loans.name: Mann

texts.en: Mrs. Mann M. Y., age 44, works selling various kinds of jewelry, making on average around $1.60 each day of profit. She started the business in 2005. Her husband is a blacksmith and makes on average around $3.30 each day. They have four children who are married. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase seeds to grow beans and yams to sell and generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to grow beans and yams to sell and generate more income.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Señora Rosa belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" (Brave Women), which is located at 296 Jr. Lima N°in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 59-years-old, has 6 children, is married, and her husband is a merchant.

Currently, the grocery store that she owns has grown more. Now she sells more products than before with the support of her children, who take turns attending to the store. At night, she sells regional food outside her home.

With this loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc., and supplies to prepare the food that she sells.

Rosa has a very noble character and is very kind. This is why her grocery store is very frequented and loved by her neighbors. She tells us that it's always nice to have a smile for someone. She is also very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all of the support offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Rosa pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Lima N° 296, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 59 años, 6 hijos, es casada y su esposo es comerciante.

En la actualidad la bodega que posee ha crecido más, ahora vende mas productos que antes con el apoyo de sus hijos, los cuales se turnan para la atención y en las noches vende comida regional en la vereda de su casa.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, etc., y víveres para la venta de sus comidas.

Rosa tiene una carácter muy noble y es muy bondadosa, es por eso que su bodega es muy concurrida y es muy querida por sus vecinos, siempre es bueno tener una sonrisa para alguien, nos dice ella, además está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindado.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc.) and supplies to prepare food

loans.name: Djurabek

texts.ru:
Djurabek K. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 41 years old, is married and has 6 children. He has a degree in teaching. He works in a High School in Yavan. His salary is however too small to provide for his family and he is forced to have a business on the side. He is a very optimistic person and supplements his measly salary by raising cattle. The profit from this business provides the necessary additional income that allows him to provide for his family. Currently the prices of animals have gone slightly down and it would be beneficial to his business to purchase calves now. This will allow Djurabek to increase turnover, get more profit from the business and take better care of his family. The business also contributes to the development of cattle raising in the region. This is why the client has come to Kiva for a loan. He plans to repay the loan within a 9 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Карохонов Джурабек проживает в городе Яван . Клиенту 41 год , он женат и имеет 6 детей.Образования высшее , по специальности Педагог. Работает в средней шуколе города Яван. Зарплаты на жизнь не хватает , поэтому приходится подрабатывать. Не смотря на это Джурабек не унывает. он очень веселый человек. Джурабек имеетхозяйство, в котором разводит бычков. После того как они подрастут , клиент выводит их на базар и продает. Этот бизнес приносит доход , который помогает ему обеспечивать семью.В данный момент цены на животных немного упали. Поэтому ему необходимо купить бычков пока цены не выросли. Это поможет уаеличить поголовье скота . Кроме того это поможет зарабатывать немного больше , что даст возможность прокормить свою семью. А еще занятие животноводством отдельно позволит развитию животноводческого сектора в целом. Для этого клиент должен получить дополнительное финансирование путем кредитования. А погасит кредит клиент в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Castorina's Group

texts.es:
This group was formed thanks to Castorina A. Estigarribia de Irala who is a craftsperson and a Nanduti teacher. Nanduti is a native Paraguayan lace making technique. In the guarani language it means spider web and it is embroidered on fabric in different patterns.

Castorina found out about “Fundacion Paraguaya” through a friend who told her about the group of entrepreneurial women which Fundacion sponsors for microentrepreneurial women who need help developing their businesses.

Castorina gathered a group of neighborhood women and friends to form her group after meeting for an informational meeting with one of the loan officers. The group was formed and they now work and obtain loans as a group.

The women that make up this group have different businesses such as the sale of groceries, cakes, sweet dough, crafts, kitchen supplies and the sale of clothing. This group is made up of 16 women who besides working to generate the majority of their family income are also dedicated mothers and wives.

These women also work and have businesses with the end goal of improving their neighborhood of Valle Apua de Lambare.

The loan that these women request will be invested in the purchase of ingredients used to make their food such as: meats, eggs, oil, flour, salt, vegetables, dough for empanadas, tapioca, bread, chickens, pastas, rice, etc. The women who sell clothes would like to purchase: jeans, shorts, pants, shirts, t-shirts, sports shoes and lingerie.

The women who sell cakes and sweet dough would purchase ingredients such as sugar, flour, lard, eggs, milk, “dulce de leche”, coconut, honey, etc.; and the craftspeople who make Nanduti would invest their loan in the purchase of thread in different colors, frames, fabrics and the maintenance of their sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Este Comité se formo gracias a la señora Castorina A. Estigarribia de Irala, quien es artesana y profesora de Ñandutí. El ñandutí es un tejido típico del Paraguay que en guaraní significa tela de araña y se borda con agujas sobre las telas y posee diferentes motivos.

Castorina conoció la Fundación Paraguaya através de una amiga quien le comento del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras que desarrolla la Fundación para mujeres microempresarias que necesitan de un apoyo para desarrollar sus actividades.

Castorina juntó un grupo de mujeres vecinas y amigas del barrio para formar su grupo y luego de una reunión informativa que realizaron con unos de los oficiales de crédito se formo el grupo que hoy día trabajan y retiran sus créditos de forma solidaria.

Las mujeres que comprenden este grupo poseen distintos tipos de actividades como venta de comestibles, tortas y masas dulces, artesanías, despensas, comedores y venta de ropas. Está formado por 16 mujeres en total que además de trabajar para generar un mayor ingreso a sus familias también son madres y esposas dedicadas.

Estas mujeres también trabajan y realizan actividades con el fin de realizar mejoras en su barrio llamado Valle Apuá de Lambaré.

El crédito que solicitan desean invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar sus comidas como: carnes, huevos, aceite, harina, sal, verduras, discos para empandas, mandioca, pan, pollos, fideos, arroz, etc. Las que se dedican a la venta de Ropas desean adquirir: jeans, bermudas, pantalones, camisas, remeras, calzados deportivos, lencerías, entre otros.

Las señoras que se dedican a la venta de tortas y masas dulces adquirirán ingredientes como harina, azúcar, manteca, huevos, leche, dulce de leche, coco, miel negra etc; y las artesanas del Ñandutí invertir su crédito en la compra de hilos de distintos colores, bastidores, telas, además en el mantenimiento de sus máquinas de coser.

loans.use: Purchase of meats, eggs, oil, flour, salt, vegetables, tapioca, bread, chickens, pastas, rices, sugar, lar, milk, sweets, honey, cheese, thread, frames, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 25 year-old Mary M.. She is married and has two children aged 2 and 5. In 2005, Mary established her seamstress business. Working six days a week, and 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about US $170 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband and two employees.

Mary requires a loan in order to purchase additional fabric and other sewing materials, with which she will sew a new range of skirts, suits and school uniforms. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $90. In the future, Mary plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Mary would like to purchase additional stocks of fabric and sewing accessories in bulk for her seamstress business.

loans.name: Abra Amétowoyo

texts.fr:
Miss Abra Amétowoyo E. was born on 8 August 1972 in Kpélé in the Prefecture of Kloto. She is unmarried with two children. She is a retailer of mineral water and rechargeable phone cards in the Wuiti district in Lomé.

With this loan she is asking for (her first), she would like to buy 2 small boxes of rechargeable phone cards and 30 packets of mineral water.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mademoiselle E. Abra Amétowoyo est née le 08 août 1972 à Kpélé dans la préfecture de Kloto. Elle est célibataire avec deux enfants. Elle est revendeuse d’eau minérale et de cartes de recharge dans le quartier Wuiti à Lomé.

Avec ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle désire acheter 2 petits cartons de cartes de recharge et 30 sachets d’eau minérale.

loans.use: To buy rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Ma Esther is a widow whose husband died about five years ago. They were blessed with six children, two of whom are still below the age of fifteen. She has suffered from poverty throughout her life: she had to drop out after primary school because her parents could not afford school fees; and after her husband’s death she has struggled to maintain six children single-handedly. She regrets that she has not been able to allow all her children to study freely and that they have had worries about food and money, as she did in her youth. 

In 2002, Ma Esther was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by other members. Since then, she has successfully borrowed and repaid loans four times, allowing her to expand her crop farm. The profit from her farming has helped her to pay school fees for her younger children and to provide some basic needs like food for the family.

Given this loan, she plans to buy corn and bean seedlings, and pay for labor to clear her farm. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has acquired some basic training on finance management and agriculture from GHAPE, which has added to her lifetime of farming experience. She plans to repay her loan in 24 months. The first installment of the repayment shall be done on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of corn seeds, beans, clearing, and labor

loans.name: Lucia Virgenia

texts.es:
Lucia is a member of the Communal Bank of Well-being.

Lucia is 42-years-old and married, with 4 children. Lucia lives in the slums of Yanamilla that are close to the city's penitentiary. Lucia operates a grocery store and also a small bar every day of the week, from 5 in the morning until very late at night, depending upon client demand. She receives assistance from her children.

Lucia needs a loan of 1,050 soles to be invested in the puchase of rice, sugar, pasta and beer.

Lucia dreams of developing a larger space to expand her store, and of helping her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.

Lucia es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Lucia vive en el asentamiento humano de Yanamilla que se encuentra cerca al penal de la ciudad, Lucia tiene una tienda surtido de abarrotes y además tiene una pequeño bar, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana desde las 5 de la mañana hasta muy de noche dependiendo del consumo de sus clientes, Lucia cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos.

Lucia necesita un préstamo de 1050 dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, cerveza.

Los sueños de Lucia son construir un ambiente mas grande para ampliar su tienda, apoyar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, pasta and beer.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba A. is a 34-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two kids. Currently both children attend school. Abiba says combining motherhood and business demands is very challenging. However, the two must be attended to simultaneously.

Abiba has sold bags of maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. for ten years now. She is able to support her household well through this business. She needs the loan to enable her to purchase more stocks of cereals to scale up her sales. She hopes the loan will enable her to double her savings to provide quality education for her kids. Abiba belongs to a group called "Ntoboase" meaning Be Patience Trust Group. The group members assist one another to repay their loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is the wife of M. N. and lives in a small area named Bund Road of City Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 2 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her son is not yet school-going age. Her elder daughter is in the 6th standard. Her younger daughter is in the 3rd standard. 

Zubaida baji's husband has a barber salon in his community. He is a well-known barber in the community. He learned this skill from his father. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Zubaida baji herself has been running a beauty parlor for the last 10 years but she is a responsible mother. She pays attention on her children and teaches and guides them in their education. Zubaida baji is applying for a loan to buy materials (cosmetics, hair dryer) to  expand her parlor.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Zareena baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rani baji wants a loan to buy material (wood, tools) for her furniture-making business. Rashida baji wants a loan to buy more fruits to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Tessy

texts.en:
Tessy O. has a shop where she sells pepper soup and drinks. She loves this business because her customers pay cash when they come in to her shop. Ever since she began this business, her desire has been to increase her sales. She is now requesting a loan of N100,000 so she can purchase more pepper soup ingredients and drinks.

Tessy is 40 years old. She is married and she has four children.

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pepper soup ingredients and drinks to sell

loans.name: Makhfira

texts.en:
D. Makhfira is 47 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 5 children. Makhfira owns a successful clothing and shoe sales business at the market of Penjikent, Tajikistan. She has been doing this business for about 8 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Makhfira tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. A normal monthly income from her business is around 1500 Somoni.

Makhfira has requested a loan of 3500 Somoni with the term of 8 months to increase her product inventory. This is a busy time for many market vendors as the cold season is coming and everyone is preparing for winter. By purchasing additional inventory, Makhfira will be better prepared to meet the increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her persistent work and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en: Ulata U., 30, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the pancakes, noodles, taro, and banana business. She sells to the village people and the public, and school children 5 days per week. She is a new member and this is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 50 Tala.  SPBD loans are Ulata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: expand her plantation and her canteen

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Mrs. Noun C. is a villager in Ang Kunh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. C. Loas, is a construction worker. Even though they have two careers, they still earn too little income to support the family. Therefore, Mrs. C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. She is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Arabsho

texts.ru: Арабшо Салимов проживаетв городе Куляб, в Восейском районе.Женат и имеет двоих детей. Возраст 30 лет.Работает в средней школе  района. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Скупает мелкий рогатый скот , а после откормки перепродпет. Планирует получить крелдит для того, чтобы уувеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Arabsho S. lives in the town of Kulyab of Vosey region. He is 30 years old and is married with two children. He works in the region's secondary school and is involved in animal sales. He buys and sells bull calves. He plans to get a loan in order to increase the number of livestock. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan sells provisions and foodstuffs. He is also a commercial motor cyclist. He is thirty-eight years old and married with five children. He needs a loan of $675 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Djalil

texts.en:
R. Djalil is married and has two children who he is very proud of, since they are fighting to get ahead. With the faith that his children will go to college someday, he started a business 4 years ago, processing and selling dried apricot in order to make enough money to pay for their schooling. He is experienced in this kind of business, which allows him to expand his clientele day by day. Right now, Djalil is requesting $800 USD for purchasing more dried apricot to process and to sell. With your help, Djalil will be able to feel proud that, through much effort, his children can go to college and become educated people.

Tajikistan Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried apricot in order to expand his business

loans.name: Pele

texts.en:
Pele P., 60, is married with four children. She has three years of experience in the bingo business. She sells to the general public two days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (about $291). SPBD loans are Pele’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy goods for the bingo prizes.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice, sugar, flour, salt, soaps, detergents and a box of noodles for bingo prizes

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year old Benedicta M. from Mwanza.  She is married with six children between the ages of 13 and 21 years old. Benedicta has operated a beauty salon since 1996. She sells long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, etc., that can woven or braided into a person's own hair, then cut and styled to look natural. She works 12 hours a day, 7 days a week, and is assisted by one employee. Benedicta is requesting a loan for $400 in order to purchase long hair and a drier. In the future, she plans to open a second business. Benedicta thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hair and equipment for a Beauty Salon

loans.name: Falilatou

texts.fr: K. Falilatou est née vers 1954 à Adjohoun dans la vallée de l'Ouémé. Falilatou est mariée à KOUTCHIKO Bouraïma, un gardien de profession. Falilatou est mère de quatre enfants dont deux seulement sont encore à sa charge. Falilatou vend des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, gombo, huile de palme et huile d'arachide, les légumes, oignons, piments, épices, sel, cubes) et les produits vivriers( maïs, mil, sorgho, haricot, farines de manioc)à PK10-Vivoten à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Falilatou a besoin de moyens financiers pour développer son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Falilatou sollicite auprès de ALIDé un prêt.
texts.en:
K. Falilatou was born around 1954 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé valley. She is married to KOUTCHIKO Bouraïma, a guard by profession. She is the mother of four children, of whom only two are still in her care. Falilatou sells sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, okra, salt, cubes) and staple foods (corn, millet, sorghum, beans, cassava flour) at PK10-Vivoten in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has need of funds to develop her business, so as to do better in satisfying her customers. For this reason, she's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five baskets of fresh tomatoes, a 50-kg sack of onions, some spices, two 50-kg  sacks of corn, and a 50-kg sack of cassava flour

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen D. sells a variety of foods and cellophane. She is married with three children and she is forty-three years old. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more food to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel M. es una persona humilde que atiende un pequeño negocio de venta de comida, su especialidad es la atencion con el Silpancho que es un apanado de carne con papa, ensalada, arroz, y huevo frito, el solamente trabaja con Emprender, ademas el esta ampliando el negocio y proximamente atendera almuerzo, tiene una cocinera y el atiende personalmente su pequeño negocio, el cual esta abierto en horario de medio día y por la noche lo que le da tiempo para estudiar, el quiere ser profesor.
texts.en:
Samuel M. is a humble person who has a small business making and selling food. His specialty is silpancho, which is breaded meat served with potatoes, salad, rice, and a fried egg. He only works with Emprender. He is also expanding his business and will soon serve lunch. He has a cook and he attends to his small business personally. It is open from noon until nighttime, which gives him time to study because he wants to be a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will invest in the construction of a bathroom for his business and will buy a sink and a toilet.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 52 years old and married with seven children. She sells beef. She hopes for the loan of N150,000 to purchase more beef to sell. She says thank you to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Chanra

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanra L., age 29, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Um, age 34 have been married since 1998 and have two children, one son and one daughter. The children are still young and attend school. The famiL. lives along national road number one about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanra has been a tailor for nearL. 10 years. Her husband is a driver. He drives for a company. Chanra is applying for her first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase 3 more sewing machines for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase 3 more sewing machines for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is fifty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all in school. She works very hard to support her husband and to provide for her family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Esther is a trader. She trades in all kinds of cosmetics. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. Esther procures her goods from Accra. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Juan Victor

texts.es: Juan Victor está casado, tiene tres hijos y junto a su esposa viven en una casa que es propia.                                             Juan Victor se dedica al transporte de pasajeros cuenta con dos vehículos propios, la esposa tiene su puesto de venta de abarrotes, verduras y otros en pleno mercado de la comunidad donde viven con más de tres años de experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será como capital de trabajo para incrementar los  productos a comercializar en el puesto de la esposa. Él es un excelente cliente de la institución, cumple a cabalidad con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Juan Victor is married, has three children and with his wife they live in their own home. Juan Victor works transporting passengers, and he owns two vehicles. His wife has a grocery booth of vegetables and other items in the central market of the community where they live and she has more than 3 years of experience in the field. The loan will be used as work capital to increase the products sold in his wife’s booth. He is an excellent client of the institution (Kiva’s field partner) as he has fulfilled his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work Capital.

loans.name: Tolokeze

texts.en:
Tolokeze J., currently in the business of selling green vegetables, is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. Twenty-eight years old and married to a policeman, Tolokeze has two children, both students. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop and buy a motor boat for fishing.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Nancy Helida

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Nancy es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Nancy tiene una tienda Multiservicios en un local alquilado que se encuentra en el centro D. L. ciudad, en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, artículos D. librería, fotocopias.
Nancy necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. papeles, arroz, azúcar.
Nancy sueña con ampliar su negocio, tener otra tienda y brindarles una buena educación.

loans.use: Para la compra de papeles, arroz, azúcar.

loans.name: Mayra Santana

texts.es: La señora Mayra Santana de 46 años de edad, es una mujer de recurso muy humilde, procreo dos hijos de 15 y 19 años de edad, el de 19 años trabaja para ayudar con los gastos lo cual dejo sus estudios debido a la economía de sus padres ya que su papa trabaja como guarda de seguridad y su salario es bajo, doña Mayra trabaja en servicio domestico trabajo cansado por que tiene que lavar y planchar mucha ropa aparte de los otros oficios que tiene que hacer  tiene cuatro años de trabajar sin tener vacaciones, su objetivo es poder terminar de hacer su casa toda de concreto ya que parte es de tabla por fuera y por dentro en las divisiones lo cual espera poder hacer en tiempos futuro toda de concreto. Vive en un barrio marginal en la capital de Managua, lo cual espera con este préstamo comprara una paca para poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa el cual se vende por ser bonita, barata y buena, ya que por su edad se cansa mucho y desea ganar sus propios ingresos junto a su familia. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de poder salir adelante el cual espera a futuro crecer en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mayra Santana is 46 years old, of vary limited means. She has two children, 15 and 19 years old. The 19-year old works to help with family expenses and, as a result, has had to abandon his studies because he needs to help contribute to family income since his father, who is employed as a security guard, earns a very small salary. Mayra works as a domestic, which is exhausting work since she has to wash and iron great quantities of clothes besides all the other chores which she must complete. She has had this job for 4 years, never time off for vacation. Her goal is to be able to complete her house with concrete since part of the outside and the interior walls are still made of lumber and she would like everything to be concrete. She lives in a poor neighborhood of Managua and hopes to use this loan to buy bundles of clothing and set up her own business selling it since it will be pretty, inexpensive and good. Because of her age, her present work is very tireing and she would like to earn her own income with her family. She thanks Afodenic for the opportunity to get ahead and she hopes in future to see her sales grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion C. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Visitacion is married and has one grown child. Visitacion owns and operates a business making and selling specialty food products to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Visitacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Visitacion is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Rosa Ivania

texts.es: La señora Rosa L. mujer que se dedica ala venta de ropa, cosméticos trabaja con catálogos de la Avon, ropa variada para dama, caballeros, niños mucho de ello por encargo. Lleva siete años en este negocio que lo inicio con dinero que su esposo dio, comenzó trabajando con poquito pero luego con préstamo el cual compro mas lo que le ha generado mejores ganancias lo que espera en un futuro tener una tienda con muchas variedades de productos en su propia casa. Tiene 40 años de edad, vive en Laureles Norte, su esposo trabaja como conductor y con dos hermosos hijos mayores. Con este financiamiento  comprara pantalones de hombres y mujeres, vestidos, faldas, camisa también perfúmenes, cremas, pinturas, y muchos más para mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa L. is a woman who makes a living by selling clothing and cosmetics. She works with Avon catalogs and sells various clothing for women, men, and children, much of which she does by taking orders. She has had this business for 7 years and started it with money that her husband gave her. She started working with little but later on she bought more through a loan, which has generated better profits for her. What she hopes for in the future is to have a store with a lot of variety of products in her own home. She is 40 and lives in Laureles Norte. Her husband works as a driver, and they have 2 beautiful older children. With this financing, she will buy men's and women's pants, dresses, skirts, shirts, perfumes, creams, makeup, and much more to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing like pants, dresses, skirts, perfume, creams, and other products

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene 65 años, vive junto a su esposa, su hija y su nieta en su casa propia.
Él se dedica a la venta de pan. Su rutina diaria es levantarse muy temprano (4 de la mañana) para acudir a una panadería que se encuentra a dos horas de su casa y es donde se abastece de este producto. Una vez con los panes, los lleva a vender por las distintas zonas de su localidad en su triciclo, el cual es su herramienta de trabajo desde hace 10 años. 
Lo que le gusta a Eusebio de esta labor es dar una buena atención a sus clientes, quienes diariamente esperan “al panadero” nos menciona. Además, le es muy rentable porque ya tiene muchos clientes estables, a quienes no tiene que estar ofreciendo los panes, sino que sólo se encarga de entregarlos en sus domicilios.

Con MFP ya tiene 7 préstamos y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas muy organizadas y sobre todo, responsables con sus pagos. 300 soles de lo que ahora serán destinados a la compra de panes para seguir activo en su negocio, y con lo restante comprará bebidas gaseosas para implementar un pequeño espacio en su casa para la venta de éstas.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 65 years old. He lives with his wife, his daughter and his granddaughter in the house he owns. He sells bread. His daily routine is to get up very early (4 in the morning) to get to a bakery that’s two hours away from his home and where he can buy his items. Once he gets the bread, he sells it on different areas of his town in his tricycle, which has been his work tool for 10 years. What Eusebio enjoys the most about this job is to provide a good service to his customers, who wait for the “baker” every day. This business is also very profitable because he has several regular customers, so he doesn’t have to offer his products, but to deliver them at their door. This is his 7th loan with MFP and what he likes the most about this community bank is that his partners are very organized and, above all, very responsible with their payments. He will use 300 soles to buy more bread and keep his business afloat. The rest will be used to buy soft drinks to open a small sales shop at home.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bread and invest in a new business

loans.name: June Rey

texts.en:
June Rey B. is from the village of Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 20 years-old and umarried. TJune Rey owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling canned goods and candies, shampo and, toothpaste in the local community. June Rey has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, June Rey joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. June Rey is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Lung

texts.en:
Lung S., 46, is a widow and lives with her two children in Siem Reap, Cambodia. S. sells desserts at a local market in the province and she is able to earn US $8.50 per day to help cover the family's expenses. She has been in this business since 2000. Her daughter also runs a dessert stand at the market earning US $7 per day to help support the family as well. 

S. and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. S. is requesting a loan of US $800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase rice from the local farmers in her village to stock for resale in the most profitable season. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy rice to stock for sale

loans.name: Oscar René

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce en León, el señor Oscar F. se ha destacado por tener su propio negocio de servicio de molino el que es atendido por el mismo y brinda el servicio de molino para moler maíz, carne, cacao, entre otros ofreciéndolo a los pobladores del caserío de San Ramón y San José que es cerca donde él vive.

Está solicitando un crédito para dar mantenimiento a las maquinas de moler y así continuar brindando un excelente servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the El Sauce region in León, Mr. Oscar F. has stood out by having his own business by working as a miller, and he provides a miller's services to grind corn, meat, and cocoa, among other things, and offers these services to the neighboring people in the villages of San Ramón and San José, which are close to where he lives. He is asking for a loan to perform maintenance on his grinding mills to be able to continue providing excellent service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenence for mills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 15 bags of roselle hibiscus leaves and 10 bags of maize

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 33-year-old married man with one child who is still attending school. He has been working in painting for the past 10 years. He took out his first loan and he has repaid it successfully. He's very thankful for his first loan and he has chosen to take out a new loan of US$ 1,200 to buy more tools and painting supplies to improve his business that was ameliorated automatically. He's expecting to make more profit and he's very happy with the results that also had an effect on his family's situation.

loans.use: buy more tools and painting supplies

loans.name: Shomurod

texts.ru: Пармонов Шомурод проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи. В этой области уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Shomurod P. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 46 years old, married and has 6 children. His wife is a homemaker. He has a secondary education and is involved in agriculture. Shomurod primarily grows vegetables. He has been in this business for 10 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Batnasan

texts.en: Batnasan is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three children in UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in an apartment, which they own. In addition to their apartment, they own a plot of land with a house. Currently, Batnasan operates a transportation business in his town. He transports his customers to and from many different areas. Batnasan has been operating his business since 2000 and he started his business with one car. His business has grown quickly over the years and he purchased another car in 2005. Batnasan has expanded his business and become a very experienced driver. His earnings have enabled him to buy the apartment for his family and his family's quality of life is good. For the future, Batnasan plans to buy a microbus and further expand his business.  He is requesting a 3,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase this microbus for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a microbus

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is widowed with one child. She rents space in a department store and sells women's clothing. Svetlana has been in this business for 11 years. She inherited it from her parents. At that time, the business was located in the market. Svetlana was able to move the business into a store where she has better work conditions and more clients.

Svetlana would like to borrow 10,000 hryvnia to increase her assortment. She hopes to make additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase assortment

loans.name: Srey Voch's Group

texts.en: Four people make up a village bank loan and they live in Mitakpheap village in Kandal province. Mrs. Srey Voch K. is the group leader, selected by all the members who will each use their loan to improve their businesses in the future. She is a seamstress in a garment factory and her husband, Mr. Savat Thorn, is a policeman. She has a problem because her work place is a long way from her home. So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Srey Voch K. is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike as transportation. She is a mother of three children who are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Carinsan

texts.en:
Carinsan C. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 30 years old. Carinsan is separated from her spouse and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Carinsan owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Carinsan has been engaged in her business for more than 4 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Carinsan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carinsan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabric and materials. Carinsan is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um O., 46, is widowed and lives with her mother and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She grows mushrooms and raises chickens at home for an income of USD 3.30 per day. One of her children is employed at a local garment factory and earns USD 1 per day.  O. is requesting a loan of USD 350 to grow more mushrooms for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan frO. CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to grow more mushrooms for resale

loans.name: Matias

texts.en:
Matias H., from the village of Tumpagon Cagayan de Oro City, is 35 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Matias owns and operates a business venture selling specialty food products such as chicken and pork al a carte in the local community. Engaged in his business for over a year, he earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Matias joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, he is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP for the same purpose. Matias plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Digna Mercedes

texts.es:
Digna de 36 años,  vive en Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución) tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte que readecuo de su casa. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propia tienda, comprando arroz, azúcar y  legumbres para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos estudiantiles de sus dos hijas.  Su esposo le ayuda atender la tienda después de trabajar, para poder surtir su tienda necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, enlatados, legumbres. 

En el futuro quiere surtir mas su tienda para tener mas ganancias y así poder ayudar al crecimiento intelectual de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Digna, 36, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a suburban area with dirt roads and eroding hills). She has a grocery shop in an area she fixed up in her home. Little by little, with effort, she has been able to have her own shop by buying rice, sugar and beans. She helps her husband with their daughter's educational expenses and he helps her at the store after work. To stock the store, she needs a loan to buy rice and canned vegetables. In the future she wants to restock her store to have more income to be able to help their children's intellectual growth.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, beans, canned goods

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr: Née en 1972, D. Reine est mariée à un polygame et a deux enfants à charge. Aucun enfant n'est scolarisé. Reine vit depuis neuf ans environs au quartier Ménontin à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec son mari et les deux enfants à charge. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Reine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de cinq ans que Reine mène comme activité la restauration. Reine prépare et vend en effet de la nourriture (riz, haricot, pâte de maïs, accompagné de condiments de sauce) et aussi des boissons à Agla à Cotonou. Reine achète ses produits vivriers à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et s'approvisionne en boissons dans les dépôts de Cotonou. Reine a déjà bénéficié de quatre prêts à ALIDé et les a tous bien remboursés. Reine désire élever davantage le niveau de son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Reine sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1972, Reine D. is married to a polygamous husband and has two children under her care. None of her children attend school. Reine has been living for the past nine years in the Ménontin borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, with her husband and the two children. The couple shares responsibility for family expenses. Reine has not attended school. For the past five years she has been active in the food preparation business. She prepares and sells food (rice, beans, corn paste, accompanied by sauce condiments) and also beverages, in the Agla area of Cotonou. Reine gets her food products from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and gets her beverages from depots in Cotonou. Reine has already received four loans from ALIDé and has fully repaid all of them. She wants to increase her activity level and improve customer satisfaction, which is why she is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sauce condiments, rice, beans, corn and beverages

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
Elvera A. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 55 years old. Elvera is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Elvera owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elvera has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvera joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvera has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elvera is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Elvera from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Vusal

texts.ru:
Vusal I. 30 let. On ne jenat i jivet vneste s roditelyami i pomoqayet im. Vusal jivet v Fuzuli regione. Vusal ranshe zanimalsya sportom no potom poluchil  travmu i poetomu brosil sport i teper on nachal rabotat. 

Vusal uje 4 qoda imeyet etot maqazin i prodayot produkti pisheqoqo upotrebleniya. Vusal etomu biznesu nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas Vusal Nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji osobenno moyushiye sredstva.
texts.en:
Vusal I. is 30 years old. He is not married, lives with his parents and helps them. Vusal lives in the Fuzuli region. He was previously involved in sports, but stopped training due to an injury and started to work. Vusal has had this store for 4 years. He sells food products there. Vusal learned this business from his father. Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy products for resale, particularly cleaning agents.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for resale

loans.name: Kakompe Ole

texts.en:
Kakompe has been practicing livestock farming in Naivasha town for 23 years. He is 58 years old and married to Kimita M.. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy young animals, which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

Kakompe hopes that the income from livestock farming will be able to educate all his children.

loans.use: To buy young animals which he will rear and sell later

loans.name: Senderos De Paz Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Senderos de Paz está integrado por cinco socias, las cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas en la Aldea El Carbonal, Silca, Olancho. La coordinadora del grupo es la sra. Prisca Beatriz C.. Ella tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la Aldea El Carbonal en el municipio de Silca, Olancho. Prisca inició vendiendo unos cuantos productos de abarrotería y se dio cuenta de que las ganancias eran muy buenas así que decidió instalar una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación que atiende ella misma desde las 6:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar azúcar, arroz, refrescos, manteca, carnes, pollo, embutidos, pan, etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo tendrá más y mejor surtido su negocio y sus clientes podrán encontrar todo lo que necesitan para preparar sus alimentos.  La sra. Prisca actualmente no enfrenta ningún problema de salud pero en algunas temporadas las ventas bajan y sus ganancias también.  Su meta es que las ventas en su negocio se mantengan estables para poder llevar el sustento a su familia. Ella tiene dieciséis ciclos en FAMA y está muy agradecida con el apoyo que ha recibido.
texts.en:
The “Senderos de Paz” (Peaceful Pathways) is comprised of five members. The have different economic activities in the village of El Carbonal in Silca, Olancho.

Prisca Beatriz C. is the coordinator of the group.  She is 46 years old, married, and has six children.  She lives with her family in the El Carbonal village in the municipality of Silca, Olancho.  Prisca started selling some grocery products, and she realized that the earnings were very good.  That is how she decided to establish a small grocery store in her house.  She tends the store herself from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.

She is requesting the loan to buy sugar, rice, soft drinks, shortening, meat, chicken, sausages, and bread, etc.  With help from the loan she will have a business that is better stocked.  Her customers will be able to find everything they need to prepare their food.

Prisca does not currently have any health problems.  There are periods of time when sales are low, but there are also times when her earnings are good.  Her goal is for the sales in her business to remain stable in order to be able to support her family.  She has been with FAMA for 16 cycles, and she is very grateful for the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy general groceries

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from the village of Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she is a boat operator and is also involved in hog fattening in her local community. Jocelyn has been in this business for about seven years and earns approximately $70 a month for this activity. 

In August 2003, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This will be her 10th loan from PMPC and will be used as additional capital for her business. The profits generated will be used to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her livestock business

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou Koné  est un homme marié de 38 ans, polygame et  père de quatre enfants vivant à Kèlèkèlè l’un des villages de la Sous-préfecture de Tousséguéla dans la grande famille traditionnelle, Préfecture de Kolondièba  dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du  Mali. 
Pour mieux alléger sa pauvreté, Monsieur Koné adhéra au programme  crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son quatre cycle.
Avec ce prêt, il compte avoir 400  kilogrammes de grains d’arachide, 1000  kilogrammes de mil et 2000 kilogrammes de maïs qu’il stockera pour revendre en une période où le cours sera plus élevé.
 Il s’approvisionne au marché de Kolondièba les jours de foire et revend à Bamako à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de revendeurs. 
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  30. 000 FCFA  
En perspective il compte ouvrir un grand magasin à Kolondièba chef lieu de la préfecture enfin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui devient de plus nombreuse.
Le bénéfice servira à prendra en charge les frais scolaires,  de santé, de nourriture et le reste sera  investi dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou Koné is a 38-year-old married man who is polygamous and the father of four children.  He lives in a large traditional family in Kèlèkèlè, a village in Tousséguéla sub-prefecture, Kolondièba prefecture, in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.

To better reduce his poverty, Mr. Koné joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso loan program and is now on his fourth loan cycle.  With the new loan, he intends to obtain 400 kg of peanut seeds, 1,000 kg of millet, and 2,000 kg of corn that he will stock up for resale when prices are higher.  He gets his supplies from the Kolondièba market on the days when the fair is held.  He sells in Bamako to a customer base composed essentially of retailers. He hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA.  

Looking forward, he hopes to open a large store in Kolondièba, the prefecture seat, in order to satisfy his customers, who are becoming more numerous.  The profits will be used to cover schooling costs, health care, and food.  The rest of it will be invested in his business.

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Camen Bethy

texts.en:
Carmen, 40, shares her home with her husband in the district of Olmos in northern Peru, a primarily rural area with a number of small farmers.

Carmen runs a small general store selling a broad range of products including detergent, candy, canned food, vegetables, drinks and other general products. She would like to continue to expand her business and improve her capital. She is proud to be able to serve her community and increase their access to basic items.

The loan will be used for the purchase of additional inventory, as Carmen hopes to be able to meet client demand and improve her income. It is important to her to continue growing her business in order to better provide for her family and the community.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has 1 child who is not currently attending school. Aidah has been involved in a hotel business for 2 years. She has a clothes salon.   

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aidah hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food. In the future, Aidah hopes to own a boutique.  

Aidah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving on her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La Señora Roxana se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujer como ser blusas, vestidos y pantalones,  su tienda es muy bonita bien organizada y muy accesible al publico.  La actividad que tiene le sirve para el sustento de su familia y de sus tres hijos ya que ella es la responsable de la educación de ellos y su padre es responsable de la alimentación y vestir ella hace constantes viajes para abastecerse de mercadería ya que su actividad así lo demanda es muy trabajadora por que las veces que pude pasar por el puesto ella siempre está atendiendo personalmente, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería para estas fiestas de fin de año ya que su venta se incrementa, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Roxana sells women’s clothes like blouses, dresses and pants.  Her store is very pretty, well organized and accessible to the public.  Her work makes it possible for her to support her family and her three children since she’s responsible for their education; their father covers food and clothing. 

She makes constant trips to stock up on merchandise because her work so requires.  She is very hard working.  One can pass by her stand any number of times and one will always find her tending to customers personally.

She will use the money from the loan to buy merchandise for the end of year festivities because sales increase.  She is grateful to the institution for the support given to her.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and fix up the entire stand.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells sweet doughnuts at Abura. She is single but takes care of three children. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and educating her children. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to prepare the doughnuts to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to make doughnuts

loans.name: Moyiare

texts.en:
Moyiare S. is 33 years old. She is married and a mother of four school-going children. Moyiare is a farmer who has been farming for the last year.

Moyiare learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET-registered client. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend 40,000 KES to buy seeds and hire help for planting her land. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to hire more land for farming to increase her wheat output and use some part of the profit to develop her plot.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she can plant wheat on a larger scale. She believes she is hard working and by having the right resources at her disposal she can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to buy seeds and hire help for planting her piece of land.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
La señora Rosalba G. está muy agradecida por su gran cooperación en el anterior préstamo en cual les pudo pagar a sus hijos las colegiaturas y exámenes y así sus niños pudieron terminar ese ciclo escolar. 
Nueva mente está solicitando su cooperación para un nuevo crédito ya que tiene que pagar la colegiatura y comprar los libros de su hijo, que esta estudiando la universidad y ella desea que tenga una carrera profesional para su futura. 
Planea pagar el crédito con sus ingresos como empleada de una fabrica, ya que los gastos familiares se cubren con la pensión alimenticia que les reciben sus hijos de su papa.
texts.en:
Señora Rosalba G. is very grateful for your enormous help with her previous loan, by which she was able to pay for school fees and tests, and so her children were able to finish that school year.

Currently she is asking for your help with a new loan as she already has to pay school fees and buy books for her son, who is studying at university and she wants him to have a professional career in the future.  She plans to repay the loan with the family's income from a factory job, as the family expenses are covered by a nutrition pension that her children get from their father.

loans.use: School fees

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn P. is from the village of Sta Lucia, Quirino, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Ailyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ailyn owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ailyn has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ailyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ailyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Ailyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Reynolds Lamin's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of teachers at the KMDEC School - Gandor in Kenema city. This school was established in September 2001 by the District Educational Committee in order to help meet the Millennium Development Goal, i.e. Education For All.
 
School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise be unable to accomplish with their meager salaries. With the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, housebuilding materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayments and pays SMT on their behalf.

Reynolds Lamin V., 62 years old, is the leader of this group of teachers. Reynolds was born in Sami Fulluma. He is married to a merchant and the couple has 7 children – 4 adults, 2 attending secondary school and 1 in college. Reynolds is going to use his share of this loan to buy house building materials such as iron, corrugated zincs, cements, and iron rods.

loans.use: to buy house building materials

loans.name: Ireen Joy

texts.en:
Ireen Joy B. is from the village of Mibando, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old and married with two school-aged children. Ireen Joy runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, biscuits and beverages in the local community. Ireen Joy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ireen Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Ireen Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and expand working capital. Ireen Joy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, soft drinks, and toiletries

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 51-year-old married man, living in Beirut with his wife and 4 children. Mohamad has owned an electronics sales shop since 2005, with 25 years of experience in this domain. He sells electronic games, DVDs and records special song CDs requested by his clients. Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time, in order to buy new products to improve his business, such as updated Playstation, MP4 and DVDs. Mohamad works on staying up-to-date with every new release because all of his clients request new releases and he has to be ready for that at any time.

Mohamad's first loan was very impressive, he stated that it improved his social situation and helped in his children's education. Mohamad's prices are very special, and his customer service is unique. His clients can be anyone in the region, including tourists, since he is in a tourist area in Beirut, visited by almost all tourists visiting Lebanon. Mohamad hopes to expand his business through selling computer accessories and hardware.

loans.use: to add new products to his business, such as Playstation, MP4 and DVDs

loans.name: Creativas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maritza lives in Santo Domingo, in one of the poorest communities surrounding the main city of the Dominican Republic. Maritza and her group of 10 members are taking loans for their businesses. This group is named Creativas 1 & 2 (Creatives).

Maritza requires a loan to buy fruit and vegetables. She also wants to buy a big box of second hand clothes. She runs a fruit and vegetables stall in front of her house, and she also sells second hand cloths by walking. She has had her business for over 6 years, after a friend gave her a loan to buy vegetables, and after some months she decided to sell fruit.  After hearing from Esperanza, she saw the opportunity to start selling second hand clothes. Her most difficult challenges have been to overcome economy crisis, and low income. She is mom of 4 children.

She says that her favorite thing is to work, and she wants to attend to the church. Maritza and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, and second hand clothes.

loans.name: Mikaela Group

texts.es: El banco D. emprendimiento "MIKAELA" se encuentra en su octavo ciclo , el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco D. Emprendimiento esta representado por las siguientes socias: Presidenta la señora Susana quien es casada, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, su actividad económica es la venta D. cosméticos D. forma ambulante, su crédito esta destinado para el aumento D. su actividad económica comprando mercadería al por mayor en cosméticos, es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre piensa en su familia, por eso trabaja desD. tempranas horas, la tesorera La señora Bárbara quien tiene 3 hijos pequeñas y tiene como actividad económica la venta D. comida y su crédito esta destinado para aumento D. su capital D. trabajo comprando insumos y abarrotes para la elaboración D. sus comidas, todas las socias son personas responsables trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan adelante a su familia, están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
The enterprising bank "MIKAELA" is in its eighth loan cycle and is formed by responsible and hardworking individuals. This Enterprising Bank is represented by the following members: President Susana who is married with two small children and her job consists of selling cosmetics by foot. 
The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics wholesale. She is a very hardworking woman who is considerate of her family which is why she begins working very early in the morning. Mrs. Bárbara is treasurer, has 3 children, sells food, and her loan will be used to buy snacks and ingredients to make her meals. All of the members are responsible and hardworking people that in many situations help their families thrive. They are thankful for the help offered by the institutions.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Lucila

texts.en:
Ana Lucila is from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 48 years old. Ana Lucila is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Ana Lucila owns & operates a mini-restaurant, serving a variety of different meals to customers like afritada, caldereta, halang-halang & fish soup in the local community. Ana Lucila has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ana Lucila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ana Lucila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Ana Lucila is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Ana Lucila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora María Guadalupe es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora que desea ofrecer a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. En este momento desea colocar una losa en su casa ya que tiene la construcción detenida por falta de capital; por tal motivo solicita el apoyo en la institución para comprar el material de construcción. Aunque María comenta que actualmente vive en la casa de su marido y es donde viven sus hijos, esto no la detiene a terminar de construir su propio hogar por que este será el  fututo y patrimonio que les ofrecerá a sus tres pequeños cuando crezcan.
texts.en: María Guadalupe is a very responsible and hard-working person who would like to offer her three children a better quality of life.  Right now, she would like to lay a concrete floor in her home since building work has been paused owing to a lack of capital.  She is requesting support from our institution so that she can buy building supplies.
