Bayarmagnai buys a package of shoes for 100,000 tugrugs (~ $70 US). There are 20-25 secondhand shoes per package. She sells the secondhand shoes at different prices depending on the shoes design and quality. Bayarmagnai is requesting a 630,000 tugrug loan to expand her product line and to increase the working capital of her business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Bov

texts.en: Mr. Bov B., 70, and his wife, Mrs. Peom Rous, 60, are rice farmers. They have been farming for 31 years. With their experience, they earn approximately five dollars per day. The couple has nine children: one drives a taxi, earning $150 per month; others are married, working and have started new homes. In order to help their laborers in the farm work, Bov B. is applying for a loan of $500 from Kiva’s project partner, HKL. He will use the loan to buy a couple of water buffalo to plow his farmland. Bov B. was busy at his farming business activities when the photo taken so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a couple of water buffalo.

loans.name: 1 De Julio Group

texts.es:
Marina Máxima A. de  33 años es casada y vecina de la  ciudad de El Alto, Villa Adela  hace 6 años aproximadamente.
Marina tiene el negocio de venta de abarrotes (alimento seco) en la zona 12 de Octubre, donde tiene un lugar propio de venta. Ella vende desde hace 15 años y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor y minimizar costos.

Las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal 1 de Julio, tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de bañadores, carne, abarrotes, dulces, CDS, pollo, celulares, elaboración de calzados y atención de tienda de barrio.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.

Ellas se reúnen mensualmente en el Centro Focal Collpani.
texts.en:
Marina Máxima A. is 33 years old, married, and a resident of the city of El Alto. She has been living in the Villa Adela neighborhood for approximately six years.

Marina has a business selling groceries (dried foods) in the October 12th District where she has her own vending post. She has been in this business for 15 years and needs a loan in order to buy merchandise in bulk so that she can minimize costs.

The remaining members of the “1 de Julio” (July 1st) Communal Association have their own businesses selling products such as swimsuits, meat, groceries, candy, CDs, chicken, and mobile phones. Other members manufacture shoes and manage neighborhood stores. They all need a loan in order to acquire merchandise, supplies, or raw materials according to their businesses.

The members meet on a monthly basis at the Collpani Community Center.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita M. is a 63-year-old, hardworking wife and mother. She is not just a plain housewife, but is also a very supportive business partner to her husband, a farmer. Along with their three children, they combat poverty with not much material or financial wealth in their possession aside from a dream nursed in their hearts that fuels their physical and mental capabilities to get out from under the weight of poverty.  

Through the proceeds of a buying and selling “bangus” (milk fish, the national fish) fry (fingerlings) and farming rice, Estelita has able to graduate one of her children from college. Though two of her children did not earn college degrees, Estelita and her husband are still happy since they are enjoying the careers they chose -- one as a hired laborer and the other abroad as a domestic helper. 

Looking back to the kind of life Estelita and her family have had in the past, she could recognize a lot of improvements had happened. Partially, their house has improved and Estelita wants to fully accomplish it through the proceeds of her business. For that, she is requesting a much larger amount of loan to finance the rice-farming business managed by her husband.

loans.use: To purchase necessary farm inputs such as seedlings, fertlizers and to pay for laborers and the rental of farm equipment

loans.name: Mariane

texts.en:
Mariane P. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur.  She is 28 years old, married and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, Mariane owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  Mariane has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 16,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mariane joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Mariane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional inventory.  Mariane is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to expand her business.  She plans to use the additional revenue from the business to support the education of her child. 

--------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expanding her business.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mr. Ny M. and his wife, Mrs. Sotheary Chheng, have been married since 2006 and have two young sons. They are living across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Ny is not in the photo; his wife is pictured instead. 

Ny and his wife are teachers. Besides teaching, Ny also raises cows at home and his wife weaves silk. Unhappily, his cow died, so he is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase one more cow to raise. He also will use a part of the loan to buy silk materials for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase cows and silk materials

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: O. Madeleine est née en 1976 à Pobè, dans le département du Plateau. Mariée à HOUNGBEDJI Sosthène, un commerçant, Madeleine est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Madeleine vit avec sa famille à Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Madeleine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Madeleine vend divers produits (sucre, savons, biscuits, huile d'arachide, riz, pâtes alimentaires, lait, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Madeleine vend en détail du charbon de bois emballé dans des sachets. Madeleine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Madeleine exerce cette activité depuis sept ans et a déjà obtenu quatre crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Madeleine voudrait rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Madeleine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
Madeleine O. was born in 1976 in Pobé, in the Plateau department. She is married to Sosthene Houngbedji, an entrepreneur, and is the mother of four children, all of whom attend school. Madeline lives with her family in Djeffa, in the community of Seme-Podji in Benin. The couple takes care of the family expenses jointly. Madeleine did not attend school. In order to support her family, she sells various products (sugar, soaps, cookies, peanut oil, rice, pasta, milk etc) out of her home. In addition, she also sells charcoal retail, in small packs. Madeline stocks up in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this line of business for seven years and obtained four loans from ALIDé in the past, all duly repaid. Madeleine would like to expand her business and better satisfy the customer demand, which is why she is seeking a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various products (peanut oil, rice, pasta, milk, sugar, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn O. A. is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. Her husband works in a garage and helps in the upbringing of the children. 

Merlyn rents a house with electricity and piped water. She cites food and rent as her greatest monthly expenses. Her main aim of working with Yehu is to obtain a loan to raise her standard of living. 

For the past two years, Merlyn has sold fresh water, handbags, and donuts. Her customers are mostly women and neighbors. She sells her goods both wholesale and retail, and she works from a shop, door-to-door, and from home. Merlyn faces the major challenge of high transport costs and seasonality. 

With this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), Merlyn wants to pay a rental deposit for her shop and to renovate her water sprinkler system. She hopes to have a large wholesale business selling handbags in town someday.

loans.use: To pay a rental deposit for her shop and to renovate the water sprinkler system.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 46-year-old married man. He has two children, aged 10 and 17. He has been selling charcoal to earn a living for three years, but was previously employed.
Michael joined a group whose members guarantee each other's loans. He has therefore requested a loan of 20,000 KES to add to his stock of charcoal. Michael hopes to become the major supplier of charcoal in his local community. He describes himself as a focused man.

loans.use: To add to his stock of charcoal

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN KOSE D. URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia D. Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 54 años D. edad y La socia es casada  y tiene 2 hijos la socia es natural D. Yucay, ella se dedica a vender almuerzos en las obras locales y refrigerios. La socia  va por todas las construcciones que se estén realizando y a la hora del almuerzo ella lleva comidas para venderles a los obreros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para la realización D. sus platos.


La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y D. este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the Communal Bank “San José D. Urubamba”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

Dominga is 54 years old, married, and has two children. She is originally from Yucay. Dominga sells lunches and snacks to the local workers. She goes to all of the construction sites during the lunch hour and brings food to sell to the workers. Dominga is requesting a loan to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

Dominga says she is grateful and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Margarete

texts.en: Margarete A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, fish and onions at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell. Margarete is 20 years old and is married to a teacher. They do not yet have a child. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: to stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena C. is from the city of Labuyo, Tangub City. She is 54 years old. Lucena is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucena runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like toothpaste, shampoo, food for snacks, sardines, noodles, etc., in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Lucena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Lucena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kimya Plus Group

texts.en:
Vana B. is a chairwoman of a Community bank named “Kimya Plus”, which is composed of 10 microentrepreneurs jointly united to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Vana has been in business since 1980 with a beginning capital of $100. Today, she operates a restaurant. She is 61years old, a widow and has five children between the ages of 20 and 35. One of them goes to school. Her restaurant prospered thanks to Hope’s loans. With the profit of about $20 earned per day, she increased her working capital. Currently, Vana is happy to be part of one of MFI Hope’s groups.  She joined the group in 2007 and her business has been reinforced through the fourteen loans she received from MFI Hope DRC and repaid them properly. Her dream is to open a catering service. Her restaurant is located in the western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of the restaurant in order to reinforce the working capital.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai T. M. V. is 54 years old with three children who are married. She is an experienced farmer in growing peach trees. Her business started in the year 2000. She has very good benefits from this activity. Joining with our credit program in 2004, she has used loans very effectively in expanding her farming. Now she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Zoumana Konaté est âgé de 40 ans,  marié et père de quatre enfants. Il réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie au quartier- Koko de Fakola, une sous–préfecture de la préfecture de Kolondièba,  troisième région (Sikasso) de la République Mali. 
Pour des raisons sociales, Zoumana Konaté abandonne prématurément les études pour s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès des son grand qui faisait l’achat et la vente de poissons. Après des années d’apprentissage, Zoumana décide d‘évoluer en solo en menant la même activité que son grand père et cela  depuis maintenant  dix  ans. 
Il est très sollicité et apprécié par les ménagères et revendeurs des villages voisins.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, il adhère au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son deuxième cycle de prêt après avoir correctement remboursé le premier. 
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter, 1000 kg de poissons fumés auprès des producteurs pêcheurs au marché de Kolondièba, Bamako et quelques fois dans les campements de pêcheurs.
Il  espère réaliser un bénéfice de 125.000F CFA par mois. Le bénéfice sera investi frais de santé et dans la construction  d’une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. Zoumana Konate is 40 years old, married and the father of four children. He lives in a large traditional extended family in the Koko borough of the sub-prefecture of Fakola, part of the Kolondieba prefecture in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.

For social reasons, Zoumana Konate prematurely quit school to pursue revenue-generating activities with his grandfather, whose occupation was the retail trading of fish. After years of apprenticeship, Zoumana decided to practice on his own the same activity as his grandfather, and has been in this line of business for the past ten years. He is very much in demand and is well appreciated by housewives and retailers from neighbouring villages.

Wanting to satisfy his ever-increasing customer base, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso MFI’s credit loan program. He is beginning his second loan cycle having correctly reimbursed the first.

With this loan he intends to buy 1000 kilos of smoked fish from fishermen at the Kolondieba and Bamako markets, or sometimes at fishermen campsites.

He hopes to attain monthly earnings of 125,000 FCFA. The profits will be invested in healthcare and the construction of a new home.

loans.use: Buy smoked fish

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Flores D. Vilquechico” ubicado en el distrito D. Vilquechico, provincia D. Huancané, departamento D. Puno, tiene 63 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda y tiene 06 hijos independientes, la señora no ha estudiado en ningún centro educativo.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 01 año, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. venta D. artesanías.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo D.  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar lanas para la producción D. sus ponchos. 
	
Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital para su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Florencia is a member of the community bank "Las Flores D. Vilquechico", located in the district of Vilquechico in the province of Huancané in the department of Puno.  She is 63 years old, married, and has six grown children.  She has never gone to school.

She began working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos one year ago.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to increase the capital of her business that sells handicrafts.

She is now asking for a loan for 300 nuevos soles to purchase wool to make ponchos.

Her dream for the future is to have more money for her business.

The things she likes best about her community bank are the meetings and the punctuality.

loans.use: Purchase wool to make ponchos

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina L. is from the village of Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk food in the local community. She is also engaging in buying and selling vegetables like squash and eggplants. Gina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional vegetables to buy and sell. Gina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the second loan that Gina has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mrs. Chorn Sarem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chorn S. is a village bank president who has been selected by sixteen people who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in which it will improve their family living in Prey Ta Khab village, Takeo province.

She and her husband, Mr. Nang Toem, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support their family and she is also breeding pig and chicken.  Since her breeding is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve this purpose, Mrs. Chorn S. is applying for a loan to buy more piglets and chickens. 

She is a mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and chickens to expand breeding

loans.name: Gerbert Ernesto

texts.es:
Don Gerbert, tiene 41 años  de edad, reside en Usulután, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y crianza de cerdos, él vive con su familia, posee casa propia, tiene experiencia en el cultivo y se dedica desde hace mucho a esta actividad como fuente de ingreso para la manutención de su familia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como abono, fertilizantes y tratamientos para plagas, elementos que son muy necesarios para el proceso de la siembra, con esta ayuda y contando con todos los materiales espera realizar una buena siembra y que el desarrollo de la milpa sea adecuada para que de buena producción.
Su objetivo es como cada año realizar un buen trabajo y de este obtener lo necesario para ayudar a su familia con la alimentación que necesitan.
texts.en:
Don Gerbert is 41 years old and lives in Usulután. He lives with his family in their home, which he owns. He grows corn and raises hogs and over a long period of time he has gained experience in agricultural activities, which has become a source of income for supporting his family.
 
He is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pest control treatments, which are essential for the sowing process. With this aid and with all the necessary supplies, Don Gerbert hopes to see progress in the corn that will be sufficient for producing a good crop.
 
His goal, as in each year, is to do a good job so that he can provide for his family with the food they need.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pest control treatments

loans.name: Esperence

texts.en: Esperance is 28 years old, married with four children who are aged between four and ten. Two of her children go to school while others are still young. Her husband works with her as well. Esperance sells different items in her shop such as cooking oil, salt, soap, sweets and onions. She has been doing this business for a period of eight years. She praises her business that contributed much to satisfy her daily needs. She says that this loan will be used to add more items in her business and the profits anticipated will be used to buy livestock and a garden. She would wish to set up a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as cooking oil, salt, soap, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante Al Progreso 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of her group, 'Con Dios adelante al progreso' 1, 2 & 3 (Forward Progress with God), and her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in the rural area of San Pedro de Macoris, surrounded by sugar cane fields, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Maritza is excited to be seeking her 8th loan with Esperanza, four years after she started doing business and taking out loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She sells miscellaneous products such as cosmetics, beauty items, shoes, clothing, etc. She will use the profits to start rebuilding her house as a safer structure. Her most difficult challenge is living in her community. She likes to work and her future plan is attending church. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget S. has spent his life cultivating crops in the province of Kompong Cham. This is a skill he learned as a young man from his grandparents. Nget S. is married and has two school-aged children. His wife frequently works in the field alongside him. Nget S. will be using his loan to add to his personal savings, which, once he has enough, he plans to use in order to buy a plot of his neighbor’s farmland near his house, which is a good location for farming. He will then rent out this land to farmers for a fee. The loan will thus provide him with an additional new asset. The rest of the fund will be used to buy peanut seeds for planting.

loans.use: To apply toward his savings fun to buy a plot of farmland, and to purchase peanut seeds for planting.

loans.name: Jacques

texts.fr: Jacques Nyarugabo est consultât du ministère de santé au Rwanda, il est né en RDC (congo). Il a 40 ans et a 8 enfants entre 20 et 2 ans, enfants vont à l’école. Il un diplôme de niveau A0 en sociologie. Il est client d’ACB depuis 2008. Il besoin d’un prêt pour faire soigner son fils qui a un problème de la colonne vertébrale, amis lui aussi a connu un accident de taxi moto. Ses ambitions sont de travailler à la hâte pour rembourser le crédit, enfin il veut chercher un nouveau  emploi qui est bien rémunéré pour qui pourront satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Jacques Nyarugabo consults for the Ministry of Health in Rwanda.  He was born in the DRC (Congo).  He is 40 years old and has 8 children between the ages of 20 and 2. His children are in school.  He has a diploma at the AO level in Sociology.  He has been a client of ACB since 2008.  He needs a loan in order to care for his son who has a problem with his spinal column, a friend also had an motorcycle taxi accident.  His goal is to work diligently to pay back the loan and ultimately he wants to find another job with a good salary so he can take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: To pay his son's health expenses

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en: Gorgonia is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a fish vending businesses.  She lives in Toledo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Gorgonia is borrowing PHP 12,000 to purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gorgonia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Angin

texts.en:
Angin H. lives with her husband and four children in Shgharshik village. Angin is a part-time nurse. Angin’s husband also works in the village. Nonetheless the local low salaries do not allow the family to meet their basic needs. Keeping a cattle farm and cultivating the land helps Angin and her husband not only cover their daily expenses but also invest in their children’s education. The parents did everything possible to earn money for one of their daughter’s higher education. She became a teacher and now works in the local school.

With the help of this loan, Angin will expand their herd of cattle which should also bring additional income to her family and cover the costs of her other children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Daniel Chege

texts.en:
Daniel has practised farming in Olkalou town for the last 14 years.  He is 34 years old, married to Naomi Wanjiku, and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 17,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Daniel hopes to become a leading farmer in Olkalou town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Creciendo Para El Futuro 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Adriana is the coordinator of her group Creciendo Para el Futuro 1, 2 & 3, (Growing for the Future). She makes her home here in a simple structure and is working hard to attend the university and become professional. 

Having repaid her previous loan and grown her business, Adriana is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for around four years, cooking foods and delivering them to people. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, beans, cooking oil, meat and chairs. She will use the additional profits to save and supply some needs for her only child and home. In the near future, she wants to build her house.

She said that her most difficult challenge is to build a safe and better built house. She enjoys being with her child and working at home.

This Esperanza associate began with us because the loans are for business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, meat and chairs

loans.name: José Hugo

texts.es:
El señor José Hugo tiene ya más de 30 años trabajando con su carro de taxi, como chofer y trasporta a gente a diferentes partes en la ciudad.
Don José esta solicitando un préstamo ya que su auto necesita mantenimiento y reparaciones de piezas como son llantas y luces, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar las reparaciones que necesita. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su taxi ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para el y su esposa.
texts.en:
José Hugo has been working as a Taxi Driver for over 30 years; he drives people around different parts of the city.

José is asking for a loan because his car needs service and repair of some parts like tires and headlights and he does not have money to carry out these needed repairs.

He plans to repay the loan with part of the income he earns from his taxi since this is his source of income for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 36 years old and from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province.  She is married with six school-aged children.  Mary Jane owns and operates a specialized retail store.  Her main source of income comes from buying and selling sweet potatoes in the local community.  She also makes and sells charcoal.  Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Mary Jane joined Kiva partner Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  She successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan of 15000 PHP, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase additional sacks of sweet potataoes and wood to make charcoal.  This is her sixth loan from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI):

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of sweet potataoes and wood for charcoal

loans.name: Hamat

texts.en:
Hamat, who is pictured here, is a fisherman. His wife sells the fish that her husband catches in the local market. In addition, the couple supplements their income with a business selling recycling materials.

Hamat is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase additional fishing nets for his business. In the future, he hopes to continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Claudia Del Carmen

texts.es: Claudia Del Carmen tiene 40 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. La señora Comenzó su negocio hace 10 años, empezó vendiendo cajetas de leches en la ciudad de manera ambulante, estos productos los elaboraba su mamá y ella aprendió también a elaborarlos, cuando ya tenía clientela suficiente, introdujo productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas para piel, lápiz labiales y una variedad de productos de la línea AVON, ahora también vende ropa, y calzado, sus ventas son de contado y crédito. El financiamiento es para la compra de una gran variedad de productos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en: Claudia Del Carmen is 40 years old; she sells general merchandise. She began her business 10 years ago, selling cajeta (a dessert made of caramelized milk) in the city as a traveling salesperson. These products were made by her mother, and she also learned to make them. When she had enough customers, she introduced beauty products such as perfumes, skin creams, lipstick, and a variety of AVON products. She now also sells clothing and shoes. She sells on cash and credit. This loan is to buy a large variety of products that her customers are asking for.

loans.use: perfumes, skin creams, lipstick, and a variety of products

loans.name: Avenida Lopez Avelar Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Avenida López A., se encuentra localizado en la comunidad D. Jantetelco, está conformado por las señoras Francisca, Angela y Eustolia van a comprar con su préstamo Perfumes y cosméticos por mayoreo, la señora Preciliana va a comprar hip o clorito para fabricar cloro, la señora Carmela va a comprar pulseras, collares, esclavas, la señora Tranquilina va a comprar zapatos por mayoreo, la señora María D. los Angeles va a comprar elotes para vender esquites y chileatole, las señoras Minerva y Alberta van a comprar ropa blusas, pantalones, camisas etc. por mayoreo. La señora Angela tiene 34 años D. edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo, ellos tienen 3 hijos Lizbeth Natali D. 12 años D. edad, Anete D. 10 años D. edad ellas están estudiando la primaria y Erick D. 5 años D. edad está en preescolar, ella venD. perfumes D. dama y C. D. la marca Fraiche por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar perfumes D. dama y C. y una parte para la alimentación D. sus hijos, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años su tía la invito a vender y con el préstamo que recibió D. Kiva y fundación Realidad lo invirtió en perfumes, ella sale a vender sus productos en Jantetelco y Amayuca, su negocio es importante porque D. ahí tiene para lo que necesiten sus hijos en la escuela, ella se siente orgullosa D. su negocio  porque sale a vender sus perfumes en su tiempos libre y pueD. atender a sus hijos, las ganancias las utiliza para lo que haga falta para la comida D. sus hijos, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir porque lo va a ocupar para invertirlo en perfumes y tener varias fragancias para ofrecerles a sus clientes, sus sueños y esperanzas son ampliar su casa construir otros cuartos para que sus niños estén mas cómodos y que sus hijos salgan adelante en sus estudios. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por sus préstamos, ya que hay muchas personas necesitadas, y que nos sigan ayudando con sus préstamos”.  Jantetelco es un pueblo bonito D. clima cálido, se ven los cerros, la gente es amable, tranquila, hay campo siembran maíz, camote, cacahuate, sorgo.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Avenida López A.. It is located in the community to Jantetelco. 

Señora Angela is 34 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage with her husband and they have three children. Lizbeth Natali is 12 years old and Anete is 10 years old. They are in primary school. Erick is 5 years old and is in preschool. She sells Fraiche brand women’s and men’s perfumes through a catalog.

She requested her loan to buy women’s and men’s perfumes and a part of it will also go to feeding her children. She began her business two years ago. Her aunt invited her to do sales and with a loan she received from Kiva and Fundación Realidad she invested in perfumes. She sells her products in Jantetelco and Amayuca. Her business is important because that is how she provides for her children’s school needs. She feels proud of her business because she goes out to sell perfume in her free time and she can care for her children.

She will use the profits to do whatever it takes to feed her children. She is happy with the loan she is going to receive because she will use it to invest in perfumes and will have various fragrances to offer to her customers. Her hopes and dreams are to add on to her house, building more rooms so that her children are more comfortable, and that her children get ahead in their studies.

The group’s members also incluD. Francisca, Angela and Eustolia who are going to buy wholesale perfumes and cosmetics. Señora Precilina is going to buy sodium hypochlorite to make bleach. Señora Carmela will buy bracelets, necklaces and ID bracelets. Señora Tranquilina is going to buy shoes wholesale. Señora María D. los Angeles will buy corn on the cob to sell esquites [corn and chili pepper based snack] and chileatole [savory corn beverage]. Señora Minerva and Señora Alberta will buy wholesale clothing such as blouses, pants, shirts, etc.

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad that “we thank them for their loans as there are many needy people, and may they continue helping us with loans.” Jantetelco is a town that has a nice warm climate and a view of the mountains. The people are friendly and it is tranquil with fields of corn, sweet potato, peanuts and sorghum.

loans.use: to buy Fraiche brand women's and men's perfumes.

loans.name: Luis Beltran

texts.es:
La comunidad de Papel Pata se encuentra a unos treinta minutos de la ciudad principal de La Convención (Quillabamba). 

En esta comunidad de Papel Pata conocimos al señor Luis Beltrán y nos cuenta que nació en el departamento de Apuricma y tiene 53 años de edad, él esta casado y fruto de esta relación tiene 2 hijos. Actualmente, Luis Beltran  vive en la comunidad de Chongona a 5 minutos de Papel Pata y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas.  

Luis Beltrán es agricultor y tiene varas chacras donde cosecha café, cacao, achote y otros productos. Desde niño aprendió el oficio pues sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería. Hace 16 años que se volvió independiente y empezó a su propio negocio de la venta de cacao y café.  Luis Beltrán  en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar la jornada laboral de los peones y la otra parte es para comprar herramientas como por ejemplo palas, picos y otros. 
 
El banco comunal “Caminando Juntos” pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa (Cusco, Perú) y las reuniones de los socios son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Papel Pata del distrito de Echarate provincia de La Convención  del departamento del Cusco.
texts.en:
The community of Papel Pata lies about thirty minutes from the main city of La Convención (Quillabamba).

In this community of Papel Pata, we met with Señor Luis Beltrán.  He tells us he was born in the Department of Apuricma, and is 53 years old.  He is married and the fruits of this relationship are his two children.  Currently, Luis Beltrán lives in the community of Chongona, which is 5 minutes from Papel Pata and this is where he undertakes his work activities.

Luis Beltrán is a farmer, he has some smallholdings where he farms coffee, cocoa, achiote plants and other products.  As a child he learned the trade because his parents taught him the work of agriculture and livestock management.  16 years ago he became independent and started his own business selling cocoa and coffee.  At this moment, Luis Beltrán is requesting the loan to pay his day laborers, and the other part is to buy tools such as shovels, picks and other things.

The community bank “Caminando Juntos” ("Walking Together") belongs to the Arariwa Association (in Cusco, Peru), and the meetings of the members take place monthly in the Papel Pata community, in the district of Echarate, which is in the province of La Convención and department of Cusco.

loans.use: to pay his day laborers, and the other part is to buy tools such as shovels, picks and other things.

loans.name: Aubrey

texts.en:
Aubrey, 23 and single, has been in the transportation business for the last three years. This is his first loan from KADET and with it he plans to buy another motorcycle. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. 

His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Bẩy

texts.en:
Bẩy is a 43-year-old female living in a town in Yên Phong district - Băc Ninh province. She is married and has 5 adult children. Bẩy operates a family member's business in the food sector, making & selling rice products in the local community. Bẩy has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6.000.000 VND a month.

In 2009, Bẩy joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bẩy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8.288.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Bẩy is now requesting a new loan of 9.184.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital.  The will be her 3rd loan from SEDA. Bẩy plans to use the additional revenue generated to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Bẩy là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong district - Băc Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 5 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Bẩy Tham gia công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Bẩy thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Bẩy kiếm được khoảng 6.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, Bẩy đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Bẩy đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.184.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Bẩy dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  tiết kiệm cho những trường hợp khẩn cấp sau này.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Otis

texts.en:
Otis is a true example of an entrepreneur, starting his first janitorial business when he was only 19. Otis has always dreamed of being his own boss and has never given up on that dream. Otis started O.J.’s Janitorial & Sweeping Service, LLC in 1994. Having experienced his share of ups and downs as a business owner, Otis was still not quite prepared for the devastation to his business that Hurricane Katrina caused. He lost over 30 of his service sites, and endured the theft of one of his company vehicles. 

Steadfast in his endeavors as always, Otis is still moving forward and taking steps to reinvigorate his business. In 2009 Otis took a major step in obtaining his SBA (Small Business Administration) 8A certification to help ensure his ability to receive opportunities at government projects and subsequent contracts. 

Otis will use his Kiva funds to take on his first federal government contract, as he continues to grow as a businessman and pave the way for others to follow.

loans.use: to purchase operating equipment such as heavy duty cleaning supplies and to cover 2 months of payroll.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee, de 30 años de edad, convive con Juan de 30 años y fruto de esa relación tienen una hija llamada Karina de 04 años y juntos residen en su propia casa situada en la ciudad de Santa Rosa. Aydee, aún cuando era adolescente trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres y a la vez trabajaba como jornalera en distintas chacras. Con sus ahorros acumulados compró su propia parcela, desde entocnes trabaja sobre esas tierras durante casi 05 años y cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno en donde cultiva plantas de cacao y café. La clave de su éxito radica en la creatividad y las ganas de trabajar, sus plantas están trabajadas de manera tecnificada porque recibe capacitación de los Ingenieros Agrónomos periódicamente. Su producto con mayor demanda es el grano del café por la calidad del producto que los ofrece y fruto de ello percibe buenos réditos económicos. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, para que de esa manera avance con mayor celeridad en la extracción y selección de su producto. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola para que de esa manera pueda seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes, en efecto mejorar su condición de vida. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito le será de mucha utilidad en el progreso de su trabajo, por ello agradece una vez mas a todos ustedes por el apoyo. Con los 2,000 soles que solicita, contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en las cosecha y desmonte de maleza.
texts.en:
30-year-old Aydee lives with 30-year-old Juan and the couple have one daughter called Karina who is 4 years old.  They live together in their own home which is located in the town of Santa Rosa.

Even when she was a teenager, Aydee worked on her parents' land and also worked as a laborer on different farms.  With some savings that she had made, she bought her own plot of land and she has been working on this land for almost five years.  She has 3 hectares of land where she grows cacao and coffee.  The key to her success lies in her creativity and her desire to work.  She applies modern technology to her work with her plants because she receives periodic training from agricultural engineers.  Her most sought-after product is coffee beans because of the quality of the product that she sells.  As a result, she makes good money.  She normally works alone but at harvest times she hires laborers so that she can pick and sort her crops more quickly.  Aydee's future plan is to continue expanding her production so that she can continue satisfying her customers and improving her own living conditions.

This will be Aydee's second loan from MFP.  She knows that the loan money will be very useful to her in making progress in her work.  For this reason, she is once again very grateful to you all for your support.  Aydee will use the 2,000 soles that she has requested to hire laborers to support her in her harvest and in weeding her land.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Connie

texts.en: Connie is 39 years old, married to a farmer and lives with her husband and two children in the town of Masindi, Uganda. She and her husband earn a living by selling the output from their farm, and Connie also runs a business on the side selling clothing. She has been successful enough to allow her family to finish construction of its house. When she started this business it was very small, but she has done well and is now applying for a loan to expand it by buying more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Felecitas

texts.en:
Felecitas is married and has eight children. She is 48 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Felecitas is a farmer and grows palay (unhusked rice) to earn a living. She has been plowing, planting and harvesting rice for 28 years. The whole family is working together to facilitate farm activities. She has alternative sources of income and that allows her to earn a total of PHP 10,000 a month. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers to boost her farm's production. 

In the future, Felecitas hopes to cultivate additional farm fields to earn more income and improve the general living condition of the family..

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, condiments, and cooking oil to make tamales

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is a 51-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in her own house in Kasese,Uganda. Resty has been in the farming and poultry business for eight years. She began with a small garden of pineapples, twenty coffee trees and  ten chickens but now has two acres of land for pineapples, three hundred coffee trees and two hundred chickens. Resty's hardship is limited financial resources. Her goal is to have five acres of land, to complete her house and to educate her children. Resty needs this loan to buy coffee seedlings for planting.

loans.use: To buy coffee seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Bulala Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bulala Group in Western Kenya! Paul is the facilitator of the Bulala group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Paul takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate his children and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Paul had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Paul was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Paul and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Paul will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bulala group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is married and blessed with two children, all of whom attend school. For the past seven years, he has been operating a business selling household utensils such as cooking pans, spoons and plates. He employs one person to assist him in running the business. 

Eliud is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy cooking pans, stoves and basins for resale. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business into wholesale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more business-oriented.

loans.use: to buy cooking pans, stoves and basins

loans.name: Rhoda Njeri

texts.en: Rhoda is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 6 years. She describes herself to be ambitious and aggressive. Rhoda operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar,maize flour and  She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in maua shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge as congestion in area of operation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to pay rent and add stock of home products. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler and run more retail stores within 5 years.

loans.use: To pay for the rent and add stock of home products.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura, de 29 años convive con Juan de 28 años. Juntos habitan en una casa alquilada que junto a su pequeña hija Xiomara de 06 años, a quien le brindan mucho amor y desean darle una mejor calidad de vida. Rosaura, es una mujer que se dedica al cuidado de su pequeña en el hogar donde habitan; con la ayuda de su pareja, quien se dedica a la construcción de casas para personas que piden de su ayuda por realizar buenos acabados de viviendas. A Juan le consta que tiene que esforzarse mucho para solventar los gastos de su hogar ya que Rosaura realiza la labor de madre atendiendo a su hija. A Juan y Rosaura les consta que tienen que apoyarse del uno al otro para salir adelante. Con el crédito solicitado piensan en comprar materiales de trabajo para que Juan continúe trabajando ya que tiene que solventar los gastos de su familia. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP, esta contenta por la colaboración que se les brinda para que así puedan seguir con su trabajo. Ambos asisten a las reuniones que se presentan en su banco comunal y están contentos por trabajar con personas responsables. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrán comprar materiales de construcción como: pala, pico, carretilla, así podrá seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosaura, 29, lives with Juan, 28, in a rented house with their 6-year-old daughter, Xiomara, who they love very much and want to provide a better quality of life for.  Rosaura is a woman who is dedicated to caring for her little girl at home with help from her spouse who works building houses for people who ask him for help to achieve good finishing touches on their dwellings.  Juan is aware that he must exert quite an effort to cover household expenses since Rosaura does the job of a mother and cares for their daughter.  Juan and Rosaura both are aware that they must help each other to get ahead.

They plan to use the requested loan to buy work supplies so that Juan can continue working since he has to cover family expenses.  This will be MFP loan #1.  She is happy about the collaboration she’s getting because they will be able to continue working.  They both attend communal bank meetings and are happy to work with responsible people.  They will be able to buy tools like a shovel, a pick and a wheelbarrow with the 1500 new soles to continue working.

loans.use: to buy a shovel, a pick and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stamping machine

loans.name: Limheang's Group

texts.en:
Limheang, 42, is married and has three dependent children who are still in school. She is a farmer and she has been in this business for more than several years. With only one income source for the family, Limheang and her husband sometimes work for others to gain additional income to better support the family. 

Limheang has been with VisionFund for one year. The loan from VisionFund has significantly helped her family. Now she and another member Hie, who has been with VisionFund for only this year, are applying for a loan. Limheang wants to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her water pump to carry water into her rice farm for US$250. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow healthy rice and sell it for a good price to earn more income to better meet her family's basic needs and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy both fertilizer and gasoline for the water pump for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jlg-008-K.pettai Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. Nivedha hails from Kulithalai, Karur district in Tamil Nadu. She is a 32-year-old married woman who works as a daily wage laborer in the agricultural sector. She has four members in her family including two children.

Monthly she saves only Rs.1,250 and the monthly medical expense is around Rs.750. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Her family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family is forced to walk a kilometer just to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. The family members, especially their women & daughters are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Joining hands with Sumathi & Revathi, whose families face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, she has formed a group of three resolute members, and is hoping to address this issue. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and security for Nivedha, Sumathi & Revathi and their families. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick.

Hence, together, inspired by awareness initiatives, they seek a loan of Rs. 42,000 to construct a toilet at home. This loan amount will cover the cost of raw materials and labor required. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to construct a toilet in her home

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a responsibly married woman with three children. She came to Kampala in 1995 when situation in Northern Uganda was not good to live in due to conflicts, which escalated to date. She left the village and came to settle in the Acholi quarters.

While in the Acholi quarter, she engaged in rock quarrying where she tried to squeek out a living for a long time and things were not appealing at all! Even working condition was not good since one is always exposed to the sunshine the whole day! Not only the sun was a problem but also danger of stones falling and wounding many who are involved in the activity of this nature.

Like Moses led the people of Israel from Egypt to a promised land, so is Life in Africa. She came to learn about Life in Africa foundation from people of good heart who introduced her and eventually joined as a bracelet maker. She is doing well with bracelets and also quite sustaining but this has not solved all her problems because where Margaret lives in Acholi Quarters she is renting - in spite of the fact that she owns a piece of land given to her by the king of Buganda (he gave parcels of the entire hill where the stone quarry lies to the displaced Acholi living there).

For months she has been thinking of building at least a two-roomed house so that she could save her rent money each month. With those savings, she'd eventually like to build a permanent family house in her District, should there one day be opportunity of going back there some day.

Margaret has saved and 100,000/= and has also recently started selling beads she makes from paper at home through the LiA CAN! export coop, which has increased her monthly income to a point that she feels comfortable servicing a loan. Therefore she is seeking loan amount of 800,000/= to top up her saving so that she can take this big step of building her own home. Below is her budget:

1000 bricks @ 50 ……….......50,000/=

15 bags of cement @ 18,000.270,000/=

1 trip of sand@ 60,000/- ..60,000/=

12 iron sheets of 32 gauge @ 11,000 = 1320 00/=

20 roofing poles @ 1400...28,000/=

Labor.....................150,000/=

2doors @ 30,000 ......... 60,000/=

2 windows @ 15000/=.......30,000/=

Transport.................70,000/=

Kcc charges...............10,000/=

Water.....................10,000/=

Roofing nails 2kgs @ 5000.10,000/=

Other nails 2kgs @ 3000...6,000/

Other expenses...........14,000/=

-Total ...................900,000

loans.use: construction materials and labor

loans.name: Gusdasta

texts.en: Gusdasta is an IDP from occupied Khodjali district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. Married, has two children. She started her business in 1995, and borrowed three Normicro loans from Baku branch totalling $2200. Now she would like to borrow $600.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Am

texts.en: "I am happy to be an LAPO member," says Mrs. Am E.. She is 40 years old and happily married. She has been an LAPO client for over 5 years. She lives in Benin City. She wishes to use the loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Chab

texts.en: Chab K. is a 50 year old widow and lives with her two children in the Siem Reap province in Cambodia.  Chab K. sells porridge, pork and beef rice to the people in her area and makes about $5/day in revenue. Meanwhile, one of her children helps to support the household by selling a variety of souvenir products near a temple.  Her other child is a carpenter. Currently, Chab K. is asking for a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a stand so that her daughter can properly sell her souvenir products to tourists.  In the future, if she saves enough money, she would like to expand her daughter's business by adding more attractive products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: to purchase a stand for her daughter to sell a variety of souvenir products

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Aged 38, Mrs. Kossiwa A. is married and the mother of four children. Abandoning her studies at a very young age, she took up the business of traditional cloth that she acquired from her uncle’s wife. This business is very successful and the profit enables her to meet some of her family’s needs. Gifted with a good sense of business management, she had no trouble repaying her first loan. To increase the size of her business she is asking for a loan of $500 to enable her to buy from wholesalers at low cost. This will make her business more profitable and ensure she can send her children to school.

Agée de 38 ans, Madame A. Kossiwa est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Abandonnant ses études très tôt, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des tissus pagnes qu’elle a acquis chez la femme de son oncle. Cette activité lui réussit bien et lui procure de bénéfice afin de satisfaire certains besoins de sa famille. Douée d’une bonne gestion de ses activités elle a su rembourser son premier crédit sans difficulté. Pour agrandir la taille de son commerce elle sollicite un crédit de $500 pour pouvoir acheter chez les grossistes à bas prix afin de plus rentabiliser son commerce et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Sale of traditional cloth

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina lives with her husband and her child in the region of Al Ain, in Bekaa. She is a tailor who offers her great services to her neighbors. Her earnings are used to help cover her household expenses. Her work and her financial contribution have enhanced her self esteem and her self confidence. Amina is very proud of her work. This is the 6th time that Amina has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. Having said this, Amina has an excellent history of on-time repayment.

loans.use: To buy material and accessories for her tailoring work

loans.name: Tik

texts.en: Mrs. Tik Y., age 60, works with her husband growing rice crops and raising domestic animals. They have seven children; two who are employed at a medical company, one who is employed by a micro finance organization, one who is a teacher, one who is employed by a local organization, and two who are students. She requests a loan of $1000 to purchase more land to expand her farm. This will increase the amount of rice she can grow and sell, thereby increasing the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more land to expand her farm.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Don Eduardo is a committed and loving head of family with five children. He breeds animals to improve and succeed in the progress of his family. For a long time he has bred sheep and taken care of them, he also breeds cattle for his own use and farms, mainly potatoes, on his own land. He starts his workday very early by cleaning out the stables with his wife and later they take the animals to graze and occasionally the sheep are sheared and the wool is sold. All the children help out with this work and together with his faithful wife they are passing on this knowledge to their children. Eduardo wishes to improve the breed of his animals and offer them a more balanced nutrition and the loan requested will be invested in buying the necessary for breeding his animals in a beneficial way. Please support don Eduardo to reach his goal.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Eduardo, es un padre de familia comprometido con mejorar y lograr el desarrollo de los suyos, ese gran amor que profesa por sus cinco hijos lo mueve a seguir trabajando en la crianza de animales. Desde hace mucho tiempo cría ganado ovino y siempre está al cuidado de ellas, también se dedica a criar para consumo propio unas vacas y dedica gran parte de su tiempo al cuidado de sus campos de cultivo el que principalmente cultiva papa. Su jornada de trabajo diario consiste en levantarse muy temprano para limpiar su establo con la ayuda de su querida esposa luego llevan sus animalitos por el campo a pastarlas y cada cierto tiempo sus ovejas son trasquiladas para vender su lana a compradores que cotizan este producto.Todos sus hijos trabajan en estas labores y junto a su fiel compañera, se ocupa de transmitir estas lecciones a sus hijos.Eduardo quiere seguir dedicándose a la ganadería y piensa mejorar la raza de sus animalitos y brindarles una mejor alimentación, es por ello que solicita un préstamo los cuales invertirá en la compra de lo necesario para la crianza de sus animales. Apoya a Eduardo a cumplir su meta.

loans.use: Purchase livestock and balanced food for the animals.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.en:
With the help of her husband, Evarista runs a small convenience store out of her house. She has two teenagers who are currently in school. Her business has grown a little at a time and now, after 12 years, it has become quite profitable.

Financial support from Fundación Paraguaya helped Evarista start her business, and she is now applying for a new loan to help her company grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as cleaning products, sugar, meat, dairy, etc. for a small business

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es:
Mrs. Mireya is a 50 year old single mom living in Hialeah. Her son works as a welder and lives with his mother helping to contribute economically towards the expenses of the household.

She began her business 8 years ago selling poultry from her home. Later she expanded her business and set up a small general store offering vegetables, grains and sweets. The income generated from her store was insufficient so she decided to refurnish one of her rooms to rent it out.

Mrs. Mireya wants to offer a greater range of goods in her general store to include staple products such as chicken and cheese. She is unable to purchase these goods as her income is used up to make improvements in her humble home. The loan she is requesting will be used to rebuild the room she is renting. The person renting her room has complained that the walls are made of wood and zinc and has asked her to make the walls of concrete. She can´t afford to lose the income from the room, so she wants to make the improvements with the loan she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses A. sells drinks and plastic products. He is 28 years old and married with 3 children. He hails from Uromi, Edo State Nigeria. He has been in business since 2005 and needs the loan of $450 to buy more drinks and plastic products to sell.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks and plastic product for sale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 33 year old married father of two living children. He lives with his wife in Sagam Siaya in Kenya. He started his cereals business in 2006 and specializes in selling dry maize to consumers. His hard work, perseverance, and good reputation, coupled with a well-established client-base ensure that his business will continue to grow despite stiff competition. He has applied for a loan of $700.00 to enable him purchase additional stock of cereals, such as beans, rice, and green grams, which are currently in high demand.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cereals.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram K. is a 28-year-old married man. He has two kids, both of whom are young at present, but he works extremely hard in order to ensure the best future for them. His wife takes care of their house and watches over their kids.

For a living, Akram works as a farmer, and he has done so for six years. His business is stable and is the main source of income for his family. Specifically, Akram grows onions and maize. During the growing season, Akram works in the field from early in the morning until late at night. Five years ago, Akram started his business by producing onions on a meager 0.10 hectare plot of land, whereas now he grows onions and other vegetables on a 1.30 hectacre plot.

Today, Akram is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 Somoni ($600) to be repaid over 12 months so that he may purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. In addition, any remaining loan proceeds will be used to pay the salaries of his hired seasonal workers. Akram thanks everyone for their support, and he promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchasing seeds and fertilizer, and to pay the salaries of his seasonal workers.

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sanata S. is 60 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Banconi neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (the third largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). At an early age, she chose to go into the restaurant business, which she learned from her mother. Her restaurant is located in a busy area of Sikasso, near the bus station. Despite her age, she is a woman who is very active and full of energy.

She has been a Soro Yiriwaso member for four years and has obtained a total of 12 loans, including three group loans (in a women’s association) and nine individual loans. With this loan, she intends to buy a ton and a half of rice, a half ton of millet and condiments for one month. This supply is regularly replenished. She sells different dishes all day long. She makes local and regional dishes (rice with lard, rice with different sauces, couscous, porridge, etc.). Her customers include truck drivers, travelers and others. She would like to earn a monthly income of 150,000 CFA francs, which she intends to use to contribute to paying her family’s expenses and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Sanata S. a 60 ans, et vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Banconi de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali ). Elle opta dès son jeune age pour la restauration qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa mère . Son restaurant est situé dans un point nevralgique de la ville de Sikasso à savoir la gare routière. Malgré son age avancé, cette dame déborde d’energie et est très active.

Elle est en rélation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 4 ans et a obtenu en tout 12 prêts dont 3 prêts solidaires ( dans une association des femmes) et 9 prêts individuels. Avec le prêt actuel, elle compte acheter une tonne et demi de riz, une demi tonne de mil et des condiments pour une période d’un mois. Ce stock est renouvélé regulièrement. Elle vend des plats diversifiés et cela pendant tout la journée. Ainsi elle prépare des plats du terrior et de la sous région (riz au gras, riz avec differentes sauces, le cousous, la bouillie etc...).Sa clientéle est constituée de routiers, de voyageurs et divers autres clients. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA et compte contribuera aux dépenses familiales et investir le reste dans son activité..

loans.use: Purchase of rice, millet and condiments

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheng K. is a farmer in the Sya Village, Kampong Speu Province. Additionally, she works as a grocer, while her husband, Mr. Reth Chou, collects palm juice to process into palm sugar. He also helps his wife in rice farming when he has spare time. Now that the rainy season has arrived, Mrs. Sokheng K. would like to cultivate rice, but she does not have enough cows to plow the rice field. Therefore, Mrs. Sokheng K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy an additional cow for this purpose. Mrs. Sokheng K. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Sokheng K. obtained a loan from AMK to start her grocery business, and she fully paid it back.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow to plow a field

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Mrs. Met P., 44 years old, and her husband, Mr. Phet Kav, 45, lives in Snam Preah Commune, Pursat Province, with their three children. One child is a student and the other two are construction workers. Met works as a farmer growing rice and raises pigs. She earns about US $2.00 per day. Her husband earns US $2.00 per day from his battery recharge service.

Her husband's business is growing and attracting customers, and she is requesting a loan of US $300.00 to replace her husband's battery-charging machine. This will allow her increasing income and better support his family's expenses. Mrs. P.'s husband is pictured because P. is unvalaible.

loans.use: To buy a replacement battery-charging machine

loans.name: Thi Hông Thăm's Group

texts.vi:
chị Nguyễn thị hồng Thắm năm nay 23 tuổi Ms 13010027 chị là một phụ nữ rất chịu khó và năng động. Chị đã tham gia vay vốn của Bình Minh CDC qua một C. kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt. Đồng thời giúp gia đình chị mở rộng kinh doanh đem lại thu nhập ổn định cho gia đình. Hàng ngày ngoài việc chăm sóc con nhỏ, chị còn buôn bán quần áo và bán tại chợ, còn chồng chị làm nghề lái xe, chuyên vận chuyển hoa quả và hàng hoá nên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định từ 150.000 VND đến 200.000 VND/ ngày. C. kỳ này chị tiếp tục đăng ký tham gia vay mức 4.704.000 VND để mua thêm quần, áo về bán. Các thành viên trong nhóm chị như sau :

  • chị C. thị Liên Ms 13010032 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để kinh doanh hàng hoa quả
  • chị Lê thị Thuý Ms 13010024 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để đi chợ và mua tre nứa về đan để bán
  • chị Nguyễn thị Oanh Ms 13010050 vay mức 2.242.000 VND để mua máy may ( trả trong 25 tuần )
  • chị Nguyễn thị Sáu Ms 13010029 vay mức 2.016.000 VND để chăn nuôi và mua tre nứa về đan để bán
  • chị Nguyễn thị Xuân Ms 13010051 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để chăn nuôi và đi chợ bán hàng bánh kẹo ( trả trong 25 tuần )
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn thị hồng Thắm is 23 years old. She is a hard working woman. She has already her first loan with SEDA. It helped her family to have a stable income. Everyday she sells clothes at the market . She also takes care of her young child. Her husband is a truck driver, delivering merchandise. Her family income is stable: 150.000 - 200.000 VND a day. This round she is requesting a loan of 4.704.000 VND to buy clothes to sell. Other members in her group are:
  • Mrs C. thị Liên, seeking 4.256.000 VND. She sells fruits and flowers
  • Mrs Lê thị Thuý, seeking 4.256.000 VND to buy bamboo to make baskets
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Oanh, seeking 2.242.000 VND to buy a sewing machine
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Sáu, seeking 2.016.000 VND. She makes bamboo baskets and raises poultry
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Xuân, seeking 3.186.000 VND. She sells basic goods and candies

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vốn buôn bán

loans.name: Walter Juan

texts.es: El Sr. R. es acompañado, de 43 años de edad, tiene 13 años de laborar para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa, como operario de limpieza, está solicitando su credito para continuar con la construcción de su casa, ya que con los créditos anteriores unicamente levanto la mitad de las paredes, ahora necesita completarlas y comprar los perlines para el techo, su compañera de vida trabaja en la Escuela Tierno Galvan de Juigalpa vendiendo golosinas a los estudiantes, y con ello apoya en los gastos del hogar, tienen 2 hijas una ya está casada y la última de 15 años está enferma debido que al nacer tragó liquido amniotico y está bajo su responsabilidad, no puede estudiar y está bajo sus cuidados.  Es un trabajador y cliente responsable que a pesar de su bajo salario ha sabido dar cumplimiento a sus compromisos
texts.en:
Mr. R. is single and he's 43 years old. He has been working in the Mayor's office in Juigalpa over the past 13 years as a janitor. He's requesting a loan in order to continue to build his home since the previous loans helped to finished half of the walls. He now needs to finish them and buy material for his roof. His life partner works at the Tierno Galvan School in Juigalpa selling snacks to the students. This helps to pay the bills. They have 2 daughters.
