One who is married and the other one who is 15 years old who was born sick because at birth she drank amniotic fluid. They're responsible for her and she can't go to school because she's under their care. Mr. R. is a hard worker and a responsible client even though his salary is very low, he has been able to pay his debts on time.


Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To continue building his house

loans.name: Heak

texts.en: Mrs. Heak D. is a villager in Prey Takap village in Takeo Province. She is a traditional medicine seller. Her husband, Mr. Kun Rath, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn his living. Even though they have different businesses, they still cannot support their family. Thus, Mrs. Heak D. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 29 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is four years old. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
Rizalyn T. believes that “discipline is the backbone of progress," and has made that the guiding principle in life.   

She is 27 years old and married to Pether, who works as a farmer. They are blessed with two children: Charizze, who is 5 years old and in a pre-school program and Pether John, who is 2 years old. They live in Binarzang Quirino, Isabela, a section of the country where rice and corn are major crops. Her family lives happily in the village and she works hard to maintain their close family ties. 

Rizalyn has a modest village store where she earns a small income that pays for their daily needs and the children's school fees. They also invest some of her earnings in the maintenance of their farm. 

Rizalyn has applied for a loan to buy additional items to sell in her store.  This loan will be of great help to her since she will be able to increase her income. This will help her husband buy farm supplies and save for the education of their children and the future of her family . 

“I believe that my dreams will turn into reality if I will work hard and hand in hand with my husband,” Rizalyn explained.

loans.use: Additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Faaogea

texts.en: Faaogea F., 18, is single with no children.  She has 2 years of experience in the pork cake business. She sells to the village people, public and school children 5 days per week. She is a new member, with just one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 Tala.  SPBD loans are Faaogea’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To expand her pork cake business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is fifty-one years old. She is married with two children. One of them has completed senior high school and is waiting for the results to enter the tertiary, preferably the university, next year. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items such as rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local market.

Sabina wants to use the loan to buy bulk stocks of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted spices, washing soaps and powders, etc., especially in the current season to avoid price hikes due to the food crisis. Sabina hopes to make good income from the expanded business to finance her children’s education to provide them with life opportunities better than what she had.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her shop

loans.name: Efua Yaa

texts.en:
Since 2006, Efua Yaa K., an uneducated lady with two children, has sold food supplies and fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Atobiase near Elmina. She uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the housekeeping expenses.

Efua Yaa is requesting a loan to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale and also to purchase more food supplies for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, She plans to save towards a house that she wants to put up with her husband and also to invest in expanding their cocoa farm.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities and more food supplies for sale.

loans.name: Daniel Plus Group

texts.en:
Deis K. is 32 years old, single, and has two children, 7 and 9, who go to school. He sells soft drinks. He began business in 1996 selling pork in KisaN. in Eastern DRCongo. From 1996 to 1997, with US$ 1700 he had as working capital, he started mining in KisaN.. His business fell down due to the war in Eastern DRCongo.

Deis decided to move to Kinshasa where he started a new business in 2003, selling beverages with a beginning capital of US$ 200. His business now makes a profit of US$ 35 per week. He joined one of Hope’s groups in December 2008. Deis works very hard and with determination to achieve his dream. He wants to purchase a small bus for transportation in his area. His business is located in the eastern part of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To add crates of soft drinks to meet his customers needs

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba M. is 54 years old. She is a divorced mother of three children. She says it is not easy for her at all providing for the family as a single mother of three children. One of them is currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
Habiba is a food vendor. She sells kenkey. She prepares the kenkey in the house she lives in and sells by the roadside in the evenings. Kenkey is served hot with pepper and fried fish. It is prepared from maize (corn dough). She procures the raw materials such as maize, fish, and other vegetables from the local market. Habiba has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure raw materials in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the support they need.

loans.use: To procure raw materials in bulk

loans.name: Herotia

texts.en: Herotia P., 52, is married with 5 children.  She has many years of experience in the Elei Printing business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about US $115).  SPBD loans are Herotia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Materials and supplies for clothing production

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.en:
Nghĩa Dương Thị (532980876) is a 38 year-old female living in the town of Nam Định. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Nghĩa owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing furniture rental services to local community members.  Nghĩa has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,200,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1998, Nghĩa joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Nghĩa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Nghĩa is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND ($850 US) which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Nghĩa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: used to invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en:
Greetings from Emerthe M., a 47 year-old married woman. She and her husband have 7 children aged 24, 18, 15, 14, 12, 8, and 5 years old. They live in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Mrs. M. has owned a restaurant in Nyarugenge district since 2000. Mrs. M. starts her business at 7:00 AM and finishes at 8:00 PM daily; she has 4 full-time employees to help her run her business smoothly. She is seeking her first loan worth 300000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company and she has no other source of income.

Before this loan Mrs. M. had a monthly profit of approximately $185. With this loan she will purchase other many products for her restaurant and she will reinvest the increased profit in her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant business.

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.ru: Валиджанов Акмалжон –молодой человек 1981 года рождения,  женат,  имеет  двоих  детей.  Недавно  он  обратился  в  нашу  организацию  за  финансовой  помощью  в  виде  потребительского  кредита.  Он  накопил  немного  денег  и  собирался  купить  автомашину  «Нексия».  Он  работает  в  дехканском  хозяйстве  и  имеет  доход,  позволяющий  погасить  кредит.  Всем  своим  друзьям  он  рекомендует  нашу  организацию,  потому  что  мы  помогли  ему  в  осуществлении  его  планов.
texts.en:
Born in 1981, Akmaljon V. is married and has two children. He recently reached out to our organization for a personal loan. He saved some money and planned to buy a Nexia car. Akmaljon works at a dekhan farm and has enough income to repay the loan. He recommends our organization to all of his friends because we helped him to achieve his goals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a car

loans.name: Shahnaz Amanat Ali Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread, and clothes) for her decorative embroidery business. 

Sabran baji wants a loan to buy a movie camera for her movie making business. 

Bushra baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switches, and switch boards) for her electric supplies business. 

Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

Another Shahnaz baji is the leader of this group. She is a very caring lady. Her members are very happy with her because she supports them in their businesses. Her husband's name is A. A.. They have lived in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Both of them are very hard working, and they help each other. Her husband deals with seasonal fruit. He buys fruit wholesale and sells it to the fruit shops in various towns. Shahnaz baji helps him by packing the fruit in boxes. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits to expand her husband’s fruit-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Bushra baji is wearing a white shawl in the photo.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos. Su esposo trabaja en el comercio de verduras, mientras ella tiene un servicio de lavado de motos, motocarros y autos en un local que alquiló y está ubicado a media hora de su casa. Para obtener ganancias extras, en su negocio vende debidas, las cuales consumen sus clientes entre tanto esperan el lavado de sus vehículos. Esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 3 años y se siente muy a gusto porque se mantiene ocupada y le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una zona comercial. Para un futuro cercano, a Elizabeth le gustaría tener un pequeño bar para incrementar sus ganancias. Este es su 4to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es porque existe mucha comunicación entre sus compañeros y son puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mangueras para su lavadero, porque las que tiene se encuentran deterioradas debido al constante uso. También comprará bebidas para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 27 years old and lives with her partner, who is the father of her two children. Her husband sells vegetables, while she operates a vehicle cleaning service for motorcycles, motorcars and automobiles. She operates her business in a rented space located a half hour from her house. To earn extra money, she also sells cold beverages which customers drink while they are waiting for their vehicles to be washed. She has been operating for 3 years and feels quite comfortable because her business is profitable since it is located in a commercial area. In the near future, Elizabeth would like to open a small bar to increase her earnings.

This is her 4th loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her group because the members always communicate with each other and make their payments on time. With the money she is requesting, she will buy hoses for her vehicle wash business because the ones she has now are deteriorating due to constant use. She would also like to purchase more beverages to sell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hoses

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 40-year-old married woman who has four children between the ages of 4 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She owns and lives in a four-room house with six people. Margaret doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day. She lives and works in a semi-urban area.

Margaret sells second-hand clothes in one of Kampala's suburbs. She uses public transportation to shop. Margaret sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expense is school fees. She has been in this business for eight years. 

Margaret has been with MCDT for nine years and servicing her twentieth loan with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothing. Margaret hopes to see her business grow and she wants to own a house on that land that she bought with previous business profits.
 

.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es: Julia A. y Antonia M., se dedican a vender chicharrones fritos, ellas compran el chicharrón semipreparado fritan y embolsan con algún juguete, luego ofrecen a tiendas y puestos de golosinas ya que es un producto muy requerido por los niños. Trabajan en esta actividad  hace 2 años e indican que les  va bien, pero pueden mejorar es por eso que se animaron a agruparse con algunas amigas y vecinas y formar el grupo “Zapatito Veloz” que es parte del Centro Focal “Collpani”, sus demás compañeras también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de licores, sal, comida y la confección de chamarras y mantas. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar materia prima o mayor mercadería.
texts.en:
Julia and Antonia sell fried pigskin. They buy the partially prepared pigskin and bag it with a toy. They then sell it to stores or candy stores because it is a product that children enjoy. They have worked at this activity for two years and it is going well. There is always room for improvement and that is why they decided to join with some friends and neighbors and form the group called “Zapatito Veloz”(Fast Little Shoe). This group is part of the focal center “Collpani”. The rest of their partners also have their own businesses such as selling liquor, salt or food or making vests or shawls. All of them need loans to buy raw material or wholesale merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material and merchandise.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian tiene 32 años, es soltera y vive sola en su casa propia. Ella es profesora de primaria, trabaja en una institución educativa que está ubicada a 2 horas de su casa. Su labor como docente es sólo por las mañanas, pues por las tardes y en sus ratos libres aprovecha sus relaciones interpersonales para vender dulces (piononos, panes integrales y otras variedades de postres), actividad que viene realizando hace 2 años y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es mantenerse ocupada, porque desde muy joven ha trabajado y se siente incomoda cuando no hace nada. Por otro lado, su negocio le es muy rentable, porque ella pide sus postres quincenalmente, los entrega a sus clientes y ellos le pagan a fin de mes, así les da opción para que junten el dinero, y posteriormente le hacen otros pedidos.
Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y está muy contento con su banco comunal porque se siente a gusto con sus compañeros, pues son personas muy responsables y amistosas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más dulces, gastará aproximadamente 1000 soles, con lo restante mandará a construir 2 habitaciones en su casa para alquilarlas y obtener ganancias extras.
texts.en:
Lilian is 32 years old, is single and lives alone in her own house. She is a primary school teacher, and she works in a school that is located 2 hours from her house. She works as a teacher only in the mornings, so in the afternoons and in her free time, she takes advantage of her personal relationships to sell sweets (piononos, wholesome bread, and other types of pastries). She has been doing this for 2 years, and it has been going well. What she likes most about her work is that it keeps her busy, because since she was young, she has worked and she feels uncomfortable when she is doing nothing. Also, her business is very profitable; she orders her pastries fortnightly, delivers them to her clients and they pay her at the end of the month. She gives them the option so that they can collect the money and pay for many orders at once. Later, they can make more orders. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she is very happy with her community bank because she feels comfortable with her peers, since they are very responsible and friendly. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy more sweets, for which she will spend about 1000 soles and with the rest, she will build 2 rooms in her house so that she can rent them out and earn extra income.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and build rooms to rent

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady D. est une marchande sise devant chez elle dans un quartier populaire de Thies au Sénégal.Elle est agée de 56 ans et connait très bien son domaine qui l'a occupé depuis très longtemps. Mariée à un vieux nommé Monsieur A.B. GUEYE, Madame Khady D. GUEYE sollicite un pret de 100 000 frs cfa. Ce crédit lui permettra de mieux faire face à la demande croissante de sa clientèle afin de gagner plus et de mieux s'occuper des besoins  de son mari qu'elle aime tant.

loans.use: acheter des legumes, du poisson, de la pate d'arachide, l'huile de palme, etc pour les vendre

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal “Primero de Agosto” de distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 57 años de edad, estado civil soltera, tiene 03 hijos, vive en la Calle San Martín en el distrito de Zepita, ella estudio hasta 4to grado de secundaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de comida.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, papas, condimentos, etc., para su negocio de venta de comida y su tienda de venta de abarrotes.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, papas, condimentos, etc.,

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Mrs. Felecia S. is from the town of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with only one child who is now an adult. Felecia has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns from her business a monthly income of PHP 4,500. Currently she's obtaining her 2nd loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Together with her husband, Veronica owns and operates a furniture-making business. She is now asking to borrow PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders that she needs to buy more wood for making different kinds of furniture. She is hoping that her loan will be approved so that she can meet the demands of her customers and also have an increase in income.

Veronica and her husband are blessed with eight children. She and her family lives in the village of San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela. Veronica dreams of improving their business in order to have a more comfortable way of living.

loans.use: To buy more wood for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Shukhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат Махмадиев проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 36 лет. Холост. Шухрат более 3 лет предоставляет услугу такси по городе Душанбе. Кредит просит для доплаты и ремонта автомашины, т.к. он еще не полностью выкупил автомашину. На полученную прибыль хочет сыграть свою свадьбу.
texts.en:
Shukhrat M. lives in the city of Dushanb. He is 36 years old and unmarried. Shukhrat has been working as a taxi driver in Dushanb for more than three years. He is asking for a loan to finance the payment and repairs of his car, because he has not yet made the car payments in full. He wishes to use the profits to plan his wedding.

Translated from Russian by Anastasia Uglova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car payments and repairs

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “30 D. Agosto”, vive en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 50 años D. edad, no cuenta con estudios, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos.
La señora Francisca tiene una tienda D. abarrotes y trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 10 años atrás y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra D. mercadería.
Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/.1200.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà abarrotes como: fideos, arroz, azúcar, etc.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda D. abarrotes y comprarse un terreno.
Lo que màs le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the Communal Bank “30 D. Agosto.” She lives in the Ilave district of El Collao Province, Departament of Puno. She is 50 years old, doesn't have an education, is a widow and has 5 children. Francisca has a small grocery store and has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 10 years. Her first loan with her Communal Bank was for 300.00 new soles, which allowed her to purchase merchandise. She is requesting a loan of 1200.00 new soles to purchase groceries such as: noodles, rice, sugar etc. Her wish for the future is to have a grocery store and to buy herself a plot of land. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the savings and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace E. is from the village of Tipolo, Plaridel in Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Grace is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over two years, and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Grace is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Grace from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Mrs. Ester R. is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store in their Barangay of Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, married to Apolinario R., and blessed with 3 children, all now at adult ages. They earn their living from farming. This family had been experiencing hardships, in terms of financial matters. To help her husband, Ester decided to open up a little sari-sari store and for 30 years she was able to manage this business. This time she is earning an average net income of PHP 4,000.00 from sales of the business.  She joined PAGLAUM MPC just this year because she is very much interested with our products and services. PAGLAUM MPC, being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, and awarded for being Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. As a newly recognized member, Ester was given a privilege to avail an amount of 6,000.00 as her 1st loan. She will use these funds to add to her capital for the existing sari-sari store business. Her plan in life is to improve her business and to be able to support her family and to help her grandchildren.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing Sari-sari Store.

loans.name: Luisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Luisa Del Carmen tiene 59 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería y venta de verduras, por lo que hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, como es una pulpera, ella es una mujer muy responsable. Por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar los ingresos de su familia, ya que tenía 3 hijos de los cuales tenía que brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar. Actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de limones, huevos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, aguacate y naranjas.
texts.en:
Luisa Del Carmen is 59 years old and makes a living tending to her convenience store and selling vegetables, which she has been doing for more than four years. As a shopkeeper, Luisa is a very responsible person. She has always been concerned about improving her family's income because she has three children for whom she wants to provide an opportunity for an education. Currently she is requesting a loan to increase her working capital, which she plans to use to purchase lemons, eggs, snacks, natural beverages, avocados and oranges.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lemons, eggs, snacks, natural beverages, avocados and oranges

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr: Madame Khary G. est une femme de 42 ans qui habite à Yoff plus précisément dans le quartier de Dagoudane. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis mai 2009 et n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt. Elle est divorcée et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 17 et20 ans. Depuis deux ans elle s’exerce dans le commerce de chaussures, de tissus et de parfums. Elle est aussi ouvrière  a l’usine Africamer. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour acheter des chaussures de femme et des parfums pour son commerce. Elle a choisi cette activité par passion et aussi pour soutenir sa petite famille
texts.en:
Ms. Khary G. is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Yoff, specifically in the Dagoudane district. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC Yoff savings group since May 2009, and has not had any previous loans. She is divorced and has 2 children whose ages range between 17 and 20 years. For two years, she has run a business selling shoes, fabric, and perfume. She is also a worker at the Africamer factory. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 FCFA to buy women's shoes and perfume for her business. She chose this business because of her interest in it and also to support her small family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Élisabeth

texts.fr: Élisabeth N. est une femme de 67 ans, elle est célibataire et mère d'un enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois du Banc Villageois de PEYCKOUK-LELO depuis 12 ans et demi. Elle a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 25 fois de suite. Elle est vendeuse de poissons séchés et de pâte d'arachide. Son petit commerce lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins personnel et à améliorer son cadre de vie par la restauration de sa maison
texts.en:
Élisabeth N., aged 67, is single and the mother of one child. She has been a member of the village bank of Peyckouk-Lelo for twelve and a half years. She is very experienced with the credit process, since she has received already 25 consecutive loans. She sells dried fish and peanut butter. Her small business enables her to provide for her needs and improve her living environment through the restoration of her house.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Jofely

texts.en:
Jofely is 38 years old and has been a member of Kiva partner, ASHI, since 2007. She actively participates in all ASHI activities, despite her busy schedule attending to the needs of her fruit and vegetable business and those of her family. For Jofely, a rest day or a day off is the time she spends with her ASHI co-members. Every second, minute and hour of it is her most treasured time because she can learn many things about different aspects of life from the sharing time they have together. For her, knowing and learning to communicate and connect to other people are the best ingredients in making a business, aside from having business capital and other financial services from ASHI. 
Jofely's husband’s support is also very important in making her fruit and vegetable farming and selling business grow. Without that, she would not have the courage to request a loan to expand the business. Her aspiration of supporting the education of her three children until college graduation has always been her top priority. Therefore, she really has to work hard at enhancing her business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long C. is 29 years old and lives in the  Dongkor District of Phnom Penh City where she works as a laborer in a garment factory. She has worked at this job since before she married. Long's husband sells a few items from home to earn a living. The family has two school-age children who are students. Long's family faces a problem with transportation expenses as they must always pay for taxis. To solve this problem, she is requesting a loan to purchase a new motorcycle to ride to work or elsewhere. (Long was busy working in the factory when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Cuatro Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Dafne Maria Gomes de 43 años, casada con Roberto Paco, vive en la ciudad de El Alto, zona Paraíso hace 3 años aproximadamente, tiene domicilio propio y vio la necesidad de que las personas realizan con frecuencia pequeñas compras, entonces, decidió abrir una tienda de barrio, cuando compró su domicilio, desde entonces estos ingresos ha podido cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, ahora quiere mejorar y estocarse mayor cantidad de mercadería.
Sus demás compañeras de la Asociación Comunal 4 Estrellas, también tienen actividades económicas como la venta de fibra de vidrio, condimentos, ropa de bebe, plásticos, conservas, leche y serigrafía.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.

Ellas se reúnen en el Centro Focal Collpani.
texts.en:
Dafne is 43 years old, married to Robert and lives in the city of El Alto in the Paradise Zone. She has had her own house for the past three years. She noticed that people needed to make small purchases frequently so she decided to open a neighborhood store when she bought her house. The earnings from the store have helped pay for the basic necessities for her family. Now she would like to improve her business by stocking a larger quantity of merchandise in her store. The other members of the Four Stars Community Association also have economic activities such as selling fiberglass, condiments, baby clothes, plastics, preserves, milk or serigraphy. They meet in the Collpani Center.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is 40 years old, married with six children. She comes from a city called Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She is the mother of six sons. Her eldest son completed his education till 5th standard and then started his own food stand in 2007 where he sells specifically Dahi Bhalas & Daal Chawal (local dishes). Her next son got his education till 8th standard and sits with his father in his grocery shop. 

The next youngest to him is a driver and he couldn’t study because he had no interest in going to school. By the grace of God, the others are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Nargis specially pays attention to them so they get the education and make their future bright. 

Nargis is a regular client of Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva). She has successfully repaid three loans to Asasah and now she is applying for a loan for the fourth time to purchase groceries such as lentils, cooking oil, rice and spices in bulk to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a store.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy F. is from the village of Kauswagan, Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 40 years old. Billy is married and has 3 school-aged children., He peddles seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Billy has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Billy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Billy is requesting his first loan, for 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more fish to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
47-year-old Federico M. is from the town of Sto. Nino. He is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Federico owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Federico joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Federico has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Federico is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Federico from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lara

texts.en:
Lara Z. is from the village of Lurugan in Valencia City. She is 43 years old. Lara is widowed and has one school-age child. To make a living, Lara owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lara has been engaged in her business for over 10 years, and she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Lara joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lara has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lara is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Lara from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El  socio vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Juan Carlos ; el tiene 27 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo menor, él socio  vive en el distrito de Urcos, él socio  trabaja desde muy jovencito aprendió a manejar y se dedica a ser taxista, con todo lo que fue ganado e las carreras, el completó para comprarse un auto, El socio trabaja desde los 15 años y ya tienen su casita, es un joven muy emprendedor y muy correcto.  El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su auto.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio de taxi y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “QORI ORCCO” communal bank. He lives in the Urcos district of Quispicanchis province, in the Department of Cusco. His name is Juan Carlos, and he is 27 years old. He has a live-in partner and one small child. He lives in the Urcos district and has worked since he was very young, learning to drive and becoming a taxi driver. Saving what he earned over the years, he was able to buy his own car. He has worked since he was 15, and he already has a small house of his own. He is a very enterprising and very well-mannered young man. He is requseting the loan in order to buy spare parts for his car. Juan Carlos infinitely values and appreciates the loan granted to him, since it will allow him to improve his taxi business and his quality of life. Accordingly, he is committed to making all of his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 30 years old, married and a mother of five.  She does tailoring to earn a living.  She was previously selling second hand clothes for a living.  Being a business-lady, she got involved with the New Jerusalem group in Faulu Kenya.  This has helped her to get new business ideas and to save her money.  Most all, she can easily access loan from Faulu Kenya because the members guarantee each other loans.  

So far, she has managed to service one loan worth 75, 000 KEs which helped her to improve her business.  Therefore, her living standards have really improved.  Currently, he needs 60, 000 KES to buy fabric and an embroidery machine.

loans.use: To buy fabric and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Claudia Soledad

texts.es:
La Señora Claudia Soledad V. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, este sector es reconocido por sus parques en donde se realiza una gran variedad de eventos festivos y deportivos, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora Claudia Soledad se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 6 ciclos, beneficiándose de los créditos de la fundación en su negocio ya que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa y también de calzado, labora en esta actividad hace 16 años y solo vende sus  productos en días de ferias.
 
Doña Claudia tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su segunda hija en la escuela, su esposo es latonero (endereza las latas de los vehículos), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en ropa para tener mucha más variedad. Su  meta el  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Claudia Soledad V. is a member of the "Mujeres Luchadoras" ["Striving Women"] communal bank. She lives in the Miraflores neighborhood of the city of Cuenca. This area is known for its parks, where a great variety of festivals and sporting events are held. The inhabitants raise animals and work in agriculture. Claudia Soledad has been a member of this communal bank for 6 loan cycles. The loans from the foundation have been used to benefit her business; her work is selling all kinds of clothing, as well as shoes. She has done this work for 16 years, selling her products only on market days. Claudia is 31 years old and married, with 2 children, aged 12 and 7. Her older child, a son, studies at a school in the city, and her younger child, a daughter, is in primary school. Her husband is a "latonero" (auto body repairman), and they do not have a house of their own, so they live as renters. Her new loan will be invested in clothing, so that she can offer a much greater variety. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying blouses, t-shirts, pants, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman with one child who attends school. Her husband is employed and he contributes to the family income. She has been operating her motorcycle business and tailoring business for the past six years. She sells from home to her neighbors, in particular ladies' dresses. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase an overlock and zigzag machine. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Flora hopes to open a well-furnished shop with modern machines.

She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a home with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase an overlock and zigzag machine.

loans.name: Olivett Achieng

texts.en:
Olivett is 30 years old and married to Kennedy Oruko, who is a doctor. They have two children: Gladwell Atieno, who is 4 years old, and Bramwel Oruko, who is 2 years old. They live in Maseno town which is in vihiga district. Olivett runs a beauty salon and has been doing so for the last four years and she confesses that the business is doing well.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after she was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is already a client. The loan will enable her to buy some salon products like shampoos, towels and hair chemicals. Her salon is situated in an urban setup and most of her clients are university students.

She hopes to establish a full beauty parlor in the area to capture the large market demand and be able to build a permanent house. When her business is stable she will be able to see to it that her children get the best education available.

loans.use: To buy salon products to add to her stock

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita E. is 62 years old and from the town of Surallah. She is married with five grown children. Farming has been the source of income for her family. She wanted to give herself and her spouse financial security now that they are old. For that very reason, she is working hard on her farming business and requests a loan to improve her yield. The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and seedlings. Her profit will be used to save for old age and for the family’s daily consumption.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Ngach

texts.en:
Ngach T. N. is 55 years old and has five children. Three of them are jobless. Ngach runs a shop that sells fresh vegetables and chicken meat in the local market and earns 100,000 VND in daily profits. Her business has been in operation for many years. Although her children are trying to find work, the family cannot currently cover big expenditures. Ngach also focuses on raising poultry and wants to raise more chickens for meat to provide for the market demand during the Tet holiday. 

Ngach is requesting a loan of 8,938,000 VND to buy 100 chickens and build a chicken coop.

loans.use: to buy chickens and build a chicken coop

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna N. is a resident of Tangal, Lalitpur, and lives with her husband and two sons. The Tangal area is a very busy shopping area of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses, especially famous for brass, copper, bronze pots and utensils of different varieties. Mrs. N. is a shopkeeper in Tangal, and sells pots and utensils. Her two sons are studying in university. Mrs. N., along with her husband, Om Bahadur N., opened their shop 8 years ago. They equally contribute their efforts in their shop because they have no other source of income. Their children also help them.

Mrs. N. is asking for her seventh loan to expand her shop by buying items like plates, steel glasses, and hotpots to meet the increasing demands of customers. They want to strengthen the economic condition of their family by increasing their income.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her shop

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda es socia del Banco Comunal “22 de Setiembre” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con dos hijos, tiene grado de instrucción secundaria completal.
Hermelinda tiene un local de imprenta en donde hace todo tipo de tarjetas, volantes y muchos otros. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en el negocio que en aquel tiempo realizaba lo cual era cría, compra y venta de chanchos.
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá ampliar su negocio de imprenta a través de la compra de materiales.
Su sueño es crecer en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es el ahorro que genera ganancia y la alegría.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the community bank "22 de Septiembre" which is located in the Llave district, El Collao province, in the department of Puno. She is 27 years old, lives with her live-in partner and has two children. She completed her secondary education.

Hermelinda has a printing business where she makes all types of cards, flyers and other products. She has been working with field partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles (PEN) which she used to invest in the business she had at the time which was raising, buying and selling pigs. 

She is requesting a new loan in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles (PEN) which will allow her to expand her printing business through the purchase of materials. 

Her dream is to expand her business. What she likes about the community banks is the savings that generate earnings and the happiness it provides.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her printing business.

loans.name: Olobulu Ole

texts.en:
Olobulu Ole K. is 22 years old .He is married to Kisianani Namo and the father of two children. Olobulu is a businessman involved in buying and selling bulls and he has been doing this for the last five years. 

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staffs in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy young bulls for selling later as that business is doing much better in his area. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire a small piece of land for his wife to carry out crop farming.

His dream is to become a commercial businessman and he is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy young bulls for selling later

loans.name: Urtnasan

texts.en:
Urtnasan B. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest child is a university student and her younger two children both attend secondary school.  Her husband operates a taxi service using his own car to supplement his family income. 

Urtnasan operates a dairy product trading business. She started her dairy product selling business in 2005 after selling a variety of food products such as meat and other products between 1992 and 2005. She is a very hardworking person.  

Urtnasan  is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of dairy products for the upcoming winter's National holiday.  This sale will increase her working capital for her dairy trading business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products in volume

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Francisca; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella vende diferentes tipos de comida y también vende gaseosas y cervezas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y gaseosas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Senora Juana Francisca belongs to the "San José de Urubamba" communal bank, which is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, in the Cuzco region.

Senora Juana Francisca is 46 years old, single, and has a son. She combines her daily activities with running a restaurant, where she sells different types of food and also sodas and beers. She works from 8am to 7pm. She wants to improve and expand her restaurant, and is seeking the loan to buy hings for cooking and sodas, which she will buy wholesale.

She is happy that she can access the loan and promises to complete her repayments on time.

loans.use: The member of this communal bank is seeking a loan to buy things for cooking, and sodas which she will buy wholesale.

loans.name: Money Finders Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Money Finders” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Baby S. is the leader of this group. The twenty-seven-year-old is married to a building contractor and they have four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Baby has been a businesswoman for five years now, she sells market-food – palm-oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, rice, oil, tomatoes, salts, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: Buy palm-oil, margi, salt, rice, oil, tomatoes, salts, etc., at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: El Señor Luis de la ciudad de La Paz,  vive en la localidad  del Torno hace 2 años, Su actividad es el servicio de trasporte en la ciudad de Santa Cruz trabaja con radio móvil hace 3 años y como segunda actividad mecánico en la zona del torno.   El Sr. Luis no es casado pero convive hace 5 años con la señora Yandira , ella tiene la actividad venta de comida hace 5 anos en la zona del Torno, los señores cuentan con un hijo pequeño. El Destino del crédito es para la compra de un motor nuevo para su vehículo. El  señor Luis se sienten muy agradecido  por haber depositado la confianza en ellos y haber agilizado el crédito.
texts.en: Luis, of the city of La Paz, has lived in the community of Torno for 2 years.  His business is transportation service in the city of Santa Cruz.  He has worked with Radio Móvil, a taxi company, for three years.  His second job is working as a mechanic in the Torno area.  Luis is not married, but for 5 years he has lived with Yandira.  She has sold food in the Torno area for 5 years.  They have a small child.  The loan will be used to buy a new engine for Luis' vehicle.  Luis is very grateful for the confidence placed in them and for the help in facilitating the loan.

loans.use: For the purchase of a new engine

loans.name: Sros

texts.en: Mrs. Sros K. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Poem Porng, live in a village in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have two sons and three daughters. Sros runs a grocery store from her home. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to repair and renovate the house where they live.

loans.use: To repair and renovate the family home.

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
Rose K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United Women. She is 28 years old, single, and has four children who are between the ages of 24 months and 10 years. She was only able to attend school through 5th grade due to financial constraints. 

For four years, she has been selling children's toys in the Jamaica Road community in Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 4,000-Liberian-Dollars portion of this 24,000-Liberian-Dollars group loan to buy more bags of toys to resell.

She describes herself as a trustworthy, hard-working and business-minded woman whose dreams are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of toys to resell

loans.name: Yin's Group

texts.en:
Yin C. currently faces difficulties with her ox; it is getting old and cannot support her in plowing her farm fields. She hopes to buy a new one, but her account is insufficient. To deal with this situation, Yin C. is requesting a loan to buy a new ox to replace the old one.

The other three borrowers are:  
Mrs. S., a rice farmer, who is asking for a loan to buy piglets to breed, and purchase planks to mend her old house.  
Mrs. Y., a local farmer, who will be using the loan money to buy a plot of farmland.
Mrs. Y., who is requesting a loan to buy nets and a few piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy a new ox to replace the old one.

loans.name: Maria De Los Remedios

texts.es: María de los Remedios J. S. es madre soltera que con esfuerzos saco a su único hijo adelante ofreciéndole una carrera universitaria el cual su hijo esta agradecido por tal motivo la apoya económicamente y adquirió su  vivienda de interés social para proteger a su madre. La señora María de los Remedios cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 9 años, al que en este momento desea comprar mas mercancía para tener mas ventas.
texts.en:
María de los Remedios J. S. is a single mother who managed to support her only son through her efforts providing him with a university career.  Her son is grateful to her for that so helps her economically; he acquired his publicly subsidized house to protect his mother.

María de los Remedios has had a used clothing sales business for 9 years.  At present she wants to buy more merchandise in order to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny tiene 31 años, ella vive en su propia casa con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace más de 4 años, Marleny ha instalado en su casa su propia tienda, desde entonces vende productos de primera necesidad, motivo por el cual no le queda tiempo para atender a sus clientes. Pero ella sola no esta, su familia la apoya en el trabajo, atendiendo a los clientes. Su trabajo lo considera muy importante ya que se a convertido en una fuente de ingresos, de esa manera puede cubrir los gastos educativos para sus hijos. Para el futuro, Marleny y su familia están pensando en implementar otros productos a fin de seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes. Es su crédito número 20 con MFP,  se siente  muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le ayudo a comprender mejor sobre la importancia de tener una economía estable y esforzarse en su negocio de lo cual esta muy agradecida y se compromete a seguir adelante con su puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de azúcar, arroz y menestras.
texts.en:
Marleny, 31, lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  Over four years ago Marleny set up a store in her house and has been selling groceries ever since which leaves her no time to tend to her customers.  But she’s not alone; her family helps her with the work and to take care of customers.

She considers her work to be very important since it’s become a source of income which allows her to cover her children’s educational expenses.  For the future, Marleny and her family are planning to add more products in order to continue meeting customer needs.

This is her 20th loan with MFP.  She feels very happy to be part of a communal bank because it helped her better understand the importance of having stable income and to work hard at her business and she is very grateful for this and committed to continue making punctual payments.  She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of sugar, rice and snacks.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar and snacks.

loans.name: Bav

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Mrs. Bav I., age 28, who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs. Since 2007, she has run this business and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She is married with three children who still study in school. Her husband is a firewood seller. 

Beside raising pigs, she has also been planting rice which is her annual business. Mrs. Bav I. is seeking a loan to buy a cow which can assist her in farm fields. The cow can also be used for breeding purposes so she can raise its offspring.

loans.use: to buy a cow to assist her in farm fields.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her older daughter, age 25, is a salesperson, while the younger two attend college and secondary school. Her husband is a fireman who works at Central Heating Place in Zavhan province. 

She manages a Mongolian traditional-clothing-making business in a rented workshop. She makes stylish and colorful clothing called "Deel." People in Mongolia like to wear Deel during national holidays. She is a hardworking lady who says, "I have received loans from XacBank many times and am still planning to receive more in the future." 

She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase a more advanced, modern sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a more advanced, modern sewing machine

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and has one child. He lives with three family members, one of whom works. M. has had a shop offering printing, photocopying and stationery since 2003. He has four years of experience and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting $2,400 to pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy a photocopy machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Jazzille Don

texts.en: Jazzille Don is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Jazzille Don is working in an eatery as a service crew member and will use the loan to provide for his daily needs. He had been working for two years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy his daily personal needs like food & clothing. Jazzille Don is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jazzille Don hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy his daily needs like food & clothing

loans.name: Arquimides

texts.en:
Arquimides, 49 years old, is a simple and hardworking man. He lives in his own home together with his wife Maria, 50, and his two beloved daughters, Vanesa, 17, and Carolina, 15. He wishes to bring them a better quality of life. Every morning, Arquimides endeavors to work very hard on his land and leave them very fertile. He knows that the quality of the yuca that he grows depends on this, to be able to sell them later in the central market in Pucallpa. What he enjoys most about his work is that he has a lot of freedom to work on his lands and set his own hours. He has been doing this job for 8 years and considers cleaning the yuca to be the hardest part. With time, he would like to purchase new plots of land to augment his production. This will be his eighth credit with MFP and he hopes for the supporr from you. With the 400 nuevos soles, he will purchase more sacks of organic fertilizer to make his land fertile. 

Translated from Spanish

Arquimides, de 49 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa María de 50 años y sus 2 queridas hijas Vanesa de 17 años  y Carolina de 15 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todas las mañanas Arquimides se esmera mucho en trabajar sus tierras y dejarlas muy fértiles, pues sabe que de eso depende la calidad de las yucas que siembra, para luego venderlas al mercado central de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucha libertad para trabajar en sus tierras, puede disponer de su propio horario. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es hacer la limpieza de sus sembríos de yuca. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este será su octavo crédito con MFP y por tanto espera el apoyo de ustedes. Con los cuatrocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprar más sacos de abono orgánico para hacer fértiles sus tierras.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys  tiene  veintiséis años de  edad ella es soltera  y vive en el barrio trinidad, de copaínala estado e Chiapas México. 

    Ella  trabaja con su hermano, es en una tienda de impresiones y ella solicito el  préstamo para invertirlo en la   compra de catálogos, de la marca, avión, jafra y Arabela, en donde lleva nueve meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con  ello ha tenido un buen  resultado.

   Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue por si misma ya que con ello desea tener sus propios  ingresos para  apoyarse con sus gastos que se generan en su vida diaria, aunque cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano lo demás lo dispone para apoyar a su mama.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña  actividad pueda tener sus propios ingresos para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys is twenty-six years old.  She is single and lives in the Trinidad neighborhood of Copaínala, in Chiapas State in Mexico.

She works with her ​​brother in a photocopying store, and she is applying for the loan to invest in purchases from beauty brand catalogs including Avon, Jafra and Arabela.   She has been doing this for nine months and says things are going well as she has had good results.

The reason she started this activity was for herself, as she wishes to have her own income to support her daily living expenses.  She counts on the support of her brother, on top of which she provides support for her mother.

What she wants most is to earn her own income from this small activity, so she can move forward in life with her family.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of cosmetics from Avon and Arabela brands.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila de 35 años vive en el centro de Malambo, un municipio a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 11 y 7 años respectivamente. 
Luzmila, inició un negocio de tienda hace 5 años vendiendo pocas cosas, como dulces, paletas, gaseosas, a las que poco a poco fue agregando lácteos, viveros, útiles de aseo y últimamente artículos de papelería y variedades en general, que finalmente logró ubicar  en un local en la casa de su madre. Luzmila es una gran trabajadora, desde hace 20 años también ofrece servicios de manicure y pedicura, oficio que aprendió en una academia y con la que siempre ha complementado los ingresos personales y ahora los de su hogar. Como es muy estudiosa también es auxiliar de enfermería y ofrece servicios de inyecto logia, que le proporciona un ingreso adicional, mientras su esposo como conductor de un taxi,  la apoya en todos sus sueños y los de su familia, que son los mismos sueños, con tal de lograr el bienestar de su hogar y estudios profesionales futuros para sus hijos.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará en mayor volumen víveres, ranchos refrescos, lácteos y dulcería en general, para ganarse descuentos que pueda trasladar a sus clientes y ofrecer mejores precios que la competencia
texts.en:
Luzmila is 35 years old.  She lives in downtown Malambo, a town 10 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  She lives with her husband and two children ages 11 and 7.  

Luzmilla started her store 5  years ago selling a few things such as candy, Popsicles, and sodas.  Then, little by little, she added dairy products, groceries, toiletries and different types of stationary items.   Eventually, she was able to set her store up in her mother's house.  

Luzmilla has worked very hard over the last 20 years.  She also does manicures and pedicures which she learned in an academy.  She has used this to supplement her personal income and now, that of her household.  Since she is very studious, she is also a nursing assistant and offers injections, which provides her with additional income.  Her husband is a taxi driver.   He is very supportive of all her and their family's dreams of striving for the well-being of the family and the future professional studies of their children.  

This Kiva loan is her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with which she will use to buy groceries, snack foods, sodas, dairy products, and sweets in large quantities in order to earn discounts that she can pass on to her customers by offering them better prices than the competition.

loans.use: purchase groceries, snack foods, soda and candy in large volume.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries for grocery shop business.

loans.name: Jenie Beth

texts.en:
Jenie Beth  is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jenie Beth  has a pigpen and she sells mature & full-grown pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Jenie Beth  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jenie Beth  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs she raises and sells.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con educación secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados como ovinos y vacunos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/  1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará una vaca o cinco ovejas para su respectivo engorde por dos meses, en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos.
Su sueño es tener un negocio de prendas de vestir (ropa) y poder vender en diferentes lugares.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque intercambian experiencias y están alegres.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca Communal Bank, which is located in the Pilcuyo District of the Collao Province in the Puno Region.  She is a 51 year-old single mother with two children.  She has a secondary education.  

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for years now.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevo soles, which she invested in her business buying and selling livestock such as sheep and cattle.  With her new loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, she will buy one cow or five sheep for two months of fattening.  They will help her children through helping her business.   

Her dream is to have a clothing business and to be able to sell in different places.

What she likes most about the communal bank are its meetings because they share their experiences and have a good time.

loans.use: to buy one cow or five sheep

loans.name: Mujeres Buscando Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
María tiene una vitrina donD. exhibe  lo que venD., tanto sus productos D. belleza como algunas golosinas como galletas, gaseosas, chocolates etc. este negocio lo tiene en su misma casa permitiéndole estar cerca D. sus hijos,  con los ingresos que obtiene D. su trabajo apoya a su hija que estudia enfermería por lo menos para su movilidad y algunos materiales indispensables para su carrera, pertenecer al grupo “MUJERES BUSCANDO UN FUTURO”  le permite tener sentido del ahorro y el progreso, debido a ello es que ha salido adelante logrando mantener su negocio tanto que ahora con su préstamo esta próxima a comprar una vitrina mas granD. que le permitirá tener mas productos y ventas  en el futuro ya esta viendo la posibilidad D. poner una bodega  en su casa cuenta con el lugar solo le faltaría acondicionarlo para empezar.

* María es la ultima D. la fila esta con chompa negra.
texts.en:
María has a display case for her products. She sells beauty products and sweets such as cookies, pop, chocolates, etc. The business is in her home, allowing her to be near to her children. With her income from this work, she supports her daughter who is studying nursing, helping her at least with transportation and various essential materials for her studies. Maria belongs to the "Mujeres Buscando un Futuro" ["Women in Search of a Future"] group. This allows her to feel that she is saving and progressing, and thanks to this group she has gotten ahead and been able to maintain her business and save. With this new loan she will purchase a larger display case which will allow her to have more products and thus more sales in the future. She sees the possibility of opening a grocery store in her home. She has the space and only needs to fit it out before she can start.

*Maria is the last in the line with the black sweater.

loans.use: to purchase a display case.

loans.name: Jesica

texts.en:
Jessica is 42 years old and lives in Tabo-o Jiminez Mis. Occ. She is married and blessed with four children. For the past year, Jessica has operated a sari-sari (general) store where she sells different kinds of basic products such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, soy sauce, food for snacks, and other items. Jessica's business is a great help to her family to sustain their daily needs. She earns PHP 4,000 PHP. Jessica joined GDMPC in 2009 and has been a cooperative member for two years. 

Jessica is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store like those mentioned above. She has a great plan for her future and for the family, and she wants to expand her business, increase her profit, and purchase a transport vehicle. 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. GDMPC is people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses intends to use the loan to buy rice, sugar and soap to sell. His business is growing despite challenges in price fluctuations and his desire is to have a wholesale shop. With the previous loan, he has seen his shop inventory increase and he is grateful for this loan.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap and sugar

loans.name: Duo Betzabe Group

texts.es:
GRUPO BETZABE
Este grupo esta formado por doña  Maria Josefina de 33 años es la lider de este duo ella tiene 5 hijos,  y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras además de tener una mini tienda en su casa desde hace 5 años, ella solicita este crédito para poder comprar mas producto en frutas y verduras y venderlo ya que la demanda de la gente ahora es mas porque muchos confían en que ella vende verdura y fruta frescas y quiere seguir manteniendo su clientela confía en que se le pueda apoyar nuevamente ya que ya cancelo y por eso necesita que fape le pueda dar el crédito.
Olivia de 29 años casada y tiene tres hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosmeticos en su casa,desde hace 7 años esta solicitnaod este credito para la compra de mas productos y de la misma manera agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Betzabe Group

This group is made up of Maria Josefina and Olivia. Maria Josefina is 33 years old and she is the leader of this duo. She has 5 children and she sells fruits and vegetables. She has had a mini-supermarket in her house for the past 5 years. She requests a loan in order to have more fruits and vegetables. The demand has increase because now many individuals trust that she will sell fresh fruits and vegetables. She wants to maintain her clientele and she trusts that she will be supported once again after repaying the previous loan. She needs for Fape (Kiva Field Partner) to grant her a loan.

Olivia is 29 years old, married, and she has three children. She sells clothing and cosmetics form her house. She has been working with loans for the past 7 years and this loan will be used to purchase more products in order to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 23 year-old business lady. She is married and a mother of three children. She runs a café, a business that has been in operation for the last seven years. 

Mariam has been a KADET client, and this marks her second loan to finance her business. She plans to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables and cereals for her business. Her dream is to own a café.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables and cereals

loans.name: Reina Mariela

texts.es:
Reina, es comerciante de lencería, su familia está conformada por su esposo y un hijo de 8 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender lencería por medio de revistas, la forma de vender es visitando a los clientes, en sus viviendas o trabajos, para ofrecer los productos de revistas, haciendo los pedidos por la cantidad de encargos que los clientes hagan.
Por el momento tiene realizado un pedido algo fuerte de lencería, para esto solicita un préstamo para pagar a los proveedores el monto por el pedido, luego de distribuirlo a los clientes y recibir el pago de ellos.
Este préstamo le ayudara para realizar la compra y darle seguimiento a los clientes, su aspiración es comprarse en un lapso de tiempo, su propia casa.
texts.en:
Reina sells lingerie.  Her family is made up of her husband and one son, age 8. She sells lingerie through magazines.  She visits customers at their homes or at work and offers them products via magazine.  She then places the orders for items her customers have requested.   

She as a large lingerie order, so she is requesting a loan to pay her supplier the amount for the order. She will then deliver the merchandise to her customers and receive payment from them. 

This loan will help her make her purchase and attend to her customers.  She hopes to eventually be able to buy her own home.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie.

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en: Pedra is 38 years old and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 school-aged children. She has a Public Utility Vehicle business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has a requested a loan of PHP 45,000 to purchase equipment for her transportation business. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  Pedra hopes to expand her business in coming years.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her transportation business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, 49, resides in GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Eddie, who is also her business partner.  With her husband, Alicia manages the household and operates their business.  She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alicia operates a food stall. In the Philippines, workers and most families only eat home-cooked meals in the evening because it is the time when all of the family members are home. This is not only a family tradition, but also a matter of convenience and frugality.
