It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two people when it costs less to buy cooked rice and meat.  In addition to her food stall business, Alicia sells homemade snacks and pork meat for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she requests a PHP 39, 000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies of necessary items, like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasoning. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Alicia hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients and products needed for her food stall business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Melanie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Melanie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: San Francisco De Asís Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Graciela de 45 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son dependientes y 2 independientes. Tiene 8 meses siendo socia de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de bebidas como cerveza y gaseosa con el cual lleva 4 años en este negocio.
Comenzó con la venta de gelatinas y helados con la idea de obtener ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades. También se dedica a la venta de juguetes, el cual recién comenzó hace poco tiempo con la finalidad de aumentar sus ingresos. Hasta el momento con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa y aumentar su mercadería. Sus ingresos los destina a los gastos de alimentación y para sus ahorros. Su plan para el futuro es seguir creciendo con su negocio hasta el punto de poder abrir un local propio. Graciela piensa usar el préstamo en la compra de mercadería ya que por campaña navideña sus ventas se incrementan. Ella pertenece a la alcancía comunal “San Francisco de Asís” el cual esta conformado por 7 personas con el cual lleva 8 meses como presidenta del grupo.
texts.en:
Graciela, 45, is single and has four children two of which are independent and two still dependent.  She’s been a member of Edaprospo for 8 months and she sells beverages like beer and soft-drinks, a business she’s had for four years.

She started out selling gelatin snacks and ice-cream with the idea of earning income to cover her needs.  She also sells toys, an activity she started a short time ago aiming at increasing her income.  To date with effort and hard work she’s managed to build a house and increase her merchandise.  She uses her income for food costs and to save.  Her plan for the future is to continue growing in her business until she reaches the point of being able to open her own locale. 

Graciela plans to use the loan to buy merchandise because sales increase during the Christmas season.  She belongs to the “San Francisco de Asís” communal bank which has 7 members; she’s been President of the group for 8 months.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.fr:
Jonathan fait le commerce des cartes de téléphone de tigo ainsi que les cartes sim. Il a 31 ans, marié et ayant 2 enfants dont le plus petit a 1 an et le plus grand a 2 ans et 6 mois. Il a deux personnes en charge et aucun enfant ne va à l’école.  Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans primaire.
C’est le 1er cycle de crédit avec ACB Ltd. Il va utiliser le crédit demandé pour accroître son stock de téléphone.
Jonathan veut être le fournisseur des produits de tigo dans sa région. Pour se faire, il va faire son mieux pour avoir un stock suffisant des produits de tigo.
Avec le profit de son commerce, Jonathan va payer les frais de scolarité de ses petits frère et fera soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jonathan sells Tigo phone cards as well as SIM cards. He is 31 years old, married and has two children. The youngest is one year old and the oldest is two years and six months old. He has two dependents and neither child goes to school. His education level is six years of primary school.

This is his first loan cycle with ACB Ltd. He is going to use the requested loan to grow his stock of telephone cards.

Jonathan would like to be the supplier of Tigo products for his region. To make this happen, he is going to do his best to have a sufficient stock of Tigo products.

With his business' profits, Jonathan is going to pay for his younger brothers' school fees and take care of his children's health.

loans.use: to grow his stock of phone cards.

loans.name: Constructoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Constructoras lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es las señora Martha María de 31 años quien se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 2 ½ años negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de granos básicos, carne, pollo…etc. Ella tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 14, 8 y 6 años y sus hijas le ayudan en el negocio.
Las otras integrantes son  Grethel de 25 años quien vende productos Avon y Mercedes quien tiene un centro de nintendo.
texts.en:
Las Constructoras Group is comprised of three hard-working, enterprising persons.  The coordinator of the group is Martha María.  She is 31 years old and has had a food sales business for two and a half years.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of basic grains, meat, chicken . . . etc. She has four children ages 15, 14, 8, and 6, and her daughters help her with the business.
The other members of the group are Grethel, 25, who sells Avon products and Mercedes who owns a Nintendo center.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, meat, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 07 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  46 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kapala, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec Aby debout  en troisième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et de semences agricoles

loans.name: Javier

texts.en:
My name is Javier Isidoro O.. I’m the owner of a corner store, which is my only revenue source for me and my family.

I had 10 years of experience in the field and in this period my profits have been very good. I would like to have more products in my store and give a better service to my customers in this popular neighborhood where the people appreciate me a lot.

I'm asking for loan of $600 which I will pay back in 1 year. With this money I will buy different products and my customers will have more buying options.

Español

Mi nombre es Javier Isidoro O., soy dueño de una pequeña tienda, la cual es la única fuente de ingreso para mi y mi familia.

Tengo 10 años de experiencia en el campo, sin embargo, en este tiempo a pesar de que mis ingresos han sido buenos quiero tener mas variedad de producto para mis clientes y brindarles un servicio, en esta vecindario tan popular y en donde la gente me aprecia mucho, por lo cual estoy solicitando un préstamo de $600.00 el cual pienso pagar en un lapso de un 1 año, con este importe compraré productos diferentes y mis clientes tendrán más opciones de compra.

loans.use: different products

loans.name: Qahir

texts.en: Qahir M. lives in Aghsu city with his wife and two children. He opened up his tea shop 13 years ago. Tea houses in Azerbaijan are very important to the culture, its a place where men can congregate and discuss current events and play the traditional game of nard, or backgammon. Qahir wants to remodel and enlarge his tea shop as well as purchase new glassware and dishes.

loans.use: Remodel and repair inside of tea house as well as purchase new glassware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest her load in the construction of a foodstand and for the purchase of products to prepare and sell Vigorón, a traditional Nicaraguan dish.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: "I am delighted to be selling provisions and drinks," says Mrs. Grace E. about a business she started three years ago. She is 55 years old and married with six children. She is optimistic that her business will improve if given the sum  of $450.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old and has a CD and computer shop in the Kirkuk market. He is applying to get $1000 from Al-Aman to paint the shop and purchase a new computer with a new printer and scanner. He has three children, and all of them are in school. He is looking to improve his life and his family life. He wants to increase his income and develop his shop.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new computer with a new printer and scanner

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en: Natasha is a hard-working young entrepreneur from Mukachevo, Ukraine. Not only is she busy working in her food sales business, she has also been making preparations to get married coming up on Oct. 27th. Natasha has had her own business for the past seven years. She sells a variety of dry food goods from a little stall at the busy Green market in Mukachevo. This has been a good business for Natasha to be in. Her products are always in demand and a high sales rate brings in good income. Natasha typically makes around $600 profit per month. She has requested a loan of $500 to add to her working capital and allow her to purchase more food inventories. We are happy for this opportunity to help Natasha with her business at this exciting time in her life.

loans.use: Natasha would like to increase her inventory for her dry food goods business.

loans.name: Thi Dan

texts.vi:
Ms Dân is 22 years old. She lives in Nghêm Xá hamlet, Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 young children. She has learned the trade from her husband who is a furniture maker. They custom make beds, tables, chairs ...etc. It takes them 3-4 days to make a bed. Her husband's family has been in this business for a long time so they have a good reputation. This business provides them a steady job. Now they need to upgrade their tools so she has decided to join the fund. She's requesting a loan to buy new tools. She will pay back the loan according to the loan term

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dân 22 tuổi sống ở thôn Nghêm Xá, Bắc Ninh. Chị đã có chồng và có 2 con còn nhỏ. Chị lấy chồng và tham gia vào công việc của nhà chông là làm nghề mộc. Gia đình chị chủ yếu đóng giường, tủ, bàn ghế...theo đặt hàng của khách. Cũng phải mất đến 3-4 ngày mới làm xong 1 cái giường hoặc 1 cái tủ. Nghề mộc là nghề mà gia đình chồng chị đã làm khá lâu và có uy tín, cũng là công việc chính tạo thu nhập cho gia đình. Gần đây, một số dụng cụ làm nghề đã cũ và lạc hậu nên chị đã quyết định tham gia vay vốn để mua mới dụng cụ và cam kết sẽ hoàn trả đúng kỳ hạn

loans.use: To purchase tools for making furniture

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo S. R., single, studied up to fourth grade. He has two children and a wife he is responsible for. This customer used to work in the sugar mill San Antonio, from which he was fired because of personnel readjustment. He now works in the automotive business. To obtain income, he decided to start business repairing bicycles because the money from his termination was not enough to cover the household expenses. For this reason, trying to find a way to get out of this situation, she decided to start his business which is currently the most competitive business in this are in the municipal market of Chinandega.

Mr. R. has been working with CEPRODEL for three years now. He tells us that he feels satisfied with the loans she has received because they have come at an opportune time, and have allowed him to support his family. He says he can't imagine how they could have made it without the help he got through the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Ricardo S. R., soltero, cursó hasta el cuarto grado de primaria, tiene dos hijos y esposa a su cargo, este cliente trabajaba en el Ingenio san Antonio, empresa de la cual fue despedido debido a que hicieron recorte de personal, el trabaja en el área de automotriz, para obtener ingresos decide dedicarse al negocio de reparación de Bicicletas, ya que la plata de que le habían dado de la indemnización ya no le alcanzaba con los gatos de la casa, por tal razón, buscando la manera de salir del problema en que estaba es que decide emprender este negocio, actualmente es el mas fuerte competidor en este negocio en el Mercado Municipal en Chinandega.

El señor R. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres año, nos manifiesta que se siente satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le sirvieron para salir a delante con su familia, dice que no se imagina como hubiese hecho sin al ayuda que obtuvo a través de los créditos.

loans.use: Buying spare bicycle parts (Compra de repuestos de Bicicleta)

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisa D. is a working mother with three children . Her two older children live away from home, but she still cares for her youngest child, who is attending college.

Since 2000, Francisa has worked in a store while her husband works as a sugar cane farmer. Thanks to the investment of some of her husband’s savings, she was able to open this store in the lower level of their home. She appreciates the sacrifices her husband has made to make her business possible.

In addition to her husband’s savings, Francisca took out a loan with the Fundación Paraguaya in 2006. She is very grateful for this support. She wants to continue expanding her business and is asking for a new loan to purchase food items, such as sugar, rice and pasta, to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, pasta, oil, milk and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Aas

texts.en: Aas, 31, is married to A. and has 2 children. They have a pretty large farm with spinach and other vegetables. Every week they sell their vegetables and earn about $15 a week. Aas is a member of MBK and is now asking for a loan of $75 to add to her business capital. She agree to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen I. is 36 years old; she is married with two children and lives in Benin City with her family. She sells provisions and drinks for a living, a business she learned from her mother over a period of 12 months. She started her own business in 2004. She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more provisions and drinks to sell. She has been a faithful LAPO client for five years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong C. is 47 years old and has lived in Phnom Penh since she was born. She works raising pigs to support her family. She makes about $8 in revenue per day. In the suburban areas as well as in the provincial or rural areas, people like raising pigs because this j, and sometime for trade.

Also, she owns a grinding mill, which she occasionally rents to the local people to earn extra profit. One of her daughters is a weaver and earns around $3 a day; another child is now employed, and another child is a student.

She would like a loan from Kiva to purchase more piglets. The rest of the loan will be used to build a small building for the grinding mill.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Pi

texts.en:
Pi T. is 28 years old and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a young housewife with only one child to take care of, along with her elderly mother. She and her mother do limited farming, as well, from a small rice field by their house. However, this is purely to provide for their sustenance. Her husband is a construction worker earning $3 USD per day. This work is somewhat unreliable and seasonal.

Pi T. wants to look into developing their rice field and increasing production by buying a cow to plow larger fields. Once they have developed this business, they will have their fields to fall back on even when construction work is scarce.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer V. is in the livestock business, carrying it out in the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. He breeds livestock, with which he provides sustenance for his humble home.

It is important to note that since he started his business, he has acquired an abundance of experience due to his great dedication and the knowledge he has acquired breeding his animals.

The reason why he looks for support from Ceprodel is that he needs to purchase livestock so he may sell it and in that way, continue with his arduous work with cattle in his sector.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El joven Elmer V. se dedica a la labor de la ganadería desempeñándose en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a la crianza del ganado con el cual lleva el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación.

Es de importancia destacar que desde que inició con este negocio ha adquirido grandes experiencias por su gran dedicación y porque ha aprendido en la crianza de sus animales.

La razón por la cual busca el apoyo en Ceprodel es porque necesita la compra de ganado para comercializarlo y así continuar con su ardo trabajo pecuario en su sector.

loans.use: Purchase cattle.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim M. lives in the Prey Khmer Village, Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a housewife who stays at home and cooks food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Korng Prak, is a taxi-driver whose income is very low. The couple has three children who are still too young to work or study. The family currently lives in an old house; therefore, Mrs. Yim M. needs a loan to combine with her savings for construction of a new house.

loans.use: Construction of a house

loans.name: Sagna

texts.fr: Grace au consommable informatique qu'elle vend, M. SAGNA, parvient a faire face a ses besoins. Maintenant elle demande un pret pour augmenter son parcking informatique.
texts.en:
M. Sagna manages to meet her needs through the sale of computer supplies. She is now requesting a loan to increase her computer stock.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer stock

loans.name: Mr. Eng Am's Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. Eng A. is 45 years old and has four children, one of whom helps Mr. Eng A.'s plantation and another one who is employed in a garment factory. The remaining two are attend the local school. Seventeen people in Chrey Bet Meas Village in Kampong ChA. Province formed a village bank loan and Mr. Eng A. is the village bank president. He is a construction worker who does not earn enough money to support his family. Aside from working in construction, he is a farmer who owns two hectares of land in which he cultivates rice. However, his plantation has become infertile and is unable to produce any more food. To solve this problem, Mr. Eng A. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to enrich his plantation. He would also use the loan to purchase pesticides to kill crop destroying insects. His wife, Mrs. Kong Nuon, is a Khmer cake seller who earns $2.50 per day, which is not enough to support her family. Together, they would like to be able to provide a quality education and future for their children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es: El  Sr. Noel  tiene 34 años de edad, habita en un barrio de asentamiento de los Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 10 y 14 años de edad, los dos están estudiando la primaria, y ella es ama de casa, y apoya a su esposo en las ventas, pues el negocio de don Noel es la electrónica y vende CD y video juegos y comida rapidas como amburguesa, reposteria, desde hace seis años inicio reparando televisores y teléfono, lo cual ha venido invirtiendo y creciendo en inventario para obtener mejores utilidades. Con la solicitud de préstamo la quiere para invertir en la compra de  disco y herramienta de trabajo para la reparación de los equipos. A futuro su objetivo es ofrecer una variedad de productos para incrementar las ventas, hacer mejoras a su vivienda y seguir dando estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noel is 34 years old and lives in a neighborhood of the Laureles Norte zone in the capital city Managua. He and his wife have two children of 10 and 14 years of age, both of whom are studying in primary school. She is a housewife and helps her husband with the business; Noel has been selling electronics, CDs and video games for six years and started repairing televisions and telephones, investing in and growing his inventory to obtain greater profit. He would like to use the loan to invest in the purchase of CDs and work tools for repairing equipment. In the future his objectives are to offer a variety of products in order to increase his sales, make improvements to his house and continue providing an education to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of CDs and work tools

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Sok K. is a villager in Kreang Banteay village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand her business so she decided to ask for a loan to buy ten piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions after she sells her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Nget Poeun, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sok K. is 40 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in different positions while another one is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ten piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Née vers 1963 à  HÊTIN DOGODO  dans la commune de DANGBO, dame    C. Marguerite  est mariée et mère de 3enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement   GF DJIDJOHO DE HÊTIN SOTA  situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du poisson. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 110 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1963 in Hetin Dogodo in the township of Dangbo, Mrs. Marguerite C. is married and the mother of 3 children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GF Djidjoho of Hetin Sota, located near the hot springs of Dangbo. She also sells fish.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Marguerite C. has requested a loan of 110,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 1.5 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Siimoa

texts.en: Siimoa V., 50, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in a plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~333 USD). SPBD loans are Siimoa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The usage of her loan is to purchase gromoxone, chemicals, bush knives and seedlings for the plantation business.

loans.use: To purchase gromoxone, sting, chemicals, bush knives and seedlings

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys A. is 48 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. Currently, all of her children are in the basic school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a suburb of Accra. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, and skimmed powdered milk in her neighborhood. She sells in both wholesale and retail. With the loan, she wants to increase her market size to make enough savings to purchase a van to help distribute stock to her customers. She hopes to raise more income to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya D., 52 ans, mariée avec  02 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter un permis de coupe et faire sculpter des pirogues à vendre. Les pirogues sont comme de petits bateaux faits en bois et utilisés par les pêcheurs pour aller en mer. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Rokhaya D., age 52, is married and has two children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Tenghory Transgambienne for seven and a half years. She wants to buy a cutter’s permit and to have pirogues made and sold. Pirogues are like small wooden boats and are used by fishermen for going out to sea. Rokhaya’s income enables her to help cover family expenses. The loan she’s requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have boats made for sale

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua A. is 50 years old. She is married and has six children, three boys and three girls. She says almost all her children are mature and living independently. The last-born is currently in junior high school. She lives with her husband, a cocoa farmer, and the last-born child in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.

Afua is into palm oil production. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms and adds to what she harvests from her own farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Afua wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She has been in business for 10 years and hopes to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. is 24 years old. She is married and has given birth to a child. According to her, her child is in the basic school. She lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 

Mary is a trader. She trades to support her husband take care of the family. She trades in yams. She procures yam tubers from the farmers in the nearby farming communities at affordable prices. She distributes mostly to food vendors and retailers in her community. Mary says she also cooks some of the yams and sells them with stew. 

She has been trading for two years and wants a loan to procure yam tubers in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin and expand her business.

loans.use: To procure yam tubers

loans.name: Dandy

texts.en:
Dandy O. is a sari-sari storeowner. He sells rice, vinegar, salt, canned foods, animal feed and other goods to his neighbors. He is 34 years old, married and has only one child. Aside from the store, he also raises pigs to supplement their income for buying their needs.

He is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for his store. In that way, he believes he will be able to attract more customers. The loan will also help him improve his piggery. 

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It helps people start and have their own business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage services as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for his sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en:
Lập Hoàng Thị (425970740) is a 55 year old female living in the town of Kim Động.  She is married and has three children who are now adults. To make a living, Lập owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Lập has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, Lập joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lập has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Lập is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be the tenth loan she has taken out from TYM Fund.  Lập plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. He has been working as a furniture painter for five years. Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua so he can purchase tools and paint, and electrical wire for his work. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because he does it well and he is punctual with his work. His clients can be anybody from his region. Ali decided on his business because of his experience in his work. When he first started his business, he didn't have the startup capital. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools, paint, and electrical wire for his work.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. is thirty-five years old. She is a married mother of three children – all sons. One is in the senior high while the others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawsoa in the western region of Ghana.

Agnes is a hard working woman. She works to support her husband. Her husband works for a local timber firm. Agnes runs a grocery store. She sells groceries such as Milo (a brand of malted milk sold by Nestle in West Africa), sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store near the street. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best of education that she can afford.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Komilhodja

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Комилходжа продаёт обувь на рынке Паншанбе, товар привозит из Истаравшана.Свои кредиты он использует на расширение своего бизнеса.На следующий займ он хочет привезти летний ассортимент мужских шлёпанцев и сланцев.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Komilhodja sells shoes on the Panshabe market, he brings the merchandise from Istaravshan. He uses his loans to expand his business. He wants to use the next loan to bring in summer assortment of mens' flip flops.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. in a 38-year-old married mother of four children. She lives with her family in Shanzu, Mombasa where she runs a primary school. The school has been in operation for the last four years.  In the future she plans to expand it into a high school.

Elizabeth is accessing her first loan from KADET. With this 80,000 Kenya shilling loan, she plans to purchase school teaching materials and also repair some furniture in the school.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase school teaching materials, and to repair furniture in the school.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en: Amira is a 30-year-old single woman who lives with her parents. She has owned a clothes shop called "Amira" since 2005 where she earns income to help satisfy the needs of her family. Today, Amira is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase additionA. clothes for the shop so she can satisfy the heavy demands of the market and help increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 16, 13, 11 y 5 años de edad en el distrito de Santa Rosa, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica al comercio de pescado fresco y salado, todos los días se levanta muy temprano y se dirige hacia el terminal pesquero de su localidad para comprar mercadería y luego ir a venderla al mercado del distrito de Pomalca, ubicado a 10 minutos de la Ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su esposo, al igual que la mayoría de los hombres del lugar, se dedica a la pesca artesanal, y durante las temporadas de veda le ayuda en su pequeño negocio, ambos dependen de estas actividades para sustentar los gastos económicos diarios de su familia y juntos se esfuerzan todos los dias para brindarles lo mejor.

Ella desea terminar de construir su casa y también desea seguir invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos brindándoles algún tipo de educación técnica superior por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la ampliación de su negocio con la compra de más pescado para vender a sus clientes.

Manuela es muy conocida en el mercado de Pomalca, sus clientes acuden a ella confiados en la calidad de los productos que vende y sus compañeros de trabajo la consideran una mujer activa y responsable.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 37-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and 4 children ages 16, 13, 11, and 5 in the district of Santa Rosa, located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 5 years now, she has been selling freshwater and saltwater fish. Every day, she gets up very early and heads to her local fish market to purchase fish, then sells it at the market in the district of Pomalca, located some 10 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Her husband—like the majority of men in the area—works in artisan fishing. During the closed season, he helps Manuela out with her small business. They depend on these jobs to cover the daily family expenses, and they work hard every day so that together they can give their family the best.

She would like to finish home construction and to keep investing in their children’s education by helping them get some sort of technical degree. For this reason, she needs to request a 1,100.00 PEN loan from our institute for the very first time. She is planning on investing this money in expanding her business by purchasing more fish to sell to her customers.

Manuela is very well-known at the Pomalca market. Her customers turn to her because they trust in the quality of the products that she sells. Her co-workers consider her to be a very active and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
La señora Leyla, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Martín de Porras”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 30 años y madre de 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Se inicio en la venta de pescado fresco, hace varios años atrás, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital de S/.300.00 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y en variedad de  especies, ubicándose en el Mercado Central “Pomarosa”, de su Ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará pescados frescos en sacos, tanto lo que produce la región como los de la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. 

Leyla, nos manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.

loans.use: Comprará sacos de pescados frescos

loans.name: Ervin Francisco

texts.es:
En el municipio de Condega del departamento de Estelí, el señor Ervin G. se dedica arduamente a laborar en su propio negocio de venta de ropa la que es exhibida en vitrinas y a la vez se dedica a la elaboración de anuncios publicitarios con materiales especiales y ofrecidos a todo tipo de negocios habiéndose destacado en esta labor por ser muy creativo y realizando trabajos muy profesionales.

La razón por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que lo necesita mucho para la compra de la ropa para continuar ofertándola y también para la compra de los materiales de trabajo para elaborar los anuncios publicitarios y de esta manera continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the town of Condega in the Estelí department, Ervin G. dutifully works at his own clothing sale business, which he displays in store windows. At the same time, he creates advertisements out of special materials for all types of businesses and has distinguised himself in his efforts by being very creative and producing very professional work. The reason he has come to Ceprodel to apply for a loan is because he needs it to buy clothing so he can continue offering it and also to buy the materials for the production of his advertisements and publicity material, and in this way, he will continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and the material to make advertisements

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal “Primero de Agosto” de distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 35 años de edad, estado civil soltera, tiene 02 hijos, vive en la Av. Panamericana s/n, ella estudio educación primaria incompleta (3er grado).

La señora inicia su  trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de chifles, nos cuanta que va a comprar, detergentes, artículos de ferretería, betunes, cepillos, papel higiénico, etc ella comercializa sus productos en las ferias semanales.

Su mayor deseo es poder poner una tienda y  darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan las facilidades en el préstamo
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the "Primero de Agosto" Community Bank from the District of Zepita, Province of Chucuito, Region of Puno. She is 35 years old, is single, and has two children. She lives on the street Av. Panamericana s/n. She has a third grade education. Mercedes is starting her work with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos with an initial loan of S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, which will allow her to increase her retail business' capital. She sells chifles (fried plantain chips), detergents, hardware supplies, shoe polish, brushes, toilet paper, etc. She sells her products during the weekly markets. Her biggest desire is to be able to open a store and provide her children with an education. She likes the terms of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of hardware, shoe polish, brushes, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Belina

texts.en:
Belina A. manages a hog-raising business in Panglao, Bohol. She is 53 years old and the mother of two children. She sustains her family with the business she has. She wants her business to grow in order to help her family’s finances and be able to send her children to school.

Belina joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2004. She’s now requesting a loan of Php 6,000 to buy pig feed and to acquire more pigs.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and to acquire more pigs

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara is the leader of this group. She is divorced and has a daughter, 21, who is a college student. About four years ago, Dinara decided to become engaged in commerce. She had been saving money prior to her decision and, after saving some amount of money, Dinara invested it in purchasing goods. Now, she trades in foodstuffs and owns a small shop by her house. During these years, Dinara’s trade has allowed her to live a decent life and even make a repair to her house. Her monthly income constitutes around $140. Now, her occupation lets her meet her daily needs. However, Dinara, aside from supporting her family, also has to pay for her daughter’s education. The amount of the tuition fees requires Dinara to give at once quite a large sum of money, which she cannot do at the present time. Therefore, Dinara saw that the only decision was to apply for this loan. She hopes that this loan will enable her to save time and pay the tuition fee at once. Then her small business would allow her to gradually save money to pay it back. Dinara has many plans for the future. Now, her only care is to give her sole daughter a good education. Then she is going to see her married. After fulfilling her parental responsibilities she is going to invest all her efforts in opening a bigger shop next to her house. Dinara has three partners: Elmira, 43, is currently unemployed. Her husband works as a tractor driver. Elmira has raised five children and the little child is just three years old. Elmira has applied for this loan to buy a calf to raise. Mairamkul, 50, is a widow and is occupied with animal husbandry. She has two sons and the eldest son helps her to look after the cattle. She needs a loan to buy a milk cow. An extra cow would allow her to sell more milk and increase her earnings. Dilarom, 22, is divorced. She is sole supporter of her family which consists of her mother and sister. Dilarom works as a schoolteacher and needs a loan to buy a calf. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been working as a tailor since 1984. Her many years of experience have led her to becoming well known in her town, where she provides products such as clothes, chair covers, tablecloths, and so on. Today, Fatmeh is asking for a loan of $800 USD to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Adalem

texts.es:
La señora Adalem es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Candelaria” desde hace 9 meses, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 38 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos.
Adalem se dedica a la compra y venta de golosinas y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital para la compra de galletas, yogures, caramelos, gaseosas, etc.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1000.00 con el cual podrá comprar más mercadería como dulces, galletas, yogures, caramelos, chocolates, gaseosas, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda completa.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
For nine months, Adalem has been a member of the “Virgen de la Candelaria” Communal Bank in the Ilave district of El Collao province in the Puno region of Peru. She is 38 years old, lives with her partner, has 4 children, and completed her secondary education.

Adalem buys and sells sweets and used her first loan from Manuela Ramos (for 500 Peruvian nuevos soles) as working capital to purchase cookies, candy, yogurt, soft drinks, etc. She is currently requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase more merchandise, including candy, cookies, yogurt, sweets, chocolate, and soft drinks.

Her dream for the future is to have her own store. Her favorite thing about her community bank is the savings account.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy, cookies, sweets, and soft drinks

loans.name: Ermila

texts.en:
Ermila M. is from the village of Becor, Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Ermila owns and operates a business venture in the food sector selling seafood in the local community. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Ermila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ermila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ermila is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the tenth loan which she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Alamurod

texts.ru: Холиков Аламурод проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 58 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Холиков Аламурод имеет среднее Техническое образование по специональности "Бухгалтер". Он работает в области животноводства более чем 6 лет. Холиков Аламурод разводит и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Alamurod H. lives in the Yavan district. He is 58 years old, married and has 5 children. Alamurod has a secondary technical education in the accounting field. He has been working in the animal husbandry field for over 6 years. Alamurod raises and sells livestock. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Juntas Progresaremos Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “JUNTAS PROGRESAREMOS”

“JUNTAS PROGRESAREMOS” es una alcancía comunal conformada por vecinas que vieron la oportunidad en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD de solicitar préstamos, de los cuales dispondrán para mejorar y hacer crecer sus negocios, con ello lograr obtener algún progreso tanto en su negocio como en su profesión.
La señora Guisela tiene 24 años, es miembro de esta alcancía, ella se dedica a ser consultora de belleza para ayudarse en sus estudios de administración de turismo y a la vez criar sola a su único hijo. También tiene un pequeño bazar en casa donde lo llena con productos de catálogo que ella vende, además de otros productos para regalo.
Su sueño es terminar sus estudios, con ayuda de su papá, pagar su curso de inglés, sacar su título y poner su propia empresa turística.
texts.en:
"Juntas Progresaremos" ("Together We Progress") is a community bank composed of neighbors who saw an opportunity in Edaprospo-Prosperidad to solicit mO. loans, all of which allow them to build and better their businesses. With the loans they are able to achieve progress in their businesses as well as their careers. Mrs. Guisela is a 24 years old of this community bank. She works as a beautician to help pay for her studies in tourism administration. She also raises her only son alone. She has a small stO. in her house, which she fills with products from a catalog to sell as well as others to gift. Her dream is--with her father's help--to finish her studies, pay for an English course, get a degree, and have her own tourism business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona tiene 39 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus tres hijos de los cuales los dos ultimos están a su cargo. Reside en el caserío El Vichayal, del distrito de La Arena, en la provincia de Piura, una comunidad rural donde la mayoría de habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, crianza y venta de animales y a la venta de chicha (bebida tipica del país). Esta zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de chicha en su domicilio, también cría animales de corral para luego venderlos a los negociantes de la zona o consumirlos y ofrecerlos en la venta de comida que realiza los fines de semana en su propio domicilio. Estas actividades le han servido para mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante.

Asunciona desea implementar un pequeño restaurante – bar en su domicilio, se ha dado cuenta de que los dos principales productos que ofrece (la chicha y la comida) tienen bastante aceptación por parte de sus clientes y desea aprovechar esa situación y la ubicación céntrica de su vivienda para instalar el negocio, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de sillas y mesas para ofrecer una mejor atención.

Asunciona es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Asunciona is 39 years old. She is separated and lives with her three children, two of whom she still supports. She lives in the “El Vichayal” neighborhood, in the La Arena district in the Piura province. This is a rural community, where most of the residents farm, raise livestock, and also sell “chica” a typical fermented beverage in Peru. This zone is located in the Piura region, three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She has been selling chicha from her home for the past two years. She also raises penned animals and sells them to the businesses within the zone or slaughters them and uses the meat to prepare the food which she sells on the weekends, also out of her home. These activities have helped her support her children and help get them ahead. Asunciona would like to open a small restaurant-bar in her home. We know of the principal products she offers (chicha and food) and that she has loyal customers, and she wants to take advantage of this and her home’s central location. She is asking for her first loan for 800 PEN ($300) through Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use to buy tables and chairs to be able to give better service. Asunciona is a hard working enterprising woman, very dedicated to her family. Her greatest desire is to watch her sons become well off men with professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant tables and chairs

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en: M. Hafiza is 45 years old, is married, and is the mother of five adorable children. Hafiza has a grocery store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her family and her home. She began her small business five years ago with financial support from her husband who is an entrepreneur. The reason for starting the business was to increase her large family’s income and the business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to grow her business further, she requests a loan of 8,900 Somoni. She is planning to spend the loan on purchasing more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of her goods. She thanks everyone who decides to support her. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Sam Oeun's Group

texts.en:
This 15-member loan group has selected Mrs. Sam Oeun C. as village bank president. The members are located in Prey Toteung village in Kandal province. The members will use their loans for different purposes.

Mrs. Sam Oeun C. is a congee and boiled rice seller in the local market. She can earn a small income to support her family’s living. To support her business activities she decided to ask for a loan to purchase tables, an ice box, and pork and beef.

Her husband, Mr. Savoeun Mao, a police officer, receives a little salary to support his family. The couple has two children; one is a seamstress in the garment factory while the other is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase tables, ice box, pork and beef.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos mayores. Reside en la localidad de San francisco, ubicada en la exótica selva tropical peruana, donde tiene su casa propia.

Doña Josefina se caracteriza por ser atrevida en la vida, ya que siempre le gustó asumir riesgos a la hora de abrir un negocio. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao y café, pero no producía lo suficiente por falta de capital, por ese motivo implementó una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le brinda buenas ganancias económicas y emocionales. 
En ocasiones la ayuda su esposo, pero por lo general trabaja sola, su esposo tiene un carro con el que realiza servicio de taxi. En el futuro, piensa ampliar su negocio de abarrotes con la finalidad de atraer más clientes.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece la facilidad de crédito que le brindan. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más productos para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, con el propósito de aumentar su rentabilidad con el pasar de los meses.
texts.en:
Josefina is 56 years old, married and has five grown children. She lives in her own house, which is located in the town of San Francisco in the exotic Peruvian tropical jungle. Doña Josefina is known for being bold in life. She has always taken risks when starting businesses. She used to grow cocoa and coffee, but she didn’t produce enough due to lack of capital. She then started a grocery store, which brings her good financial and emotional gains. Her husband sometimes helps her at the store, but she usually works by herself. Her husband works driving a taxi. In the future, she wants to expand her store in order to attract more clients. This is the first loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments. She is thankful for the opportunity provided. With this loan, she is going to buy more products to increase her grocery store’s inventory and hopes to improve her earnings in a few months.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer, chemicals and raw materials for her tea plantation

loans.name: Precila

texts.en: Precila B.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 50 years old, widowed and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. Precila has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Precila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Precila is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make snack products for sale. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Vong

texts.en: Vong P. is married and resides with his wife (who appears in the photo) and young child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. He is employed at a local garment factory for an income of USD 3 per day. His wife is also garment factory worker who rents parts of the house to workers, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Vong is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to build more rental rooms, and in the future would like to use any additional profit to expand his business.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To build more rental rooms

loans.name: Joël

texts.fr:
M. Joël 45 ans marie avec 6 enfants, née en district de Bugesera, province de l’est du Rwanda, mais il vit avec sa famille à Kigali. 
Il est Evangéliste de l’Eglise de Pentecôte du Rwanda, à part ça il est commerçant détaillant en boutique, il a commencé cette activité en 1990 avec un capital de 1500 Rrw, pendant le génocide perpétré contre les  tutsi de 1994, il a tout perdu, il s’est reconstruit après cette guerre en  commercialisant les marchandises des autres jusqu'à ce qu’il en tire le capital pour commencer sa boutique.Les épargnes continuelles lui a aidé de construire sa propre maison.Les bénéfices tirés dans la boutique combiné du salaire de l’Eglise font qu’il peut faire vivre sa famille. Avec Amasezerano il a remboursé un prêt. Il a contracté un autre pour acheter les haricots, sucre, savons pour augmenter la capacité de sa boutique.ses ambitions et que dans l’avenir est ’acheter une moto pour lui facilité de transport journalière, construire d’autres maisons à louer.
texts.en:
M. Joël, aged 45, is married and has six children.  He was born in the district of Bugesera, Eastern Province, Rwanda.  But he lives with his family in Kigali.  He is the assistant pastor of the Pentacost Church of Rwanda.  Aside from this, he is a retail shopkeeper.  Joël started this business in 1990 with 1,500 RWF in capital.  During the genocide perpetrated against the Tutsi in 1994, he lost everything.  He rebuilt after the war by selling the merchandise of others until he derived the capital for starting his own shop. Saving continuously helped him to build his own house.  The profits from his shop combined with his church salary means he can provide for his family.  With Amasezerano, Joël has repaid a loan.  He has signed another loan for buying beans, sugar, and soaps for increasing the capacity of his shop.  His ambitions for the future involve buying a motorbike to facilitate his transport each day and to build other houses to rent.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sugar, beans, salt, and soaps for his shop

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara, de 53 años, es una madre de familia muy tierna y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. La actividad cotidiana a la que se dedica Sara, son las manualidades en base a tela y bisuterías, además es experta elaborando adornos navideños y para celebraciones importantes. De esta manera ésta actividad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, y con al ayuda de su maquina de coser ofrece buenos acabados en las prendas que cose. Sus clientes son en mayoría algunas madres y amistades que tiene cerca de su domicilio. Se siente muy complacida con el trabajo que realiza, además le permite estar pendiente de su familia. De esta manera han transcurrido 4 años, y lo más difícil para ella; es no contar con material suficiente, perdiendo oportunidades de hacer más trabajo y de ganar más. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su taller y después terminar de construir su casa. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, ya que le será muy provechoso aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará telas e hilos de diversos colores, así como bisutería para continuar con su trabajo de costura.
texts.en:
Sara, 53, is a kind and hard-working mother. She lives with her husband and their 2 children in their own home. Sara's daily activity is making handicrafts from fabric and costume jewellery, and she is also an expert at making ornaments for Christmas and other important celebrations. This activity has become her principle source of income, and with the help of her sewing machine she offers well-finished garments. Her clients are for the most part mothers and friends that she has close to her home. Sara feels very pleased with the work that she does, and it also lets her provide for her family. 4 years have passed like this and the most difficult thing for Sara is not having sufficient material, thereby losing opportunities to do more work and earn more. Her biggest dream is to expand her workshop and afterwards finish building her house. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she promises to make all the repayments necessary, as the loan will be very useful in increasing her working capital. With the loan she is seeking she will purchase farbric in various colours and costume jewellery to continue her sewing business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase threads and fabric in various colours.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
36 years old, Elizabeth S. is a fisherwoman. She is married and has six children. Four of her children go to school. Elizabeth sells fish for a living. She started this business as her livelihood 13 years ago and her ambition is to have a sustainable business to help cover the needs of her family. 

She would like to apply for a loan of PhP 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy a new boat for her husband. In this way, they will be able to continue earning an income to help pay for the education of their children.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El socio está ubicada en el barrio de Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Rosendo; el tiene 63  años de edad y es viudo  tiene3 Hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio minorista, desde hace 11 años, El socio se dedica a la venta de productos secos y los envía a Puerto Maldonado; El socio es solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para su envío.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a part of the “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together) communal bank. He lives in the Arcopata neighborhood, within the Santiago province, in the Cusco department. Rosendo is 63 years old and a widower with three children. He’s been alternating his daily activities between small businesses for the past 11 years, selling dry goods, which he ships to Puerto Maldonado. He is asking for this loan in order to invest in merchandise to ship. He is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and he is committed to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Antonio Pedro

texts.pt:
Antonio  Pedro B. nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane, Sul de Moçambique tem 41 anos de idade vive maritalmente, é pai de 2 filhos de 4 e 11 anos. todos vão a escola, fez a 4ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições, para alêm dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus dois sobrinhos que vivem com ele em sua casa.  

Antonio e recrutado para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório durante 3 anos(tempo regular), muda se para o Distrito de Namaacha onde trabalha como ajudante numa carpentaria. Mais devido a sua ambição opta em abrir uma carpentaria em sua casa. tem como melhor encomenda (cama, cristaleira, porta, aparador mesas) tem uma receita mensal de 8,000.00mt a 10.000.00mt dependendo muito mais da clientela. Com os lucrus inicia sua obra que devido ao elevado custo de material não concluiu solicitando assim os emprestimos na Hluvuku para dar a continuidade da mesma.


Este é o quinto  empréstimo de Antonio na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 25.000.00mt.  com o qual pretende  comprar material de  construçao(arros, tijoleiras e cimento) para concluir as minimas partes da sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores de (5.300.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 12.000.00 e 17.000.00mt) foram usados para a mesma finalidade, esta muito feliz porque em breve mudara para sua própria casa e esta confiante que vai pagar cem nenhum problema porque também recebe uma pensão de 3,260.00mt por mês.
texts.en:
Antonio Pedro was born in the Inhambane Province, South of Mozambique. He is 41 years old and lives in a common law marriage. He has two children who are 4 and 11 years old. Both children go to school. Antonio Pedro went to school until 4th grade and didn't finish due to lack of conditions. Besides his children, he also supports his two nephews who live in his home. Antonio was drafted for mandatory military service and served for three years (regular time). He moved to the Namaacha districted where he started working as an assistant at a carpentry shop. Due to his ambition, he decided to open his own shop at home. His best orders are beds, cupboards, doors, stands and tables. He has a monthly income of 8,000 to 10,000 meticais, depending mostly on his clientele. With his profits he started his construction. He hasn't been able to finish due to the elevated cost of materials and has requested loans from Hluvuku to continue construction. This is Antonio's fifth loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva in the amount of 25,000 meticais. He intends to buy construction materials (iron, bricks and cement) to finish the basic parts of his construction. The previous loans in the amount of 5,300, 8,000, 12,000 and 17,000 meticais were used for the same goal. He is very happy because he will move to his own home soon. He is also confident he will pay the loan back without a problem because he also has a monthly pension of 3,260 meticais.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase o building materials (iron, bricks and cement)

loans.name: Peter Gathogo

texts.en:
Peter Gathogo is a businessman who has operated a retail shop in the heart of Nairobi’s city center for about ten years. He is 50 years old and is married to Eunice Wairimu who 46 years old. The wife is a farmer and she also contributes to the family’s total income. They have four children: their firstborn is 17 years old and their second-born is 13 years old and both are in secondary school; the other two children, age 10 years and 8 years, are in primary school.

Peter leant about KADET LTD through one of its credit officers and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs 50,000. He has no previous history with any other micro-finance institution and he plans to use the loan to purchase more stock for his retail shop and to venture into the distribution of Aberdare maize meal from Nyeri to Nairobi as a secondary business.

In the future, Peter hopes to have distribution stores for food products to supply hotels and schools within the city.

loans.use: To add more stock to his shop and to venture into the distribution of Aberdare maize meal

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Carmen es viuda y tiene 5 hijos, Carmen se dedica a la venta de licores, caña en un local alquilado ubicado cerca de un terminal terrestre, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de caña.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria” (Virgin Mary). She is widowed and has five children. Carmen sells liquor and rum from a rented location near the bus terminal. She manages her business every day with the help of her children.

Carmen needs a loan of 1500 PEN to buy rum.

loans.use: Purchase rum

loans.name: Kalbubu's Group

texts.en:
Kalbubu B. is the leader of the group. She is 52, married. Her husband earns money by working as a school watchman. The couple has 3 children, including the youngest son who helps parents in keeping house. The whole family has been engaged in cattle breeding since 1990. Kalbubu hopes to get a loan for purchasing more cattle (livestock animals). In the future, the family is planning to increase cattle stock and also arrange a son’s wedding.

Jumabubu S., 50, married. Her family has 4 children, all of them help their parents to breed cattle. She started this business 20 years ago following her father’s advice. During these years, they have managed to increase the total number of animals. The loan purpose is to purchase more cattle for further fattening and breeding. Jumabubu and her family hope to improve their wealth by increasing cattle stock.

Gulayim S. has the status of group treasurer. She is 50, married. Her husband is a worker of administrative department. The couple has 2 children; the son raises money by working in Bishkek, the daughter is a student. The family has run their own cattle breeding business since 1994. Their loan purpose is to obtain livestock animals in order to increase their total number of cattle. In the future, Gulayim aims to give proper education to the daughter.

Uson K., 45, married. His wife is a private entrepreneur. The couple has 4 children, one of them is a student, the rest of which help parents in keeping house. The family makes their bread by selling consumer retail goods, following his brother’s advice. Out of profits, they wish to afford to obtain necessary household appliances. The loan purpose is to purchase 3 livestock animals. Later, Uson aims to increase cattle stock, then to enlarge commodity circulation.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
This is 42 year old Laxmi K..  She is married and has 2 children ages 20 and 18.  In 2009 she established her poultry business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.
