She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy small chicks.  In the future, Laxmi plans to raise the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local microfinance institution partner Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buy small chickens for her business

loans.name: Jesus Amada

texts.en:
Jesus lives in the village of Viviano Espinoza in the district of Las Lomas in the province of Piura. She is a single mother. She owns her home and lives with her two young children. She is 50 years old.

Jesus manages a small general store in the front of her home from which she sells basic items such as soap, food items and drinks. She sells beauty products to her neighbors from the Esika brand which provides opportunities to women with low resources. She can be found in her store on a daily basis making sales morning, noon and night.

This will be Jesus’s first loan with Edpmye Alternativa. She has good references and is well respected in the neighborhood. She plans to use the loan to increase her inventory and better meet her client’s needs. In this way, she hopes to improve the opportunities for her family and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and better meet her client’s needs

loans.name: Kungkear

texts.en:
Mrs. Kungkear C., 48, is a widow with one son who is a security guard. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, capital of Cambodia.

Kungkear is a farmer; she grows ginger on her farmland in the village where she lives. She is requesting her first loan of US$700 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her ginger farm.

Pictured: Mrs. Kungkear is at home, not at the farm

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her ginger farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for making pupusas and tortillas

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian U. Jiménez, tiene la edad de 28 años, está soltero y tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad que es su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar unos terneros para el engorde para luego cuando estén grandes venderlos. El cuenta con el terreno y el pasto necesario para su explotación apta  y además el tiene la experiencia necesaria para seguir en el negocio, creciendo como ganadero. Piensa en el futuro de su hijo, pues quiere darle una buena calidad de vida y a su vez repararle una vida digna y un estudio en el futuro, entre otras metas que se propone para su bienestar. 
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Adrian U. Jiménez is 28 years old and single.  He has a five year old child, who is his greatest priority.

Adrian wants to buy some calves to fatten and later sell when they are bigger.  He has the land and the fodder that is suitable for this use.  He also has the necessary experience to continue in the business and grow as a rancher.

He thinks of his child’s future.  He wants to give him a good quality of life, a decent life, and an education in the future, among other goals that he has for his child’s well-being.  

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous loans with state banks.  FUDESCOR has provided the loan with the greatest ease, and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: To buy calves to fatten

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif A. is a 34-year-old man from Sabirabad, Azerbaijan. He is married and has two school-aged children. He supports his family by operating a grocery store. Vasif sells a variety of goods. He started his trading business in 2008 with the help of his family. 

This is Vasif's first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva. He used the loan in 1500 AZN to buy a wide variety of products. He has many dreams for the future. He plans to expand his business, enlarge the store, and have more customers in the area. He is grateful for the support provided to him because it has already allowed him to grow his business. He now earns an average monthly income of 500 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es: Marcia Del Socorro tiene 62 años, su actividad económica es pulpería. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Esta actividad se da por iniciativa propia, Ella es una persona muy humilde y disfruta de su trabajo por lo que siempre está al tanto de los que sus clientes le solicitan. Siempre se ha dedicado a mejorar sus ingresos y cada día más. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas y refrescos naturales. Su deseo es seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marcia Del Socorro is 62 years old.  She has owned a grocery store business for more than 12 years.  She started out in the business on her own initiative.

Marcia Del Socorro is a very unassuming person and enjoys her work.  For this reason, she is always aware of what her customers are requesting.  She has always been dedicated to improving her income day by day and is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, candies and natural soft drinks.  Her wish is to continue improving her home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mira

texts.en: Mira L., 45, believes that she has what it takes to become a successful microentrepreneur. She only reached high school, but with the determination she has to succeed, her poor educational background doesn't matter much. Mira is married to a driver named Benjamin and together they raise two children. One child is already in college, while the other is in elementary school.They live in Paliparan Site, Dasmariñas, Cavite. Running a sari-sari (variety store) is what occupies Mira's daily schedule. She determines which retail items are most needed and wanted by her community and buys them at the local market. She displays them on her store shelves in a way that will immediately get the attention of people in her neighborhood who might need a sachet of shampoo or a bottle of vinegar just to keep going with their busy lives. Aside from her sari-sari store and Benjamin's jeepney operation, they also raise pigs to meet the family's needs. Monthly, they earn around 10,380 Philippine pesos (PHP). To help expand her sari-sari store, Mira applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP. She plans to use this money to purchase more retail items such as canned goods, detergents and instant noodles among other things. With this loan, she will make sure that her store will be capable of meeting the immediate needs of her community. Mira hopes to see her small store grow into a grocery. Therefore, she goes all out to address her challenges and become a better entrepreneur. She wants to achieve this, because her main goal is to be able to support her family and assure them of a bright future. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To add quantities of retail items to her store

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en: Desideria lives in the municipality of Sta. Fe, in the island of Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a shell crafting business.  Her common-law husband Andy, who is 32 years old, works as a trisikad driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  She has four children who are 6 months to 13 years old.  Desideria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Desideria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000 to use as additional capital for the business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Desideria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her business

loans.name: Amerta Kencana Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu S. is the leader of the group Amerta Kencana. Ni Putu S. has two children. The first daughter is still in elementary school and the second child is three years old. As a creative housewife, Ni Putu S. always workhard to support her family income. She has been engaged in the pig business since she married I Ketut Sernen.

To promote her livestock business, Ni Putu S. applied for a loan from MUK. The loan used to buy four piglets that will be maintained for about 4-5 months and then sold. The profits from their pigs will be used for the purpose of supporting the family economy.

loans.use: To buy four piglets

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is one of our associates from Hato Mayor branch, the most rural and agricultural city in Dominican Republic. She is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and increased her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying goods for her Colmado (this is a small food store).

Petronila will use the profits to save and build her house. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying being at her family's house. Petronila tells us that the most difficult challenge has been to build her house.

She is very thankful to have received this loan from Esperanza to invest in her business, and with this loan she will buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, canned meals, and others, to increase her business inventory.

She is a single mom with 8 children, and 2 of them live together in a simple structure home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 39 años, vive en casa de sus familiares con sus 2 hijos. Hace más de 15 años tiene su tienda de abarrotes en donde vende productos alimenticios tanto perecibles como no perecibles, de la misma forma vende variados artículos para el hogar y para el colegio, es así que sola administra sus propios ingresos y los deriva para sus ganancias y otra parte para volverlo a invertir. Esta muy contenta con su trabajo, ya que su economía se mantiene estable, así se prevé para momento difíciles cuando las ventas son muy bajas, por ello procura siempre de dar un buen trato a sus clientes y ofrecer lo mejor con garantía. Su negocio esta creciendo es por esta razón que en adelante quiere tener una tienda más amplia. Adicionalmente a este trabajo también cría cuyes en su granja ya que dispone de una extensión de terreno en donde siembra alfalfa que le sirve de alimento para sus animales. Es su crédito número 8 con MFP,  trabaja en esta ocasión de manera individual y agradece por el capital de apoyo que se le otorga y se compromete ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda y también en la siembra de alfalfa.
texts.en: Isabel is 39 years old, lives with her family members and her two children. For more than 15 years she has worked in a grocery store where she sells perishable and non perishable goods. She also sells various items for the home and school. She manages her own income by saving some of her profits and reinvesting the other portion back into her business. She is very happy with her job since she has a stable income. This helps her prevent difficult moments when sales are very low. She always makes sure to treat her customers well and offers them the best deals. Her business is growing and for this reason she wants to expand her store. Additionally, she raises animals in a farm. From an extension of land she grows alfalfa used to feed her animals. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She works individually and is thankful for the offered support. She commits to be punctual with her payments. With the requested loan she plans to buy more merchandise for her store and more alfalfa seeds for her crops.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store and more alfalfa seeds

loans.name: 5 Tiền Phong  Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hoa Ngô Thị (21) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Hoa is the leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 5 Tiền Phong  Nam Ngan (12.1.5 Nam Ngạn).

Hoa is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Hoa owns and operates a hairdressing and beauty salon. Hoa has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2011, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Hoa is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her beauty salon service. Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:
1. P. Thị T. Hà (22) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

2. K. Thị Thuận (23) is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3. N. Thị Yến (24) is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa Ngô Thị (21) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 5 Tiền Phong Nam Ngan (5  Nam Ngạn).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ làm tóc & làm đẹp cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2011, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. Thị T. Hà (22) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  K. Thị Thuận (23) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  N. Thị Yến (24) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more trees for timber.

loans.name: Shermamat

texts.en:
Shermamat is 50 years old, married, and has eight children. Shermamat comes from a humble family and, from a young age, he helped his father in the fields, which is why he never finished his studies. Despite that, he feels fortunate to be with his wife, who helps him with their farming business. Shermamat cultivates tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and watermelons. He is very thankful for what he has and, thanks to the dedication and support from his family, he can have a dignified life and give a better life to his children. At this time, he is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more seeds and fertilizer that will help him cultivate more produce. 
    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase the seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Arlene has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, biscuits & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of canned goods & snacks.

Arlene is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods & snacks to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda radica por más de 20 años en Huancayo, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Hace 11 años aprovecho la oportunidad de la ubicación estratégica de su casa en su barrio y la necesidad que hay de un establecimiento ferretero  así que decidió invertir sus ahorros en este negocio. Se ocupa de la administración y ventas en  su establecimiento que en la actualidad se mantiene estable porque también vende agregados (arena y piedra) cuyo almacén es el patio amplio de su casa. Sus 4 hijos y su esposo  colaboran con Yolanda en la atención y compra de más mercadería. Toda su familia tiene como meta mejorar este negocio y ser un gran abastecedor de productos de construcción. Ya tiene un amplio historial crediticio y record de ser un cliente puntual en sus pagos, pues este será su 24 crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo los créditos han sido una gran aliada para el mantenimiento de su capital y el crecimiento de su negocio. En esta ocasión con el dinero comprará artículos de tuberías al por mayor.
texts.en: Yolanda has lived in Huancayo for more than 20 years. She lives with her husband and four children. Eleven years ago, she took advantage of the strategic location of her home in her neighborhood and of the need for a hardware store in the area. She decided to invest her savings in this business. She is in charge of making sales and managing her business, which is now stable because she also sells extra items (sand and gravel) . Her warehouse is on the large patio next to her house. Her four children and her husband help Yolanda with monitoring and ordering more merchandise. The whole family shares the goal of improving the business and being a major supplier of construction materials. She already has a long credit history and record of being punctual with her payments. This will be her 24th loan through Kiva partner MFP. Over all this time, the loans have been a great help in maintaining capital and business growth. This time the loan will be used to purchase pipes wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase pipes

loans.name: Monica Del Rocio

texts.es:
Monica de 38 años,  vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Es separada y tienen tres hijos de 2, 8 y 7 años que estudian en escuela fiscales. Se dedica a la venta de ropas y varias productos.

Empezó hace un tiempo atrás a raíz de su separación inicio con la ventas de ropa y varios productos y amplio su negocio. Labora sola de 8H00 am a 17h00 pm. Con el apoyo de préstamo desea incrementar su capital comprando mas mercadería de ropa . En un futuro quiere abrir un local para promocionar mas sus productos y todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Monica, 38, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (so called because at the beginning there were many orchids there) in Guayaquil.  She is separated and has three children who are 2, 8 and 7 years of age and who go to public school.  She sells clothes and assorted products.

She started some time ago due to her separation.  She started with sales of clothes and various products and expanded the business.  She works alone from 8am until 5pm.  With help from the loan she wants to increase her capital buying more clothes.  In the future she’d like to open a locale to better promote her wares and all her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Hector Rosendo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio; el socio tiene 48 años; el socio es casado y tiene 2 hijos, El socio es docente de profesión, el socio trabaja en el colegio particular de varones “La Merced”; E l socio trabaja en esta institución 10 años en el área de matemáticas, el socio está realizando actualmente una maestría en su rubro y en esta ocasión desea el préstamo para invertir en sus estudios. El socio desea terminar su maestría y poder así presentarse a la universidad para obtener el cargo de catedrático cargo que le dará mejor economía monetaria y de este modo podrá dar mejor calidad de vida  a los suyos. El socio trabaja y estudia sin descuidar a sus hijos y apoya a su esposa en todo lo que requiere. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago trimestral de su maestría.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Choquequirao Communal Bank. This bank belongs to the Huanchac district, Cusco province, in the department of Cusco.

He is 48, married and has two children. He is a teacher by profession, and works in a private boys' school called "La Merced". He has worked at this institution for 10 years teaching mathematics. He is currently doing a master's degree in his subject, and he now needs a loan to invest in his studies. He wants to finish his master's and then be able to apply to the university for the post of professor, a job that will give him a better salary. This way, he will be able to provide a better quality of life to his loved ones. He works and studies without neglecting his children, and he supports his wife in everything that she needs. He is requesting this loan to invest in the quarterly payment of his tuition.

He is very satisfied and grateful for the support that we are offering him through this loan, and promises to pay the quotas as established.

loans.use: to invest in the quarterly payment of his tuition.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 31  años de edad,  ella es casada y tiene  2 hijos en edad escolar, cuenta con casa propia, la misma que esta ubicada en una zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque,  cuenta con servicios de agua y luz , el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50  familias.

Paula se dedica a la crianza y  comercialización  de animales menores, aves de corral como patos,  gallinas, pavos, etc.  Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años, el negocio esta situado corrales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.   

Paula esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para ella pueda  invertir en la compra de aves menores para su crianza con sus respectivo, alimento balanceado para aves y cerdos.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización

Paula es uma mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo em su negocio y poder ayudar a su esposo , para que su família obtenga uma mejor calidad de Vida.
texts.en:
Paula is 31 years old, married, and she has 2 school-aged children. She owns her own home and it is located in a rural region in the department of Lambayeque. Her home is equipped with water and electricity. The community is small and it consists of approximately 50 families.

Paula raises and sells small livestock, such as poultry, ducks, hens, turkeys, etc. She has been in business for the past 15 years. She runs her business from corrals located in the rear section of her property. She learned the business from her parents, which is to say that she knows the business perfectly.

Paula requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. She will invest in the purchase of small livestock to raise and to purchase feed, for poultry and for pigs. This business has competition but there is also a large sales market.

Paula is a very hardworking woman and she is devoted to her family. Her greatest dream is to keep growing in her business and to keep helping her husband so that her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock and their feed.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 23-year-old married mother of two. She is a dry fish vendor, a business that has been in operation for two years. 

She is a KADET client and this is her third loan to finance her business. With the money she plans to purchase more fish for selling. She hopes to use the profit from her sales to repay her loan and to also support her family. 

Her hope is to expand her business and to be a good provider for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for selling

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es: María De La Luz de 55 años es madre soltera y desde hace 27 años se dedica a la venta de productos de segunda mano, los productos que ella vende son ropa usada de temporada, Zapatos, Juguetes, Artículos para el hogar, Muebles, Bolsas de dama; María es una mujer emprendedora la cual después de haber trabajado 20 años en una empresa decidió emprender su propio negocio y ser ella misma su propio Jefe, durante estos 27 años el negocio ha sido su única fuente de ingresos ella sabe que entre más producto tenga en existencia para su venta mayores serán ventas  y solicita el apoyo para compra de ropa de temporada y poder ampliar el inventario de mercancía.
texts.en: Maria De La Luz is 55 years old, a single mother and has been selling second hand merchandise for 27 years.  The merchandise that she sells is used seasonal clothing, shoes, toys, home goods, furniture and handbags.  Maria is an enterprising woman, who after working for a company for 20 years decided to start her own business and be her own boss.  During theses 27 years, the business has been her only source of income.  She know that the more merchandise that she has available for sale the higher will be her sales.  She is requesting backing to be able to buy seasonal clothing and be able to increase her merchandise inventory.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the business.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, de 27 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, esta estudiando su Kindergarten mientras el se dedica a trabajar, el es mecánico automotriz, el aprendió este oficio por medio de su padre, quien le enseño a reparar autos, el tenia 14 años de edad, se especializo en mecánica automotriz. Después el decidió poner su propio taller de autos, también aprendió lo que es la soldadura. 
Realizo el préstamo comprar un compresor y unas herramientas de trabajos para reparar autos. Pues necesita tener herramientas nuevas para que le ayuden a repara bien los autos y maquinas modernas que le ayuden a realizar reparaciones externas de los vehículos. Como meta el quiere acondicionar mejor taller ,tener una buena estructura para guardar su inventario de repuestos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 27 years old and lives in the city of León.  He has a 4-year-old son who attends Kindergarten while Francisco works.  Francisco is a car mechanic.  He learned this trade from his father, who taught him to repair cars.  When he was 14 years old he specialized in school in auto mechanics.  Afterwards he decided to set up his own auto repair shop and also learned how to solder.  

He will use the loan to purchase a compressor and tools for his work repairing cars.  He needs tools because they help him repair the cars well and modern machinery that helps him do the body work on the cars.  His goal is to improve the structure of his garage so he can protect his parts inventory.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor and tools for repairing cars.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is married with five children. She is 32 years old and lives in San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Liza owns a sari-sari store (a general store) to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She is a load retailer, too. She earns 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this business and on alternative means every month. She wants to sustain the business, so, she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy grocery items to sell such as cereals, noodles, canned goods, soap, etc. to fill in the emptying store.

Liza has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Liza hopes that with this sari-sari store, she can help to meet their daily needs. A portion of her revenue will be used to renovate her house.
 
======================================

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell such as cereals, noodles, canned goods, soap, etc.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She and her husband have two children, aged nine years old and three years old, for whom they hope to provide good education to the university level. 

Agnes owns a clothing sales business in which she sells materials to the local tailors in Nairobi. She has been running this business for the last nine years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge is that there are other people in the area doing the same kind of business, so her customers are spoiled for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more materials for resale. She hopes to open a bigger shop in the future. She describes herself as ambitious and visionary.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor es socia el Banco Comunal Los Claveles, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 2 años.
Flor vende papa en el Mercado, desde muy pequeña siempre trabajo vendiendo papa, le ayudaba a sus padres, ahora ella tiene su propio capital y se pudo comprar un carro, le encantaría tener otro carro mas moderno, ella se esta esforzando por ahorrar mas y poder cumplir sus metas. Con este préstamo comprará mas papa.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the communal bank named Los Claveles. She is 24 years old and she has 2 children. She has been a member of Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 2 years. 

Flor sells potatoes in the market. Ever since she was a young girl she has been selling potatoes. She used to help her parents and today she has her own capital fund. She was able to purchase a car. She would love to have another, newer car. She is making and effort tot save more and to accomplish her goals. She will purchase more potatoes with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He has owned a grocery store in his town since 2006 and has one part-time employee supporting him occasionally. He sells dairy and daily products. Today, he is asking to borrow $2,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory of added merchandise needed, such as sweets, canned food, etc… In the future, he plans to sell vegetables also from his shop.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory of added merchandise needed, such as sweets, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Melania De Jesus

texts.es: Melania De Jesús se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace mas de 20 años ella siempre ha sido una persona responsable. La mayoría de sus clientes saben donde ella tiene localizado el negocio por lo que llegan a buscar los diferentes productos que ofrece, pues en su comarca no existe una tienda de ropa y aprovecho la oportunidad de establecer este negocio. el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, trajes, faldas, vestidos y ropa para niños.
texts.en: Melania De Jesús has sold clothes for more than twenty years; she’s always been a responsible person.  Most of her customers know where her business is located so they come by looking for the various items she offers because in the area there is no other clothing store and she took advantage of this opportunity to establish this business.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy pants, shirts, suits, skirts, dresses and children’s clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn believes that opportunity is available for everyone; all you have to do is to grab it. Jocelyn's goal in life is to give a progressive way of living to her family. Jocelyn is 34 years old and married with four school-age children.

Jocelyn runs a rice farming business, planting rice on their farm within their village. Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years. She has 1.5 hectares of rice fields, from which she usually earns a net income of P40,000 per crop.

Jocelyn’s income from her last crop was invested in another business for an additional source of income for the family. Some went for the allowances of her children and household use. Jocelyn needs additional working capital to continue her farming business. 

Jocelyn wishes to borrow P40,000 to purchase rice seed, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for rice farming. She hopes to receive the loan and maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for rice farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three bags of maize.

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
Roldan is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 
Roldan has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Roldan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roldan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Camilla

texts.en:
Camilla is 28 years of age and is married with 3 children. She runs a plantation business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 2 years of experience in this business. Camilla needs a loan of 1500 WST to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Camilla joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Camilla's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
This is Ryan, 29, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Single, he manages his household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses

Ryan operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. He rents computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Ryan hopes to expand his business in the coming years. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his computer shop.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.en:
My name is Gloria and I sell clothes and personal products such as cream, lotions, shinolas, sandals and other personal items. I have had my business for several years and it helps me to provide for my family. At this moment I would like to invest more in order to increase my sales.

Loan Use: Purchase socks, handkerchiefs, underwear, shirts and other items.

Me llamo Gloria y me dedico a vender ropa y articulos personales como crema, lociones, shinolas, sandalias y otros articulos de uso personal. Tengo varios años de tener mi negocio el que me ayudado a tener ingresos para mantener a mi familia. En este momento necesito realizar una buena inversion para incrementar mis ganacias.

loans.use: Compra de calcetines, pañuelos, ropa interior, camisas y otros.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila H. (her husband is pictured) owns a small market in the small town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Rahila is looking for funding so that she can increase the quantity and quality of her inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quanity and qulity of her inventory.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina A. is a young and beautiful woman who is 38 years of age. She is married with two (2) children and has been an LAPO client for 3 years. She is experienced in her line of business and has proven her worthiness of a loan from LAPO. She will use the money ($400) to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drugs to sell

loans.name: Azet

texts.en: Azet G. lives in Ashigli village of the Beylagan region. She is 50 years old, and works at the secondary school in Ashigli village. But she is also engaged in cattle breeding. She is a client of Normicro Beylagan Branch. She has borrowed four loans totaling $1900. She bought three cows with these loans, and sells the milk of her cows at the Beylagan bazaar. She wants to increase the number of cows, and so she now needs $900 to buy two cows.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu S. is married with one child.  Her husband is also a petty trader in the same market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. Mariatu is a twenty six year old mother who sells fresh fish  She said her income supplements her husband’s income to meet household expenses.  She increased her business volume with her previous loan and would like to borrow more for the same purpose.

loans.use: To increase stock for fresh fish selling business.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
Location: CaT.-Maputo
Client: Lidia T.
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 20,100 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 804)
Loan use: Purchase clothing for resale
Start date: 10/08/2007
End date: 01/30/2008

Lidia T., a widow, was born in Maputo on December 16, 1962. She is the daughter of a church pastor father and a dressmaker mother. She spent her childhood in South Africa where her parents lived at the time. She attended school until the 6th grade and got her first job as a servant at the Johannesburg airport (Captain Park), where she worked for 7 years. Later she worked at a detergent factory in the same city. She then left that job when she was able to save enough money to invest in the business of buying and reselling electric appliances.

After marrying, she moved permanently to Mozambique and continued with the business. With the profits she built her own home, which has a 7-room rental annex and a mini-mart. Through a church brother she became aware of Hluvuku where she obtained a loan of 20,100 MT to acquire various electric appliances and decorating products for resale. Her future plans include purchasing a mode of transportation, preferably a truck to facilitate the transport of her merchandise and minimize her costs. This would allow her to set more accessible prices and increase revenue by providing transportation services to her business colleagues.

The project has had a positive impact on the community in addition to allowing her to support the 11 people under her care and create 2 jobs.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: CaT.-Maputo Cliente: Lidia T. Actividade: Comércio Valor do Empréstimo: 20.100,00MT (804.00US$) Aplicação do valor : Compra de electrodomesticos para revenda Início: 08/10/2007 Fim: 30/01/2008 Lidia T. viuva, nascida em Maputo, aos 16 de Dezembro de 1962, filha de pai Pastor da Igreija e mãe modista, passou a sua infancia na Africa do Sul onde os seus pais estiveram radicados. Estudou até 6ª clase e teve o seu primeiro emprego como servente no Aeroporto (CAPTIN PARK) em Johanesburg durante 7 anos e mais tarde trabalhou numa fabrica de detergrntes na mesma cidade onde veio a deixar logo que obteve rendimento suficiente para investir no negócio de compra e revenda de electrodomésticos. Depois de casar veio viver definitivamente em Moçambique e continuou com seu negócio e com o rendimento construiu a sua residência que tem como anexo 7 quartos para aluguer e uma mini – mercearia. Atraves de um irmão da igreja veio a conhecer a Hluvuku onde recorrendo a um emprestimo de 20.100,00MT (Vinte Mil e Cem Meticais) para adquirir vários electrodomésticos e produtos de decoração para revenda. Como perspectiva pretende adquirir uma viatura de preferência Camioneta para facilitar o transporte das suas mercadorias minimizando assim os custos de transporte de modo a colocar o seu produto a preço mais acessível e rentabilizar atravês de fretes para colegas de trabalho. O projecto tem um impacto positivo na comunidade pois para alem de permitir o sostento de 11 pessoas que estão na sua responsabilidade, garante 2 postos de trabalho.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob M. is a 47-year-old retired army officer and a resident of the Vingunguti area. Since his retirement, he started a business. He runs a retail shop at his home, selling various items. He now wants to expand his business and increase the stock in his shop so as to look after his family. He is in need of $1,200 to help expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Yolanda Niño

texts.es:
Selling curd and cheese is an important business because people eat these products daily. Knowing this, Mrs. Yolanda Niño R., married with 2 children, has been selling curds and cream in Chinandega city for over 12 years.

This business is one of the most unique today in her area, her sales have increased considerably over the years, and she has expanded her locale and improved the facility. Her initial investment was C$10,000 (córdobas) from her savings.

Yolanda Niño has worked with Ceprodel for 3 years and feels very satisfied with the loans she has received as they have been awarded at opportune moments, helping her meet her business’s needs and satisify her customers daily. She has a history of 18 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de cuajada y queso es un negocio muy importante porque a diario las personas consumen este producto. Consiente de esto la señora Yolanda Niño R. casada y con 2 hijos hace más de 12 años se ha dedicado a su venta de cuajadas y crema en la ciudad de Chinandega.

Este negocio es uno de los mas destacados hoy en día en su sector, sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente al paso de los años, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su local y mejorando la estructura del mismo. Su capital de inicio fue de C$ 10,000 (córdobas) los cuales una parte eran sus ahorros.

Yolanda Niño trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 3 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 18 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase milk

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora is a single mother of two children, a 16 year old boy and a 6 year old girl. They live in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood. Ms. Maria is a small business owner. She runs a small general store out of her home, where she sells a variety of products used in everyday life to neighbors and area residents.

Since this is her family's only source of income, she needs to work very hard to earn enough money to support her family. She needs the loan to purchase more merchandise for her store and to expand the variety of products she offers. This will allow her to increase her earnings to support her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maria Auxiliadora es madre soltera de 2 hijos, un varón de 16 años y una niña de 6 años, habitan en el barrio Villa Venezuela. Doña Maria es una pequeña comerciante que como negocio posee una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, donde atende diariamente a varios vecinos del lugar que buscan los productos de consumo básicos del hogar.

Siendo el único ingreso de su familia, necesita poner mucho empeño para generar los ingresos suficientes para sostener a su familia. Requiere el crédito para invertir en variedad de productos y así expandir su mercadería y al mismo tiempo el ingreso necesario para la manutención de sus dos pequeños.

loans.use: To purchase assorted merchandise for her general store

loans.name: María Dorotea

texts.es:
Maria Dorotea worked at a maquiladora factory, and she noticed that in her town there are many factories whose employees required meals. This is why she took advantage of this opportunity and started selling food out of her home, taking it to factories, and offering it at low prices. Maria Dorotea is a widow and is the sole support of her children of 19, 11, and 9 years of age.

Currently, Maria Dorotea would like to expand her sales to be able to pay for her children's studies. This is why she is requesting a loan for U. $250 which she is willing to pay in a period of 3 months. With this money Maria will be able to buy merchandise to make more food. With your help Maria will be able to move her business forward and help her children so they can go to college.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María Dorotea, trabajaba en una maquiladora y observó que en el pueblo hay muchas empresas maquiladoras y sU. empleados demandaban comida corrida, por lo que aprovechó la oportunidad e inicio la venta de comida en su casa llevando a las empresas a precios módicos, María Dorotea es viuda y es la que sostiene a sU. dos hijos de 19, 11 y 9 años.

Actualmente María Dorotea, desea crecer sU. ventas para poder pagar los estudios de sU. hijos. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de U. $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar mercancía para elaborar más comidas. Con tu ayuda María logrará impulsar su negocio y ayudar a sU. hijos a que estudien una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Buying material to prepare meals (Comprar material)

loans.name: Elidio

texts.en:
Elidio is 25 years old and is originally from Ponta Malongane, a beach 20km north of Ponta D’Ouro, where he currently lives. Ponta D’Ouro is also a beach village, but on the border of South Africa and very famous for its tourism. Elidio and his family moved to South Africa for 10 years during the Mozambican civil war, returning home in 1993.

Elidio didn’t complete primary school. He studied up to 5th grade and left to find a job and take care of his newly born daughter, who is today 5 years old. He is married and just had a new baby boy a month ago. On top of supporting his family, Elidio helps his younger brother (17 years old), who is doing secondary school in Bela Vista (the only village around with a secondary school).

Working at one of the most famous resort/camping ventures in Ponta D’Ouro, Elidio helps with the boat, going to the sea with clients and so on. He has been a permanent employee for 2.5 years now, working from 5:00am to 4:00pm and earning MTn 2,210 per month (around US$90). Life in Ponta D’Ouro is not easy, though. There are no public hospitals or clinics and food is very expensive. Elidio prefers to pay the 20 rand (around US$2) transportation costs and shop in Manguza in South Africa every other week (or at least once a month). Last month he sent his wife to Maputo (the capital) to have his baby, all increments to his monthly expenses.

This is Elidio’s second loan with Hluvuku. He used the first loan of MTn 3,000 to buy bricks and cement to start his own house. He was able to complete repayment in advance and has applied for this second loan of MTn 5,000 to buy aluminum covering to use on the roof. As soon as Elidio finishes paying this second loan, he intends to apply for a third one to continue building his house. All he is missing now are the floor and some other details in order to move there. And he is very positive that next year he will already be there with his family.

loans.use: Buy construction material (aluminum roofing)

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim S. is 49 years old, and have lives with husband and children in Kampong Cham province. Mrs. Sim S. is a farmer and makes around $1 per day. Her husband Ros Ren is 47 years old and works as a construction worker. Usually he earns about $3 per day (pictured here).

Two children are married and live away from home. Two children work in the garment factory and each earns $80 a month; and two children are local workers.

Sim S. requests a loan from Kiva to purchase more farmland. This will allow her to produce more to support the family. Recently, in Cambodia the price of rice is very high because of inflation. So when she produces more rice, she can earn more money to support the family.

loans.use: To purchase farmland to plant more rice

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long M. is 24 years old and lives in Siem Reap province. She sells produce and various food products outside a local Buddhist temple. Long reports doing quite well, actually earning $50 US on a good day! This puts her at the top of her trade easily, earning much more than the average grocery store owner. One of the reasons for her success is high sales to people who buy offerings for the temple each day. Her husband is also a hard worker, doing electrical and mechanical work on cars. He earns about $5 US per day. The young couple has one child, who is too young to attend school. Long M. wants a loan to invest in her already quite successful business; she will further boost her inventory to respond to customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products.

loans.name: Zadith

texts.es:
Mrs. Zadith P. Córdova, member of the Credit Group known as “Las Golondrinas” who lives in the department of San Martín, Province of San Martín and District of Tarapoto, sells parts for cars, motorcycles, and motokars (a 3-wheeled motorized “rickshaw” vehicle). Her business is located in her own residence. She decided to open this business because her husband is a mechanic, and she saw the need they had to travel downtown into the city in order to buy car parts. With this loan of $350.00, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase many different types of parts, automotive fluids, and oil in order to outfit her business and secure sales of the parts which are the most vital to the business. She is married, 37 years old, and has 2 children in school. Like all mothers she would like to see her children become professionals, and thanks to her business they are achieving this. She is a very optimistic and self-assured person and she wants to run her business in the best way possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zadith P. Córdova socia del Grupo de Crédito mientras tanto “Las Golondrinas” vive en el departamento de San Martín, Provincia de San Martín y Distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motos, motokar y carros, su local se encuentra ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Jorge Chávez Nº 1371. Su esposo la motivo aperturar este negocio, por que él es mecánico, viendo la necesidad de que tenían que trasladarse al centro de la ciudad para comprar los repuestos de los vehículos, optaron en poner este negocio. Con el préstamo recibido de S/. 1 000.00 que los pagará en 4 meses, compró diversos modelos de repuestos y accesorios para motos, motokar y carros, como ponchos para palier, terminales, rodajes, resortes, etc. así mismo compró liquido de freno, crucetas y aceite para surtir su negocio y tener asegurado sus ventas, por que son los repuestos que tienen mas salida. Ella es casada, cuenta con 37 años y 2 hijos que están estudiando y como toda madre desea ver a sus hijos profesionales, gracias a su negocio lo esta logrando, ella es una persona muy optimista y segura de si misma, quiere implementa mejor su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of car parts for different models. Purchase accessories and oil wholesale.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat N. is 45 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is an economist. Muhabbat opened her own general store four years ago because good jobs were not available and she wanted to make sure that her family had enough money to meet its needs. This business is one of her greatest accomplishments because she has always dreamed of owning a business and not having to depend on anyone else.

Muhabbat's company sells clothing to children and women. From time to time, she travels to the neighboring town of Istaravshan to buy goods to sell. Her younger son, pictured here, helps out in the business. Muhabbat started out with only a few products, but her business has grown larger and more stable. Thanks to hard work by Muhabbat and her husband, her daughter was able to get married last year. Now, they are focused on giving their son a good education so that he has the best possible future. That is why Muhabbat has applied for a loan of $1,000 to expand her business. She will repay the loan in nine months. She promises to repay it faithfully, as she has done in the past with previous loans, and wishes to thank the people who choose to support her.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Astou Garage

texts.fr: Astou Garage D., mariée avec 03enfants plus 02 autres à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Thièkène depuis 3ans. Elle veut renforcer son commerce  de fruits (mangues) pour accroître ses revenus. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des fruits de la période..<b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance<b/>.
texts.en:
Astou Garage D. is married with 3 children and 2 others in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Thièkène for 3 years. She would like to strengthen her business selling fruit (mangoes) in order to increase her income. Her business consists of buying and re-selling seasonal fruit. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell fruit

loans.name: Ramile

texts.en: Ramile M. is 25 years old. She is married and has a son. Her mother invited her to help sell clothing at the marketplace and she agreed to the offer. This is how she learned the skills necessary to manage a store. Now she has run the store since 2003. She sells woman's clothes, tights, socks and kerchiefs. Ramile thinks it is important to buy new merchandise so she can stock a wider variety of items, which in turn will attract more customers. She has applied for a loan of $1000 USD. This loan will help her to increase her income, and help her better support her family.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise.

loans.name: Maximina Florisa

texts.es:
La señora Maximina Florisa tiene 66 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal San Luis y vive en el barrio Santa Emilia 109 del caserío de Motil, distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el cuarto año de educación primaria porque en Motil había una escuela que solamente contaba con los primeros grados de instrucción. Se casó con Teodoro Flores y tienen dos hijas que aún son estudiantes.
Siempre tuvo su Restaurante y en el caserío se le conoce con el nombre de restaurant Motil. Recuerda que desde que cumplió 20 años, aún soltera,  lo tiene y todos la conocen por este rubro.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, incrementó su negocio con gaseosas y cerveza, además incursionó en la compra y venta de quesos.
Con este crédito de 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, equipará su restaurante.
Su sueño es ver profesionales a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Ms. Maximina Floris is 66 years old, belongs to the Communal Bank San Louis and lives in the neighborhood Santa Emilia 109 of the hamlet of Motil, Agallpampa district, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied until the fourth year of primary education because Motil only had a school with the first grades of education. She married Teodoro Flores and they have two daughters who are still students. She always had her restaurant and in the village it was known as Restaurant Motil. She recalls that since she was 20 years old, still unmarried, she had it and everyone knows her for it. With the first loan of 300 soles (US $100), repaid in 4 months, she increased her business with soft drinks and beers, in addition she ventured into buying and selling cheese. With this loan of 1,000 (US $ 325), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will equip her restaurant. Her dream is to see her daughters become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Equip the restaurant

loans.name: Neema D.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Nema D. S. from Mbeya, married with five children between the ages of 5 and 14. Neema has been running a local restaurant business since 1990. Working at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week and assisted by her husband. Neema currently earns about $200 each month.

She is requesting a loan of $650 in order to purchase more rice, beans, salt, flour and cooking oil in bulk for her restaurant, and in the future plans to expand her business. Neema thanks you for your support!

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, beans, salt, flour and cooking oil in bulk.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Azucenas (“White Lilies”) Village Bank.  She is 32 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. On Sundays, Lidia sells shoes from a mobile cart in the Las Americas Market. The rest of the week, she goes from house to house selling shoes on credit to friends and family members. She and her husband also have a car, which he drives as a taxi in the city of Ayacucho. Lidia needs a loan of $975 to buy different kinds of shoes.  Lidia’s dreams are to improve her business and for her children to graduate with professional degrees. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of shoes

loans.name: Mapusaga

texts.en: Mapusaga S., 29, is married with 2 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the foodstall business. She sells to the villagers and general public 6 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Mapusaga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used in renovating her house.

loans.use: Purchase goods for the foodstall business

loans.name: Reginalda

texts.es: Reginalda se dedica a la elaboración de cómales, y a la siembra de tomate, también vende leña para cocinar. Tiene 9 hijos, 5 de ellos están con ella los otros cuatro ya están casados, viven en la misma casa las esposas de sus hijos, y le ayudan a la elaboración de los cómales.  También vende maíz y fríjol, y por necesidad se dedica a todo tipo de negocio que le salga. Necesita su Préstamo para poder comprar mas material para los cómales y semilla de tomate, y su deseo es poder mejorar en su situación económica familiar, ella es muy trabajadora y confía en que con este capital podrá tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Reginalda makes clay griddles, grows tomatoes, and sells cooking wood for a living. She has 9 children, 5 of whom live with her. The other 4 are already married, but they and their spouses in live her house, so they help her to make the clay griddles. She also sells corn and beans, and does any type of business that she can out of necessity. She needs a loan in order to purchase tomato seeds and more materials to make the griddles. Her wish is to be able to improve her family’s financial situation. She is a very hard-working woman, and she trusts that she will increase her profits with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make clay griddles, and invest in tomato and corn crops

loans.name: Okadeji Laide

texts.en: Okadeji Laide A. is 26 years old, married, and has one child. She sells rechargeable phones. She is requesting a loan of $225 (30,000 NGN) to purchase more rechargeable phones to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more rechargeable phones to sell

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi Y. est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est tailleur à Womé, un village situé au nord ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Koffi exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans. Il espère avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son activité en payant 2 machines à coudre et des tissus pour la revente. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Dans la vue il est celui qui est torse nu en culotte blanche.
texts.en:
Koffi Y. is a young man, 37 years old, married, and the father of two. He is a tailor in Womé, a village located northwest of Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been in this business for five years. He hopes to use this loan to augment his work by buying two sewing machines and some fabrics for resale. He’s counting on this opportunity to change his family’s living conditions. In the photo, Koffi is the one without a shirt and wearing white shorts.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and some cloth for resale

loans.name: Ndèye Coumba

texts.fr: Ndèye Coumba Dramé, 40 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Face Néma à Ziguinchor depuis 1 an et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des tissus teintés. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce pour mieux participer aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye Coumba Dramé, 40, is married and raising 5 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Face Néma in Ziguinchor for a year and a half. Her business is buying and re-selling dyed cloth. She wants to bolster her business so that she can better participate in catering for family expenses. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of dyed cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано Алиёров 1979 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Торгует в магазине конфетами и мороженным.  Кредит получает на расширение  бизнеса и увеличения ассортимента. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2004 года. Кредит получила для расширения бизнеса, а потом за аренду помещения. Теперь она благодарна Микроинвест, потому что улучшила своё положение в жизни. Муж поддерживает ее в бизнесе.
texts.en:
Rano A. was born in 1979. She is married and has 2 children. Rano has a high school education. She sells candy and ice cream in a store. She is taking out a loan to grow her business and increase her product selection. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2004. She took out a loan to grow her business and later for space rental. Now Rano is grateful to MicroInvest because she has improved her living conditions. Her husband supports her business endeavors

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Obaldina

texts.es:
Obaldina es socia del Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero.
Obaldina es casada, tiene 42 años y 6 hijos, Obaldina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas, ropa y también mantas que adquiere en el penal de la ciudad y de las ferias compra queso, cereales que luego comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Obaldina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mantas.
Los sueños de Obaldina son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Obaldina is a client of the Chaska Lucero Communal Bank. She is married, 42 years old, and has 6 children. Obaldina travels to different regional markets where she sells fruit, clothing and sometimes blankets which she acquires at the municipal jail. From the markets, she purchases cheese and grains which she later sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

Obaldina needs a loan of 1000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of blankets.

Obaldina's dreams are to provide a good education for her children, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of blankets

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 41 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Fouad has been working as a mason for three years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase electrical wires and pay for his children school tuition. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Fouad first started his work, he had difficulty building networking and pay for his work equipment. In the future, he plans on improving his work by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: Fouad will use the loan to purchase electrical wires and pay for his children school tuition.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K. runs a boutique shop in her community. She sells all kinds of ready-made clothes, footwear and fashion accessories for both men and women. Her shop is located by the roadside. She buys her goods from Accra and Kumasi. She has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy clothes in bulk.

Grace is the mother of three children, two sons and a daughter, who are currently in junior high and primary schools. She is 35 years old and married. Her husband is a commercial driver. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Grace wants to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy ready-made clothes

loans.name: Chhun's Group

texts.en:
Chhun S., 30, has a business of collecting palm fruits and a kind of insect (large red ants) used for cooking. Her husband usually helps her with this business after his work as a farmer in the rice field and orchard. She lives with her husband and three school-aged children. 

S. has a gross income of $33 US per day. Seeing an opportunity to generate more income for the family, she wants a loan of $1000 US to purchase more palm fruit and red ants to resell. By doing this, she hopes she will be able to have a better standard of living and reserve some savings for her children’s future education.

S. and her husband are in the photo with ants they collected.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits and large red ants

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah P. is a single parent and has two children. Her husband is a trader. Hannah has received junior high school education.

Hannah has a grocery store at Abura where she sells a variety of items. She has been selling groceries like milk, canned drinks, etc. since 2002 and is responsible for paying fees and house-keeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy provision for resale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business and re-invest.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
MYRNA P. is a 48 year-old married woman with 2 children from Brgy. Mabini, Valladolid, Negros Occidental.

Myrna and her husband earn their living through vegetable farming and selling their crop to bulk buyers who go to their farm at harvest time. Vegetable farming is not an easy job and requires the family's full attention and focus. Diligence is required to make sure that the vegetables are pest-free and well cared-for until they are ready for harvest. 

The P. family has so far been blessed with good harvests and Myrna has used most of the money she has borrowed form NWTF-Project Dungganon to buy the materials and tools that she needs to take care of the plants. Thus far, the income from the vegetable farm has been sufficient to support their two daughters' education and the family's basic needs. 

For her 9th loan, Mrs. P. is borrowing PHP 15,000.00, which she plans to use to purchase breeding livestock and  to use as additional capital for her vegetable farm. She hopes to increase the income potential of her family.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Mary Catherene

texts.en:
Mary Catherine U. is a 34-year-old manager of her own business. She is married to Ronnie, 35 years old. She has two daughters to take care of. She lives in the busy town of Morong, Rizal province in the Philippines.  She is a living picture of a mother whose dream is to provide a decent life for her children.

She is an expert in the house rental business, since she has a house in the city and a family is renting it. She receives payment on a monthly basis. The business is good but sometimes she has encountered problems, especially when the lessee could not pay her rent payment for a month. She needed to think of another business to support her house rental business.

In 2002, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with dreams of having capital for her planned business of reselling items. She has been doing the resale business for two years already. The business brings her enough proceeds and seems to be growing. She wants to invest more in her resale business.

On her ninth loan, she requests an amount of 40,000 pesos as additional capital for her resale business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for ten sacks of commercial rice, 45 cases of assorted soft drinks, five sacks of sugar, and ten gallons of cooking oil; all for resale.

She dreams of expanding her business. She also aspires of building an additional housing unit for rent and of course to send her children to school until they finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: To buy ten sacks of commercial rice, 45 cases of assorted soft drinks, five sacks of sugar, and ten gallons of cooking oil; all for resale.

loans.name: Lourdes Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Micaela Bastidas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 45 años y 01 hija ya independiente.

Lourdes Mercedes, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y generar sus propios ingresos sola, sin tener que depender de alguien, decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de bebidas gasificadas y golosinas. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas y haciéndose mas conocida.

En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes y amigos del barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará mas bebidas como: gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Lourdes Mercedes, tiene muchas metas por adelante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Lourdes Mercedes belongs to the Micaela Bastidas Community Bank in the Juanjui district, Micaela Bastidas province, San Martín department. She is single, is 45 years old and has one adult daughter. Lourdes Mercedes is a woman who likes to work and generate her own income without having to depend on anyone. She decided to start her own business selling sodas and candy. It is she herself who runs the business, without having a schedule or a boss. She tells us that she started with S. 300 and began by buying 5 packs of soda. She saw that it was going well and that she lacked enough sodas. Gradually, she invested more and became more well-known. Currently, she continues with the same business and is well-known by her customers and friends in the neighborhood. With this loan of S. 1,000, she will buy more beverages such as sodas in different flavors, sizes and brands as well as sparkling and still mineral water. Lourdes Mercedes has many goals for the future and feels motivated to make them a reality. She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she needed it most. She is responsible with her payments and will continue well.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase packs of sodas.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: Victoire est une bonne cliente de ALIDé qui vend: des poteries, des plantes médicinales et du bois de chauffage à son domicile à Hêvié.
