Victoire achète ces produits à Tori au Sud du Bénin et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Victoire vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille grâce au revenu de son activité. Avec déjà cinq ans d’expérience dans le domaine, Victoire ambitionne agrandir son activité. Cette ambition l’a conduit à solliciter auprès d’ALIDé un crédit.

loans.use: Achat de poteries, de plantes médicinales et de deux camions de bois de chauffage

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor D. Locumba” del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 38 años D. edad, estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Chinumani, ella no tuvo la oportunidad D. seguir estudios.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años es una D. las socias fundadoras, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. detergentes.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar diferentes tipos D. detergentes y para comercializarlos en las ferias semanales.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse una casita.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Sra. Emiliana is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor D. Locumba”, which is located in the District of Yunguyo, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno. She is 38 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in the community of Chinumani and was not able to continue her studies.

Emiliana has been working with Manuela Ramos for several years since she is one her group’s founding members. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to increase her operating capital for her detergent business.

She is now requesting a new loan of 500 soles so that she can buy different types of detergents that she will sell at the fairs on a weekly basis. Emiliana hopes to buy a house of her own. She enjoys her Communal Bank meetings and the simplicity of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase detergents

loans.name: Renepura

texts.en: Renepura E. is from the village of So. Poblacion. She is 53 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Renepura owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Renepura joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Renepura is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida M. is from the village of Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old. Nida is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In November 2009, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Lletti

texts.es:
Lletti tiene 37 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, todos ellos estudiantes y le apoyan mucho en su casa y su negocio.

Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de comida (desayuno: caldo de gallina y almuerzo: platos variados). Para este negocio ha implementado un lugar frente de su casa donde mandó a construir su kiosco para dar mejor a cogida a sus clientes. Lletti no solo vende comida, pues también vende cervezas y gaseosas. Ella se levanta muy temprano (5 am) para preparar el caldo de gallina y los demás platos de comida para después venderlos a los trabajadores de un aserradero que queda al frente de su casa.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y que los mismos se sientan satisfechos de su buena atención y buena sazón. Por otro lado, le es muy rentable porque tiene clientes estables, para ella no hay nada difícil cuando se sabe trabajar, nos menciona.

Esta es la primera vez que trabaja con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque son personas confiables y responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina.
texts.en:
Lletti is 37 years old, a single mother with 3 children, all of them students who help her around the house and her business. For over a year now she has been selling food (breakfast: chicken soup and lunch: a variety of dishes). For this business she has set up a place in front of her house where she built a kiosk to give her customers a more comfortable place. Lletti not only sells food, she also sells beer and sodas. She wakes up very early (5 am) to prepare the chicken soup and the rest of the dishes to later sell to the workers from the sawmill in front of her house. What she likes about her job is to give good customer service and that the customers feel satisfied by her good service and good seasoning. On the other hand, it's very profitable for her because she has stable customers. She mentions that for her there is nothing too difficult when you know how to work. This is the first time she works with MFP and she likes working with her group because they are very trustworthy and responsible people. The money she is asking for is to buy tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina R. is from the village of Brgy, Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Divina raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Divina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Divina joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Divina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Divina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Divina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs. Ya C. is a villager in Svay Chour village in Kandal province. She is 60 years old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops to support her family. She is a widow who has a child who is also a farmer. In their fields, the family has some obstacles because this season is a growing season, yet they did not have enough money to invest in their fields. Thus Mrs. Ya C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Naji

texts.en: Naji is a 39-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Naji has been working in construction. When he first started his business, he had competition and some financiA. issues. Naji is speciA. in his work because he is known for his good work. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financiA. situation.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Victor Orlando

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor Orlando Hernández V., Trabaja como ayudante de Electricista en el área de Mantenimiento, actualmente estudia una carrera universitaria y este crédito lo utilizara para gastos en sus estudios, desde la compra de libros y otros materiales.
texts.en:
Mr. Víctor Orlando Hernández V. works as an electrician’s assistant in the area of maintenance; he is currently studying in college and he will use this loan for his college expenses, such as textbooks and other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For college expenses such as textbooks and other supplies.

loans.name: Julia Narda

texts.es: La Señora Julia Narda tiene 39 años, su negocio que consiste en el servicio de sastrería en el cual se desempeña desde hace 18 años, dentro de las característica de su negocio consiste en la elaboración de prenda de vestir tanto de hombre, mujeres, y niños,  elaborando un promedio de cien trajes o los encargos que tiene solicitado. Por lo que el financiamiento lo solicita para la compra de agujas, tijeras, hilos, botones, carretes aceite de máquina. Por lo que esto le ha permito en el transcurso de sus dieciocho años mantenerse en el mercado e ir creciendo tanto económicamente  como con sus clientes. Beneficio que le ha permitido sentirse realizada como persona, y  madre sabiendo que es una buenas proveedora para su hogar.
texts.en:
Julia Narda, 39, has had a tailor shop for 18 years; she makes clothing for men, women and children. She makes an average of 100 items or the pending orders she has. She is asking for funding to buy supplies like: needles, scissors, thread, buttons, large spools of thread, sewing machine oil, etc. This has allowed her over these eighteen years to remain in the marketplace and to grow economically and with her customer base; a benefit that has made it possible for her to feel fulfilled as a person and as a mother, knowing that she has been a good provider.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en: S. Farzona is married and has a little kid. For almost three years Farzona has spent a great part of her time working and managing her grocery store. She has always looked for a way to generate income for her home, which is why her grocery store is not her first job. Previously, Farzona worked at a traveling fruit stand. However, she thinks that maintaining her store is a more secure job. She plans to continue improving her grocery store in order to have a diversity of goods and to be able to increase her sales. For now, Farzona feels happy to have helped her husband with their family expenses. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase goods to increase the range of items for sale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia sells cooked food, pepper soup and drinks at her restaurant in Lagos to make a living and she has been in the business for a year now.

Olivia is a member of LAPO micro-finance and has a good record. She repays her loan as and when due without any delay. She wants to see her business grow and improve so she is requesting NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell.

Olivia is 38 years old and she has five children. She lives with her husband who is a businessman in Lagos. She appreciates all lenders for their wonderful support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Monsefú, ciudad conocida por sus festividades religiosas y turísticas, se encuentra ubicada a viente minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a trabajar como chofer de una unidad vehícular (combi) que brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros cubriendo la ruta Monsefú – Chiclayo y viceversa. El realiza su labor todos los dias y los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para apoyar a su familia y solventar sus gastos personales. El trata de realizar su trabajo con la mayor responsabilidad ya que sabe que hay muchas vidas que dependen de el .

El continuo uso que se le otorga han hecho que la unidad vehicular empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por este motivo Victor se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil.

Victor es un joven trabajador y que siempre trata de ayudar con el bienestar de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y concidos le consideran una personas tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
Victor is 23 years old, single and lives with his parents in the district Monsefú. A city known for its religious festivals and tourism, it is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Over the past three years he has worked as a driver of a bus-van that provides passenger service covering the roundtrip Monsefú - Chiclayo route. He works every day and his income is used to support the family and meet his personal expenses. He treats his job with great respect because he knows that there are many lives depending on him. The continued use and wear of the bus-van requires some urgent repairs in order for it to continue to function properly. For this reason, Victor has applied for a first time loan from “Edpyme Alturnativa” for 1000 PEN soles which he plans to use for the repair and maintenance of the bus-van. Victor is a young worker and always tries to improve the welfare of his family. His greatest desire is to offer them a better quality of life. In his neighborhood, all of his neighbors and friends consider him to be a calm and reliable person.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for the repair and maintenance of the vehicle

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren T., 46, lives with his wife and 18 year old son in Tuv province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). They have been living together in their current home for 15 years. His son, Otgonbayr, is a university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Myagmarsuren operates a meat trading business with his wife. He started a mobile meat trading business in 2004 with a working capital of 200,000 MNT, and after several years of successful operations has built a working capital of 2,000,000 MNT. Over the past six years, he has gained much experience as a trader. He currently has 80 heads of livestock, worth a total of about 1,600,000 MNT. With his business profit, he has been paying the university tuition fees for his youngest son. In addition he was able to pay for the university tuition of his other children through to their graduations. Myagmarsuren is a very hard working person. He says, “I am  working hard to expand my business and build a house for my family. ” He is requesting 1,600,000 MNT loan to purchase livestock while it is cheap for 1,000,000 MNT, and other raw materials (such as skins) with the remaining 600,000 MNT.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and inventory.

loans.name: Oppus

texts.en:
Oppus Ma. M. is from the village of Baylao Airport, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old. Oppus is married and has adult children. To make a living, Oppus owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Oppus has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Oppus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oppus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Oppus is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Oppus from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida E., from the town of Surallah, is 33 years old, married, and has a three-year-old child. To make a living, Nida has been planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale for over 3 years, earning approximately 3500 PHP a month.,

In 2008, Nida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new one, her fifth, of 15000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and hogs to raise. Nida plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and hogs to raise

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia B. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Antonia is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Antonia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Antonia has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Antonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Antonia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es: La Señora Maria Emilia B. de 61 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos. Maria vive con su hijo y su madre en Barrio La Ceibita en San Lorenzo, Valle. Su hija emigro a los Estados Unidos en busca de una vida mejor y le manda dinero a Maria para ayudarla economicamente. Su esposo murio hace años lo cual ha hecho mas dificil sacar adelante a su familia. Maria se dedica al Comercio, tiene varios años vendiendo ropa interior de damas y caballeros en su casa de habitacion. El prestamo sera usado para adquirir mas ropa y asi poder utilizar las ganancias para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y algunos gastos medicos recientes de su madre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Emilia B. is a sixty-one year old single mother of two children. Maria lives with her son and her mother in Barrio La Ceibita in San Lorenzo, Valle. Her daughter emigrated to the United States in search of a better life and sends money to Maria to help her financially. Her husband died years ago, which has made it more difficult to take care of her family. Maria is a saleswoman who has sold ladies and men's lingerie from her home for several years. The loan will be used to buy more clothes so she can use her earnings to cover the household expenses and some recent medical expenses for her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new underwear

loans.name: Stanslaus

texts.en: Stanslaus M. O. is 30 years old, single and has no children yet. His business is located at the busy Gorofani estate in Tudor-Mombasa. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many, many tourist attraction sites not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches. He has been selling such items as spinach, kale, tomatoes, carrots and others for the last five years to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenges he has to manage is the high perishability of the vegetables and price fluctuations leading to losses. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more vegetables to grow his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He also hopes to become a landlord someday. He describes himself as very hardworking, customer friendly and honest.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Karen Rossmery

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio de Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago , provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karen; ella tiene 40  años de edad y es conviviente y  tiene 3 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la capacitación en gestión empresarial que está dictando una municipalidad a la que ella se inscribió, este curso de capacitación les enseña a producir en el caso de la socia en especifico los derivados de la leche, ella está produciendo, quesos y yogurt, mantequilla. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para poner en práctica lo aprendido y generar su propio negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Karen belongs to the "Vamos Juntos" ("We Go Together") community bank and lives in the community of Arcopata, district of Santiago, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 40 years old, lives with her partner and has three children. She is currently taking business-management courses she signed up for through the city, and these courses are teaching her how to produce, specifically in Karen's case, dairy products. She has been producing cheeses, yogurt and butter. She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients so she can put into practice what she has learned and start her own business. Karen is grateful for those who help her reach her dream through these means, and she promises to fulfill her payments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make dairy products

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 40 years old, married and with two children who are in school.  She runs a cyber café with two employees and she gets many customers.  Jacqueline is also a poultry farmer.   

She has membership with the Integrity group in Faulu, Kenya.  Jacqueline has managed to save some money.  She is requesting a loan of 50, 000 KES to purchase poultry equipment, computers and to meet Internet connection expenses.  She hopes to manage a big cyber café business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase poultry equipment, computers and to meet internet connection expenses.

loans.name: Ndere Bakyara Tukole, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
K. Jovia has really improved her standard of living by starting a grocery and produce store. A member of the Ndere Bakyara Tukole group, she is 53 years old. After 18 years in the farming industry, K. changed her business to sell products like beans, millet, sorghum, maize, and fruits. She sells these from Rwoya trading center in Rukungiri, where she earns 150,000 UGX on a monthly basis. 

A married mother of eight chidlren, Jovia has been working hard, as she knows she has responsibilities to her family, including paying school fees and other necessities. She pays for her family's expenses with help from her husband. One challenge in her business is having a small supply of inventory. This loan will enable her to expand the business by buying more products to increase her ability to sell to customers when they are ready to buy. Having more stock on hand will enable her to earn more sales revenue and, therefore, improve her quality of life. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and build a store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza Q. es una mujer muy trabajadora, que siempre busca las mejores técnicas para mejorar el calzado que ella misma fabrica, con   estilos muy modernos y diseños que cada día salen D. su propia inspiración. Esperanza es madre D. 6 hijos que hoy están en las edades D. 21 a 38 años y que sueña con verlos siempre prósperos y exitosos.  Ella desD. hace 30 años se dedica a esta actividad, aprendida cuando trabajó en grandes fabricas y esta experiencia la llevó a conocer muy bien el mercado D. clientes y  a también el proceso productivo del calzado, incursionando con su producto en la ciudad D. Bogotá y hasta en Cali.
Su gran desafío es la innovación D. sus diseños, por eso permanece cada día como observadora D. los distintos escenarios donD. se exhiben, igualmente la competencia trae un calzado importado, que aunque pueD. no tener la mejor calidad, presenta un buen precio, pero Esperanza se preocupa por utilizar la estrategia D. mercadeo “uno a uno” haciendo que su producto sean a la medida D. sus consumidores. Con su credikiva comprará materia prima e insumos para la fabricación D. 92 pares D. zapatos en la línea  femenina, porque los tiene encargados y desD. ya necesita ponerse en marcha para responder a estos pedidos.
texts.en:
Esperanza Q. is a very hard-working woman who is always looking for the best techniques to improve the shoes she manufactures herself. She makes them in very modern styles and designs that come out of her own inspiration each day. Esperanza is the mother of 6 children, who today range from 21 to 38 years old. She dreams of seeing them always prosperous and successful. She has worked in this field for 30 years; she learned the profession when she worked in large factories, and through this experience, she got to know the market very well, including the customers as well as the manufacturing process for shoes. Her products have entered the market in Bogotá and even in Cali.

Her great challenge is innovating with her designs, and for this reason she spends time each day as an observer in the different places where her products are exhibited. The competition is selling imported shoes, which may not have the best quality but are offered at a good price. However, Esperanza concerns herself with following a "one to one" marketing strategy, so that her product is tailored to her customers. With her loan from Kiva, she will buy materials and supplies to make 92 pairs of women's shoes, because she has orders for them, and she needs to start working to fill these orders.

loans.use: Buying materials and supplies to manufacture 92 pairs of women's shoes, because she has orders for them

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn H. is from the village of Wigan Cordon. She is 28 years old. Evelyn is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Evelyn operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,200 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.fr: P. Clotilde est née le 20 Février 1975 et vit depuis environs quinze (15) ans à PK16, sur la route de Porto- Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Mariée à AGBOTON Alain, un soudeur, Clotilde est mère de quatre (04) enfants  tous scolarisés. Clotilde a un niveau d’étude du cours primaire. Clotilde assure ensemble avec son mari les charges familiales. Clotilde vend depuis deux (02) ans à son domicile du riz, des produits divers (biscuits, conserves, lait, mayonnaise, pâtes alimentaires, savons, etc.). De façon secondaire, Clotilde vend du charbon de bois à son domicile. Clotilde s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, le marché international du Bénin. Afin d’améliorer le niveau de son activité et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, Clotilde sollicite auprès de ALIDé un deuxième crédit. Le premier crédit que Clotilde avait eu auprès de ALIDé a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Clotilde P. was born 20 February 1975 and has been living for the past 15 years in PK16, on the road to Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. She is married to Alain Agboton, a welder, and is the mother of four children, all attending school. Clotilde was educated at primary school level.

Clotilde shares family expenses with her husband. For the past two years she has been retailing rice and various products from her home (cookies, canned goods, milk, mayonnaise, pasta, soap, etc.). As a second line of business, she sells charcoal from her home.

Clotilde gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. She is requesting a second loan from ALIDé to raise the level of her business activity and increase her stock supply. The first loan granted from ALIDé was fully reimbursed.

loans.use: Buy various products (canned goods, milk, pasta, rice, cookies, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Edulfa Floresmila

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a  la señora Edulfa, tiene 53 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado 5 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, su marido tiene un bar y salón.

Se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja los jueves, viernes y sabados desde las 7am hasta las 17h00, la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza en los campos, lugares a los que se traslada para ofrecer sus productos, como ya conoce a las personas a quienes les vende, les deja a crédito y les cobra en tres partes. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil y Huaquillas cada fin de mes.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería. Ella es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y se desempeña como presidenta del Banco, le gusta por los beneficios que ofrece la institución. Su sueño es tener un carro para ir a vender con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
The “La Rosa de Guadalupe” communal bank meats every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its traditional culture and for its location, minutes from the provincial beaches of San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find Edulfa.  She is 53 years old and is in a live in relationship.  Together she and her partner have had five children, who are all fully grown.  Her partner runs a bar and grill.

She sells all types of clothing, door to door, and works on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM.  She makes most of her sales in rural areas, where she travels to offer her products and where she knows the people well.   She sells on credit and customers pay her in thirds.  At the end of every month, she brings new merchandise in from Guayaquil and Huaquillas.

She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise.  She is a founding member of the communal bank, serves as the bank’s president, and likes the benefits that the bank offers.

She would like to have a car so that she can be more comfortable when making sales calls.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann T. is 51 years old, married, and supports her family by operating a carinderia (eatery). She lives in Purok 1, Brgy. 1, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her carinderia (eatery), she is gradually gaining more economically stability for her family. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,600. Mary Ann is now borrowing PHP 23,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her food products. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Mary Ann aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of her carinderia (eatery)

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is a member of Mukombet Group in Kitale town, western Kenya, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years. His main products are tomatoes, maize and beans which he sells locally. He is also a business man and sells kitchen appliances to the local market. 

Nathan is 32 years old. He is married with 5 children who are between the ages of 5 months and 5 years. Two of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 60,000 KES to buy a motorcycle. He says his income will improve from this transport business and he will be able to provide for the basic needs of his family without straining. His primary challenge has been fluctuation in market prices and seasonal changes which always affect the businesses.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: El Sr. Gutiérrez es un hombre muy trabajador y humilde, empezó a trabajar desde muy temprana edad ayudándole a su papa en trabajos de construcción, al formar su propia familia siguió con el mismo oficio, con ese trabajo empezó a levantar su casa, y a comprar maquinaria para instalar una vulcanizadora siempre pensando en el futuro poner su propio negocio en este momento lo a conseguido tiene su negocio el cual lo trabaja su hijo cuando el esta trabajando en su oficio de albañil, el negocio le funciona bien tiene 15 años de haber empezado con el mismo y ya es un negocio estable el requiere el dinero para comprar material que necesita en su vulcanizadora y llantas las cuales compra en buen estado par revenderlas.
texts.en: Mr. Gutiérrez is a very hard-working and humble man.  He started working at a very young age, helping his father on construction jobs.  When he started his own family he continued with the same type of work.  This work allowed him to start building his own house and to buy machinery to install a vulcanizer.  He had always been thinking about starting his own business in the future, so at that moment he started his business.  His son works there as well, and is also a mason.  The business is going well.  Mr. Gutiérrez has been doing this for 15 years now and it is a stable business.  He needs this loan in order to buy necessary materials for his vulcanizer, as well as tires, which he buys in good condition to resell.

loans.use: to buy materials for his business

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy A. is from the village of Dicayas, Dipolog City. She is 42 years old, separated and has four school aged child. Juvy operates a family member's business in the retail sector, selling fish in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Juvy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Juvy is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Juvy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.About PMPC:


Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Konh

texts.en: Konh S., 57, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known for one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. S. is a housewife while her husband is a farmer, earning an income of 1 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 40 USD on food and 37 USD on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 650 USD to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Violita's Group

texts.en:
Violita O., from the village of Poblacion, Sibutad, is the 32-year-old group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Violita, who is married and has two school-aged children, owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling "puto" and other delicacies in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 11 years, she earns approximately 3,100 PHP a month.

In 2010, Violita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 3000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make puto, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to support her family needs.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make "puto"

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase supplies for producing snacks & fast food

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel M., whose wife takes care of the household chores, is the father of two children, 19 and 8 years of age; Daniel and his wife hope to give both a quality education to the university level. They in Mombasa, Kenya, the coastal region of Kenya well-known for its many tourist attraction sites including the Indian Ocean's white beaches.

For the past two-and-a-half years Daniel has owned a general store located at Jomvu estate selling such items as rice, flour, oil, detergents, soft drinks, etc. to the local people. While the business is profitable, financial constraints are Daniel's biggest challenge. However, he works very hard to maintain the health of his enterprise, and will use his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more general items to expand it. Describing himself as very aggressive, Daniel hopes to be a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, detergents, and beverages

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa C. se dedica a la venta D. flores, estampas D. santos y camándulas a las afueras D. un Cementerio D. la ciudad D. Medellín. Hace 20 años se dedica a esta actividad debido a que la violencia hizo que perdiera 5 D. sus hijos y ella debió salir a trabajar para mantener a su familia. Teresa trabaja junto con un hijo y un nieto quienes le ayudan en la atención del negocio. 

Actualmente Teresa quiere capitalizar su negocio con el fin D. poder ofrecer mejores productos y así crecerlo. Ella espera que eso se traduzca en el aumento D. sus ingresos y D. esta forma poder salir D. la difícil situación por la que ha tenido que pasar.
texts.en:
Teresa C. sells flowers, saint prints, and rosaries in the outskirts of a cemetery in the city of Medellín. She has been working in this business for 20 years since she lost 5 of her children to violence and she had to work to maintain her family. Teresa works alongsiD. her son and grandson who help her attend the business.

At the moment Teresa wants to buy more products to offer more and grow her business. She is hoping that it will also help her make more profits to be able to get out of the difficult situation she has had to go through.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of flowers to expand her business

loans.name: Puerta Del Sol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PUERTA DEL SOL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Ana.   Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio

La señora Ana, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es la primera vez que participa en asociación comunal y en Pro Mujer. Ella cuenta que se integro a la institución por la promoción que se hizo en la zona. En la actualidad desarrolla un trabajo de tejido de chompas, en una fabrica.

El dominio de la técnica de tejido es la que le animó a instalar su propio negocio; es por esta razón que con el con el crédito que sacará comprará lana para iniciar su producción independiente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los regalos
texts.en:
The “PUERTA DEL SOL” community association is made up of eight women and is beginning its first cycle in the Senkata office.  Ana is the group’s president and the other women are involved in a number of other businesses, such as selling, production, and services.

Ana says that this is her first time working with a communal association and with Pro Mujer (Professional Woman) and that she joined after they promoted the organization within her zone.  At the moment she makes sweaters in a factory.

Her knowledge of knitting motivated her to start her own business.  She will use the money from this loan to buy yarn to begin working as an entrepreneur.  This will help her earn an income to support her family.  She is married and has two children.  She tells us that when she likes about Pro Mujer are the gifts.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Sabinahon's Group

texts.en:
Sabinahon A. is the leader of this group. She is 54 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She has a daughter of 20 years old, who is a babysitter, and a son of 22 years old, who works in construction. When Sabinahon was young, her mom taught her how to sew clothes and blankets. Sabinahon now takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national clothing and blankets. With money gained from her business, she built a kiosk near her house and sells convenience goods there. Sabinahon hopes to obtain this loan, which she will use to purchase fabric and materials for sewing and convenience goods for her kiosk. In the future, she wants to see her daughter get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some fresh fruit for his shop.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, age 54, earns a living by owning and operating a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Here, she buys and sells such items as canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have four grown children and live in the village of Pahindong, Medina, Misamis Oriental.

In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and was empoloyed as working capital. 

Delia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods, and detergents to offer for sale. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Delia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods, and detergents to offer for sale

loans.name: Riimaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Riimaa is a 46-year-old divorcee. She lives with her four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a clothes retail business for 12 years. She has stall at the Kharkhorin, the second largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. 

Twelve years ago she started up her business with 80 USDs as starting capital and now her working capital has reached 2400 USDs. Recently she has added one more stall at the market to increase her sales and profit. Her three daughters help in her business. 

Last year she started a family house building project and it is not completed yet. The exterior is nearly finished and the interior decoration needs to be done. She is planning to move in  before September 2011. The loan Riimaa is taking will be used to buy necessary building materials such as a cement, sand, gypsum boards, plaster, paint and wallpaper and to complete the interior decoration of the house.

loans.use: To buy necessary building materials such as a cement, sand, gypsum boards, etc.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 56 years old, married and has two children. She is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice to sell. Nida needs fertilizers and other farm inputs. She requested a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. so she could fund her farm. Nida hopes to have a productive farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Wilda

texts.es:
Wilda nació en la ciudad de Acomayo del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 32 años de edad. Actualmente,  Wilda vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. Wilda tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Wilda requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros productos de primera necesidad. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Wilda was born in the city of Acomayo, in the department of Cusco (Peru). She is 32 years old. Currently, Wilda lives in the city of Cusco together with her two children. Wilda has a small grocery store in her home. At this time, Wilda needs a loan to buy merchandise, such as rice, sugar, noodles and other basic necessities. 

The borrower is a responsible and hard-working person, and thanks to these qualities, her fellow members invited her to join the “Mosoc Killa” communal bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Begg Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Begg Fallou est créé le 09 décembre 2010 lors du premier financement du Banc Villageois,il est composé de 12 femmes qui habitent le même quartier, elles sont solidaires et ont confiance entre elles; la principale activité menée est le petit commerce.

La présidente du groupe de solidarité Khady, âgée de 27 ans, est célibataire sans enfant. Sur la photo elle est debout en couleur orangée tout à fait à droite.

Elle fait de la teinture et de la couture depuis 06 ans. Elle achéte ses tissus dans une grande ville.

Avec son prêt elle voudrai acheter du matériel de teinture et de couture.

Avec ses bénéfices elle veut élargir son champ d'action et épargner plus dans le système.
texts.en:
The Begg Fallou solidarity group of the village loan fund of Jappo Dollé Ndiass was created on 9 December 2010. The group comprises 12 women who live in the same area and support and trust each other.

The solidarity group president, Khady, is 27 years old, unmarried, and has no children. She is wearing orange and standing all the way on the right in the photo.

She has been dyeing and making clothing for six years. She buys her fabric in Touba.

With her loan, she would like to buy dyes and dressmaking supplies.

With her profits, she wants to expand her market.

loans.use: To buy dyes and dressmaking products.

loans.name: Anelly

texts.en: Anelly, a 45-year-old married mother of two, has run a posho mill for the last two years. A KADET client, she is now requesting her second loan to purchase another posho mill. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business further. Anelly hopes to be a prosperous businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing another posho mill.

loans.name: Amcha

texts.en:
Amcha is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children for whom she works hard to provide a good living. Amcha is a baker who makes saj bread, a traditional Lebanese bread cooked on a saj, much like an upside-down wok. It is also known as markouk, manakish or manaeesh bread. The dough, which is like a thin pastry, is topped with thyme, cheese or ground meat; some places use other ingredients to make it tasty and attractive.

Amcha used to work with her sister as partners, but her sister was getting too old for such hard work. Consequently, Amcha bought out her sister's part of the bakery and is now the sole owner.

Amcha's business increases during Ramadan. Once the daytime fast has been broken, most store owners open their shops for customers at night. People will eat at nighttime so they can fast during the day.

Amcha is an Al Majmoua client in good standing and has a good reputation. Her previous loans helped a lot in improving her social and financial situations. Amcha is now requesting a loan, her third from Al Majmoua, in order to decorate her bakery so as to attract customers. She hopes to maintain their loyalty.

loans.use: to decorate her bakery.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Hog raising is the business of Criselda. She is 33 years old, managing hog raising for almost three years now. She is a college graduate but due to lack of employment opportunity she got married and chose to live a simple life with her family in their "bario" (a small village). She even shared that through patient hog raising, money is more easily acquired than through working in an office.

She is earning P15,000 every month from the business and is of big help getting medication for her mother-in-law's who had a  stroke due to high blood. She works for her medicine maintenance and her child's future. 	

She is requesting a loan from ASKI amounting to P15,000 to buy hog feed and three pigs to raise. She hopes that she will expand her venture to generate a higher income. Through this she can continue helping her mother-in-law with her medicines and create a stable future for her child.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and three pigs to raise.

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1986. She is married with one child who is small. She lives in Xom Trong village, Uy No commune. Her family has a workshop. Her husband works there. Her husband is a mechanic. He has an income of about 4,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND) per month. Sometimes, Mrs. Thuy helps her husband in their workshop. In addition, she sells vegetables in the market. She has had this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. This is the first time for her to participate in SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more vegetables to resell.

About the other borrowers in her group:
T. is 33 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
Lan is 31 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a 22-year-old lady; she is married to Milton, a 23-year-old man. They have a son, Christian, a one year and nine month old baby. 

Although Filomena is married she and her son are still living with Filomena's parents. Filomena's husband resides and works in another province – Maluku. To make a living, Filomena runs a home-based kiosk business at her parent's house. She has been operating her small kiosk for about two years. She sells kerosene, corn, snacks, coffee, tea, shampoo etc. in small quantities. Her kiosk income is quite helpful to in providing daily meals for Filomena and her son. She is also responsible for supporting her parents' needs as she lives with them. 

Therefore Filomena always tries her best to increase her income. She wishes to improve her kiosk business to generate better income. One day her mother suggested that she apply for a loan from TLM. She looked for more information on the TLM Lending Program by visiting the nearest branch office and she found herself interested in joining the program. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 Rupiah (IDR). The loan will be used to purchase hundreds of kilograms of corn. Filomena hopes that her loan application will be approved by TLM.

loans.use: to purchase hundreds of kilograms of corn

loans.name: Arthur

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Arthur; el tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente del nivel secundario y también es socio de una academia de preparación pre universitaria, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medios de su trabajo y de su negocio el socio quiere salir adelante, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de academia. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar carpetas e implementar la academia pre universitaria.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Arthur is a member of the 'Hatun Rumiyoc' community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

Arthur is 28 years old and single.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his work as a high school teacher.  He is also a member of an academy which prepares students for university.  He works from 7.00am to 8.00pm and, through his work and his business, he would like to get ahead in life.  He would like to expand and improve the pre-university prep school business.  He is requesting this loan to buy folders and equip the academy.

Arthur is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy folders and equip the pre-university prep school

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik works as a engineer. Unfortunately his salary is too low to sustain the family so Gagik is also engaged in agriculture. He would like to expand his business, which requires sufficient financial means. With the requested loan Gagik plans to purchase livestock and forage. Development of farming will help Gagik to increase the business income and insure better living conditions for his family. Gagik lives together with his wife. Gagik's son has left for abroad to work, so development of farming will allow him to come back, get engaged in agriculture and stay with his family.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo, tiene la edad  de  56 años, está casado y vive con  su esposa e hijo. El quiere comprar madera para seguir trabajando. El actualmente cuenta con una mueblería desde varios años atrás y actualmente necesita realizar la compra  de madera para la fabricación de muebles para su venta. E l quiere compra madera de excelente calidad para darle a su clientela mejor calidad de trabajos y acabados perfectos. El tiene como meta poder generar con los muebles fabricados de la madera comprada  mejores ingresos económicos para salir adelante con la mueblería y mejorar su bienestar familiar.   Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Hugo, 56, is married and lives with his wife and son.  He wants to buy lumber to continue working.  He’s had a furniture store for several years and he wants to buy lumber to manufacture furniture to sell.  

He wants to buy excellent quality lumber to give his customers the best quality of work with perfect detailing.  His goal is to generate better income with the furniture made from the purchased wood to get ahead with the furniture store and increase his family’s wellbeing.

This is his first Fudecosur loan.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
The primary source of income for the village where Carmelita and her family resides is through rice farming. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She helps her husband manage the rice field. 

Carmelita hopes to improve their farming practices, which is why she is asking for a loan of P30,000 as an additional capital in buying fertilizers and pesticides for her rice seedlings. She is hoping that through the help of this loan shew will increase crop production to increase her profits.

Carmelita aims to continuously provide a good education for her three children. Two of them attend college and one is in high school. She hopes that someday they will live progressively.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en:
Fozia is an artist; she prepares beautiful flower brocades to sell to generate income for her family. She is also involved in an embroidery and sewing business. She does embroidery and sewing because it also produces good revenue, which she uses to manage the household expenses.  

She is very dedicated and hard-working. After seeing her efforts, her daughter has also started helping her manage her business. Fozia feels happy to see her daughter’s care and sense of understanding towards her.  

With this loan, Fozia will purchase flowers and thread in bulk to be able to prepare flower brocades in larger numbers to sell for a good profit.  
In the future, Fozia would like to save money to expand her business to a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy flowers and thread for her flower brocade-making business.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Leonides has a pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

Leonides has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leonides hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old, separated, and has one child. 

To make a living, Alicia runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-used products to the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 11,400 PHP a month for these activities.

Alicia is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Iris Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Iris   tiene un taller de costura en su casa de habitación, ella trabaja con dos señoras más quienes se encargan de la costura y ella de la administración y de la atención al cliente.
Ella trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.
Ella acude nuevamente a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería como es tela, hilos y dedales para la elaboración de trajes para niños y faldas para damas.
Es el segundo préstamo que trabaja con ceprodel todos para el negocio.
texts.en:
Iris has a sewing room at  her house and works with two other women who are in charge of sewing and taking care of administration and customer service. She works Monday through Saturday from eight o'clock until five o'clock.

Iris recently returned to the CEPRODEL office to request a new loan. She will invest this loan in the purchase of goods such as fabric, thread and thimbles to make outfits for boys and skirts for ladies.

This is the second loan that Iris has taken out for her business with with CEPRODEL.

loans.use: to fabric, thread and thimbles to make outfits for boys and skirts for ladies.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is married and has three children from six months to 10 years. She operates a grocery store where she sells passion fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Dorcas is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy passion fruits. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortages of passion fruits. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to purchase passion fruits t sell.

loans.name: Dasse's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis décembre 2009.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce et l'agriculture.

Celle qui se trouve à gauche de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 53 ans ,est mariée et mére de 02 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de mil,maïs et de l'arachide.Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis sa jeunesse ce qui fait au fil des années ,elle a pu acquérir de l'expérience et se tisser une relation solide avec ses clients.

Avec ce financement,elle compte acheter du maïs pour une valeur de 100000f,du mil pour une valeur de 50000f et de l'arachide pour une valeur de 50000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et assurer la scolarité de ses 02 filles.
texts.en: This group was created in December 2009. It is made up of members who live in the same village. Their businesses are small stores and agriculture. The one who is at the left of the photo raising her hand is the leader of the group. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of two daughters. Her business is the sale of millet, corn and peanuts. She has run this type of business since her youth, and over the years she has been able to acquire experience and forge a solid relation with her clients. With this financing, she expects to buy corn at a value of 100,000 f, millet at a value of 50,000 f, and peanuts at a value of 50,000 f. Her objective is to increase her savings and ensure the education of her two daughters.

loans.use: to purchase corn, millet and peanuts.

loans.name: Sophie Bernadette

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by three women from the village of Diourou, represented by Sophie Bernadette C.. The group describes their business plan as follows:

“This project aims to commercialize the products of African artisans, offering its clients various opportunities to market hand-dyed Bazin (a traditional African cloth), better known as thioub. For this purpose, the group will purchase a supply of both rich Bazin and second-quality Bazin, to match the preference and purchasing power of our clientele.

The clothing market is thriving in spite of the poor economic situation. The traditional boubou (a long robe or dress typically worn in West Africa) is commonly worn by the Senegalese people – young and old, men and women – especially during family celebrations such as marriages and baptisms, on Fridays (when Muslims gather at the mosque for prayer), during Ramadan (a holy month of fasting for Muslims), for the festivals of Korité (known outside Senegal as Eid al-Fitr, this holiday celebrates the breaking of the fast at the end of Ramadan), Tabaski (known outside Senegal as Eid al-Kabir, this celebration marks a high point during the season of pilgrimage to Mecca), etc.

There is strong demand in this sector. In order to be competitive, we plan to set our prices reasonably in relation to our various market targets. We will take full advantage of our address book, which will surely play an important role [in establishing a good clientele base]. This market generally requires a fairly large initial investment, and the profit margins are quite good.

This project aims to meet the clothing needs of our target clientele – children, adolescents, and adults. Its goal is to create employment, and it will allow us to contribute to the economic development of our country, because our long-term objective is to form an official SME (Small/Medium Enterprise, a status which entitles holders to various state-sponsored business promotion services in Senegal), to hire paid staff and therefore create employment, and to import from and export to other African countries such as the Ivory Coast with Wax (a traditional African cloth) skirts, Gabon with Gabonese robes, Morocco with jallabé and other leather or artificial leather accessories – and why not? – with the countries of Asia as well.

Original French:

"Le projet est destiné à commercialiser les produits des produits africains (art…). Ce projet propose à ses clients plusieurs services dans le domaine de la commercialisation du Bazin teinté plus connu sous le nom de thioub. Pour cela, la promotrice s’approvisionnera en Bazin riche et en Bazin de seconde qualité selon le choix et le pouvoir d’achat de sa clientèle.

Le secteur de l’habillement est un marché porteur malgré la conjoncture. Pour ce qui est du boubou traditionnel il y a une tendance pour les sénégalais (petits et grands, hommes ou femmes ) à s’habiller dans ces tenues surtout lors des cérémonies familiales (mariages, baptêmes etc.) et aussi les vendredi, en période de ramadan, lors des fêtes de korité, Tabaski etc.

Il y a une demande forte par rapport à ce secteur. Pour être compétitif par rapport à nos concurrents, nous comptons pratiquer des prix raisonnables pour nos différentes cibles. Nous mettrons à profit notre carnet d’adresse qui jouera sûrement un très grand rôle. Ce marché a besoin d’un préfinancement souvent assez lourd où les marges bénéficiaires sont assez bonnes

Ce projet cherche à résoudre les besoins de nos cibles jeunes, moins jeunes et adultes en habillement. Il a pour autre objectif la création d’emploi et nous permettra de participer au développement économique de notre pays car nous avons comme objectif à long terme de nous constituer en PME, de recruter du personnel (donc la création d’emploi) et de faire de l’import/export vers des pays africains comme la côte d’Ivoire avec le pagne Wax, le Gabon avec les robes gabonaises le Maroc avec les jallabé et autres accessoires en cuir ou en simili cuir et pourquoi pas vers les pays asiatiques."

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Cloth dying

loans.name: Ayisha

texts.en: Ayisha is 40 years old and a mother of 4. She resides at Effiakuma where she runs a small food joint. She has done this business for the past 2 years. There seems to be considerable progress with adequate potential for growth. Ayi has also gone through the TEACH sessions of Kraban Support Foundation. Equipped with these skills she is seeking this loan from Kiva in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: "I changed to this business four (4) years ago and I have no cause to regret it. Though I am 42 years old, my numerous customers always give me satisfaction," says Mrs. Judith O.. She needs the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wears for sales

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie O. sells beverages and bags of pure drinking water to her customers. She is 37 years old, married and has three children. She has applied for a loan which she would like to use to buy additional drinks and water to sell from her shop.

loans.use:
To buy more drinks and bags of pure water
 for sale

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: At 40 years old with three young children, Ana owns a taro plantation right behind her house.  Her husband is unemployed like her and they work together for the betterment of the plantation and the family. It is the only source of income for her family; it puts food on the table and children through school.  She has requested financial aid to buy chemicals that would kill pests and diseases from demolishing the crops.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is 55 years old and has three children.  He runs a stall of used clothing in the Magburaka market.  He tries hard to teach his children about his business and how to be a good business man.  With the previous loan, he purchased 4 – 5 bales of clothes monthly, and the increase in the business is keeping the children busy instead of being idle.  His children sometimes assist in the selling after school and during weekends.  With the profit, Abdul is in a position to meet school expenses.  His plan is to expand the business and train the children to manage it for their livelihood in the future.

loans.use: Purchase additional bales of used clothing at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Emis

texts.en: Emis is a 44 year old married woman. She lives with her daughter. She has a small shop which sells some household goods and usually earns $8 per day.
