She also sells coconut milk rice and fried snacks in the morning. She requests a $50 loan to buy more goods to fill her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Miss Candida M. is a young entrepreneur who has been selling shoes in the Chinandega central market for three years.

She began her business with US$300 that she received as a gift from her mother, and she decided to go in to this business until she can improve her standard of living.

Her plans, if God is willing, is to use her business to enable her to complete her education and university studies in order to become a great businesswoman in the market.

She has been working with Ceprodel for a year and a half and she feels very satisfied with the previous loans as they have been dispersed at opportune times, helping her acquire what her business needed and serving her customers daily. It is important to note that she has a history of 8 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Candida M. es una joven muy emprendedora ya que desde hace tres años se dedica a la comercialización de zapatos en el mercado central de Chinandega.

Comenzó su negocio con un capital de U$ 300 que los obtuvo como regalo de su mama y decidió de manera personal dedicarse a este negocio hasta poder progresar y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Son sus planes si Dios así se lo permite y poniendo de su empeño poder realizar sus estudios y profesionalizarse para poder llegar a ser una gran comerciante en el mercado de su localidad.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace año y medio por lo que se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Es importante destacar que ella tiene un record de 8 créditos.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a twenty nine year old single mother with two children ages three and six.  For ten years, Juana has sold clothes and music in the San Lorenzo market.  The business was inherited from her mother who became too old to work.  Thanks to Juana’s dedication and hard work she has been able to save enough money to finish constructing a house for her and her daughters.  She is also earning enough income to pay for her daughter to attend school.  

With this loan, Juana will purchase more clothes and music to sell.  In the future she wants to buy her own store to sell all types of merchandise and hopes that with an increase in business she will be able to employ others as well.

loans.use: To buy music disks and clothes.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
When Maria del Carmen saw that what her husband made as a laborer was not enough to cover the household expenses, she started buying and selling bread among the neighbors of their community. This business has turned out well for them, although now she does not want to buy the bread to re-sell, but rather produce it on her own.

This is why she is requesting a loan for US $300, which she is determined to pay in a period of 5 months. With this money, Maria del Carmen will be able to buy material to make the bread and increase her profit margin. With your help, Maria del Carmen will help her family succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María del Carmen al ver que su marido no le alcanzaba con lo que ganaba como albañil para cubrir los gastos de la casa, ella inicio la compra y venta de pan entre los vecinos de la comunidad, negocio que le ha ido resultando, aunque ahora desea no comprarlos para revender sino elaborarlos por su cuenta.

Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero María del Carmen podrá comprar material para elaborar los panes y así poder tener más margen de ganancias. Con tu ayuda María del Carme podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Buying materials to make bread (Comprar material para elaborar los panes)

loans.name: Faapito

texts.en: Faapito G. is a 36-year old mother of 4 children. Faapito used to be employed at Samoan National Provident Fund, but resigned 3 years ago due to her husband's illness. When Faapito left work, she joined SPBD for financial support in starting up her business, which is now very successful. Her business has helped her support her family very well. And she aims to stay in the program and continue doing her business, so that she can move up to another level of success. She hopes that one day she’ll be able to turn her BBQ business into a restaurant. She wants to give her children the best education so that they can be well employed in the future and help her out with her dream.

loans.use: To purchase lamb ribs, chicken, sausages and rice for her BBQ business

loans.name: Khlot

texts.en: Mr. Khlot H. has a grind machine and makes about $6.5 per day. His wife, Mrs. Khun Hov makes about $2 per day breeding pigs. They live with their eight children in Phka Rumchek Village, Siem Reap Province. With growing family expenses, they need to expand their business. They seek a loan of $1,200 to purchase rice stock for resell. This loan will expand their business and improve their income to support their family sufficiently. (The Photo is H.’s wife)

loans.use: To purchase rice stock to resell

loans.name: Nalwoga, Kyosiga Group

texts.en:
N. Edisa has a stall where she sells cabbage, pineapples, tomatoes, onions, carrots, spices and so much more. She lives in Kisoga and she has been a member of her group, Kyosiga, since its inception.

Edisa is a widow with five children from 4 to 14 years of age, all in school, and she pays their school fees single-handedly with the help of loans. She now has another baby who is provided for by its father. Edisa buys her goods from farmers in the villages. With the loan, she intends to buy more vegetables and fruit for sale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and spices for sale.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina M. G. D. Paz belongs to the "La Violetas II" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín region, Rioja province, in the district of Nueva Cajamarca. Her business is located in the local market and she sells fruit which grows in the region.

When she separated from her husband, and with the need to support her children, her only idea was to start up a business selling fruit. She got a stand in the market, and thanks to her own efforts managed to increase her sales and to gain the appreciation and admiration of many customers.

With a loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy some of the local fruit, such as: oranges, mandarin oranges, sweet granadilla (grenadia), taperiba, coconas, ripe bananas and green bananas, and papayas, so that she can have her stand stocked and meet the demand of her customers.

Alejandrina is 48 years old and every day works to show that she is an enterprising woman who stops at nothing to reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alejandrina M. Garcia D. Paz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas II,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia D. Rioja y distrito Nueva Cajamarca, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado D. la misma localidad se dedica a la venta D. frutas propias D. la zona.

Al separarse D. su esposo y con el afán D. sacar adelante a sus hijos no tuvo mejor idea que iniciarse en el negocio D. venta D. frutas, para ello consiguió un puesto en el mercado, gracias al esfuerzo propio ha logrado incrementar sus ventas, habiendo ganado el aprecio y la acogida D. una gran clientela.

Con el crédito D. S/.1,000.00,el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversas frutas D. la región como: naranjas, mandarinas, granadillas, taperiva, coconas en cientos, plátanos y guineos en racimos, papayas, para así tener abastecido su puesto y satisfacer la exigencia D. sus clientes.

Alejandrina tiene 48 años, trabaja diariamente demostrando que es una mujer emprendedora que para cumplir sus metas no hay límites.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of fruit.

loans.name: Fransica

texts.en:
Fransica is a 32-year-old married woman with two children, ages 13 and 6. She began selling clothes in 2007. She works from 7AM to 6PM each day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Fransica now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou D. est une femme divorcée, mère de 03 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour faire un commerce de fruits locaux saisonniers et plus particulièrement de mangues et de pastèques actuellement puisque c’est la saison. Elle veut satisfaire ses propres besoins quotidiens et assurer de meilleures conditions de vie sa famille. <b>Elle pourra rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Codou D. is a divorced woman with 3 children. She is asking for this loan to run a business selling local seasonal fruits, specifically mangoes and watermelons currently, since they are in season. She would like to meet her own daily needs and ensure better living conditions for her family. She will be able to reimburse this loan at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell fruit (mangoes and watermelons specifically)

loans.name: Shahmurad

texts.en: Shahmurad is 30 years old. He is single and lives in Khachaz, Azerbaijan. Five years ago he started a sheep-breeding business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a cow and baling presses to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy a cow and baling presses

loans.name: Erminia Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Erminia Isabel Áreas tiene 43 años de edad su estado civil es de acompañada, tiene 3 hijos con edades comprendidas entre 20, 18 y 14 años de edad todos estudian actualmente la secundaria en un colegio publico  su compañero de vida es soldador, también presta los servicio como aserrador, lo propósitos que desea lograr son trabajar para mejorar sus condiciones de vida como es en cuanto a infraestructura se refiere ya que sus condiciones son bastante limitadas y en época de invierno se ve afectada así poder proporcionarle a sus hijos un hogar  y un techo donde vivir.

La actividad económica de doña Erminia, es el destace de cerdo, compra y venta de cerdo en pie, comprando en zonas aledañas dentro de su jurisdicción domiciliar siendo esta en Quezalguaque, el tiempo que tiene de tener el negocio es de 2 años y medio el negocio empieza de la necesidad  de ayudarle a su compañero en los gastos correspondientes de su casa por lo que cada día que pasa las cosas están mas difíciles debido a la diferente situación económica y el costo de la vida esta mas difícil y tratar de esta forma de obtener otros ingresos  para el hogar y poder ayudar en la manutención de la familia con la ayuda de la organización fundación león 2000 y aquellos programas que beneficien a nuestros microempresarios con visión de negocio.
texts.en:
Erminia Isabel Áreas is 43 years old, lives with her partner and has three children ages 10, 18 and 14, all of whom study in a public secondary school. Her life-long partner is a welder and also works as a lumberjack. The goals she wishes to achieve are work to improve their living conditions with regard to the infrastructure as her living conditions are rather limited and in winter greatly affected so she would like to be able to provide her children a home and a roof where they can live. Erminia has a business raising, selling and butchering pigs. She buys in neighboring villages within her home’s region, which is Quezalguaque. She has had this business for 2.5 years, beginning the business out of the necessity to help her partner with the household expenses because every day that passes things are more difficult due to the different economic situation and the cost of living is more difficult and this is a way to obtain additional income for the home and help support the family with the help of the León 2000 Foundation organization and those programs that benefit our microbusinesses with a business vision.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sokhoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoun N. is a 29-year-old grocery seller who has been in business since early 2007, selling out of her home and earning around US $4.00 per day. She is the mother of two children, both students who also help her with her business. Sokhoun is married to Mr. Sokaiy Hang, 35, a goldsmith.

Recently Sokhoun has been selling her goods until she is completely out of stock. She is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase more grocery inventory to stock and resell. This will allow her to increase her revenue and meet her family's living expenses.

Sokhoun and her family live in the area of Resey Krok Commune, Banteay Meanchey Province.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 63 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Se dedica a la crianza de cuyes desde hace 6 años, y gracias a que sus animalitos aumentan rápidamente puede venderlos en los mercados o atiende solo pedidos en su domicilio. Delia  disfruta de criar estos animalitos y ver como aumentan día a día  la motiva a seguir cuidándolos y alimentándolas de la mejor manera, así incrementan su valor por peso, y se logra obtener buenas ganancias. Sin embargo,  es muy delicada la alimentación de estos cuyes, si no se tienes en debido cuidado  en darles los pastos adecuados, tienden a morir rápidamente. Este es quinto préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tuvo problemas de pago. Con el dinero solicitado comprará cuyes de raza para mejorar la calidad de sus animales y darles un valor agregado.
texts.en:
Delia is 63 years old and lives with her husband and son. For six years she has raised guinea pigs [a Peruvian delicacy]. Because the animals reproduce and grow so rapidly, she can sell them at markets and also from her home. Delia enjoys raising these animals and watching them grow. She takes good care of them and feeds them well so that she can increase their value per pound and thereby increase her earnings. Feeding the guinea pigs is a very delicate matter, as if one does not take care to provide adequate feed they tend to die rapidly.

This is Delia's fifth loan with Kiva's partner MFP and she has not had problems with repayment. With this loan she will buy pure-bred guinea pigs to improve the quality of her animals and raise their value.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pure-bred guinea pigs

loans.name: Maxim

texts.en: Maxim was born in 1971 and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is now settled in the Fizuli region, in a Bala Bahmanli village. He is married and has two children. He started his taxi business five years ago and is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his car so he can keep his taxi running well and not lose any business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for a taxi business

loans.name: Delia Sabina

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Delia es viuda, tiene 64 años y 3 hijos, Delia compra y vende cuy, viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra cuy y también compra de las feriantes que le llevan a su domicilio, Delia vende los cuy en 3 presentaciones, vivo, beneficiado y ya preparado, dependiendo del pedido de sus clientes.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy.
Los sueños de Delia son que su salud se mejore, ampliar su negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Banco Comunal Buena Suerte (Communal Bank of Good Luck). She is a widow who is 64 years old and has three children. Delia buys and sells guinea pigs. She travels to the local markets where she buys guinea pig from the vendors and then takes it to her home to prepare. Delia sells the guinea pig in three different ways: live, as raw meat, or cooked, depending on what her clients request. Delia needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of guinea pig. Delia's dreams are that her health will improve, her business will grow, and she will be able to continue onward.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the sale of guinea pig

loans.name: Nasaazzi Jane Group

texts.en:
Jane is the leader of a four-member group. She is forty years old and divorced with eight children, aged between 3 and 22 years. Seven of her children go to school and the eldest is working. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She at times gets some assistance from her ex-husband. She resides in and rents a single-room house where she stays with nine people. They have neither electricity nor piped water at home. The family does get three meals a day.

Jane works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She sells charcoal in a Mengo market in one of the city suburbs. She works five days a week and buys charcoal from villages, which incurs extra transport costs. Jane pays a fee of 20000 per month as rent plus an operating license. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and to all categories of people, mainly on retail. Jane has been in this business for the last 13 years and a member of MCDT for four years. She is servicing her seventh loan, working all along with the same group mates. Before joining the charcoal business, Jane had a restaurant.

Jane is faced with the challenge of the rainy season, which hinders her customers ability to reach out to her and makes transportation of her merchandise difficult as roads become impassable. Her monthly expenses include rent for the business, her children's school fees, and feeding the family. She wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal and to pay school fees for her dependents. She aspires to buy a plot of land and sell only on wholesale.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Maahjabeen Aslam Group

texts.en:
"My name is Maahjabeen and I’m 45 years old. I own a two-room brick house in a city named Lahore, Pakistan and have been living in it with my family for the past 20 years. My husband's name is A. and he is a tailor by profession. He runs a small shop in the community. He has a good number of customers. He charges US$ 2 for simple stitching and US$ 3 for designer clothes. I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy another sewing machine for my husband’s tailoring center. "I am the group leader for some more women from my locality. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport. Shama baji wants a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop. Ishrat Bano baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones for her phone shop."

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is 50 years old. She is divorced, with four children. All her children go to school. She lives with her family at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. For the past 23 years, Ama has been baking bread for sale. In spite of the challenges, Ama is making business progress.

She says she gives best value for money by making sure that her food quality meets her customer’s expectation. But her sales have fallen because of lack of capital to buy raw materials. Ama says prices of commodities are rising, making it difficult to buy more raw materials to make enough bread to meet high daily demand. She says she bakes at most 550 loaves of bread in a day.

Ama needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood etc. She says assistance would be very welcome. Ama belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо  Хусейнова  1952 года рождения имеет  5 детей. Имеет среднее образование.  У нее есть не большой цех  для переработки хлопка. Ее клиенты, это люди, которые берут на  приданное своих детей, национальные матрасы из хлопка.  Она перерабатывает хлопок и сбивает по несколько раз что бы хлопок стал пышный и легкий, для матрасов.  Первый кредит получила в 2008 году, на покупки хлопка , так как у нее был большой заказ. Она благодарна Микроинвест и за поддержку от КИВА.
texts.en:
Zebiniso H. was born in 1952 and has 5 children. She graduated from high school. She has a small workshop for cotton processing. Her clients are people who purchase Tajik national mattresses for their children's dowry. She processes cotton and shakes it several times to make it full and light for the mattresses. She received her first loan to purchase cotton in 2008, because she had a large order. She thanks MicroInvest and Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Ruth Yeni

texts.es:
La socia es la Srta.YENI, ella vive en el barrio de santa Mónica, situada en la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Ella tiene 38 años  es soltera, no tiene hijos y alterna sus actividades personales con el negocio de venta de recuerdos al por mayor y menor en el barrio antiguo de San Agustín, esta a 2 cuadras de la plaza principal de la ciudad, zona turística, por lo que nuestra socia abrió su souvenir. Ella solicita el préstamo en razón de que requiere comprar algunas artesanías y decorar un poco más su tienda para hacerla más acogedora.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Yeni lives in the Santa Mónica neighborhood in the city of Cusco. She is 38, single, and has no children. She alternates her personal activities with her business activities. She sells mementos wholesale and retail in the old San Agustín neighborhood. She sells two blocks from the principal plaza in the city, which is a tourist zone. That is why she opened her shop there. She is asking for a loan to buy some handicrafts to decorate her store a little more. She wants to make the store cozier.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy decorations for her small souvenir shop

loans.name: Maroun

texts.en:
Maroun is a 59 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Maroun has owned a barber shop for eleven years. Maroun requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his shop like scissors, hairdryer, as well as his children school tuition. Maroun has been a microcredit client for nine years now and has always paid on time.  
His previous loans helped him improve his salon. Maroun is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is always aware new haircuts. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: Maroun will use the loan to purchase tools for his shop like scissors, hairdryer, as well as his children school tuition.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Ermelinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, ubicada en la ciudad de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 58 años, es conviviente y madre de 03 hijos, tiene estudios de educación secundaria incompleta, vive en el Barrio La Capilla.
 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años, es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal Cristo Blanco, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 compró golosinas como: caramelos, galletas, chocolates y yogurts para venderlos en su kiosco.

Actualmente solocita un préstamo de S/. 700.00 para poder invertir en su kiosco de venta de golosinas, comprara chocolates, galletas, caramelos, yogurts y gaseosas, además comprara frutas como: plátanos, naranjas, mandarinas y entre otros para su venta.

Su mayor sueño es poder seguir trabajando. A ella le gustan los ahorros, las reuniones de su Banco Comunal ya que se distrae mucho compartiendo con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Ermelinda belongs to the "White Christ" Communal Bank, located in the city of Juliaca, San Román Province, in the State of Puno. She is 58 years old, and lives with her partner and three children. She did not complete her secondary education. She lives in the La Capilla neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 7 years and is one of the founding members of the White Christ Communal Bank. With an initial loan of S/. 300.00 she purchased sweets such as caramels, cookies, chocolates and yogurt to sell at her kiosk. She is now requesting a loan of S./ 700.00 to invest in her kiosk. She will purchase chocolates, cookies, caramels, yogurt, and soft drinks, as well as fruit such as bananas, oranges and mandarins among others, to sell. Her greatest dream is to continue working. She likes saving and enjoys the meetings of her Communal Bank, because she has a good time sharing with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chocolates, cookies, caramels, and soft drinks, as well as fruit (bananas, oranges, mandarins)

loans.name: Korn

texts.en: Korn C., age 41, works as a construction builder with an income of $4 per day in Phnom Penh City. She is married and lives with four children who have all dropped out of school. They help their father who works as a construction foreman with an income of $6 per day. Because Chard wants to have a better standard of living, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike in order to enable her to have a business selling shacked-coconut juice. She thinks the expected business, in which she plans to invest both her loan and efforts, will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina A. is a food vender at Amissanu in Elmina. She has a small shed in which she sells. Regina has received primary education. She is married and has 5 dependants. Her husband is a teacher. Regina has been selling food since 2001. She is responsible for paying bills. Her loan will be used to buy more meat and foodstuffs to increase her food production and sales. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and help children to further their education.

loans.use: To buy more meat and food stuffs to increase her food production and sales.

loans.name: Placide

texts.en:
Placide K. is married and has two children, ages four and two. She lives with her family in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin, where she sells pans and plates for cooking.  She buys her products at the Ouando Market in Porto-Novo and in Cotonou, a large city about an hour away. Placide sells her goods along the road. 

She has already received a loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin. The loan helped her to expand the variety of her products. Before the loan, she had a smaller operation, selling mainly corn. 

Placide is seeking a second loan to start selling pagnes, beautifully colored Beninese fabrics, and to increase her stock of plates and pans.

loans.use: Plates and pans

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita F. is from Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married to Samson F.. The family is blessed with two children. Esterlita became a member of the Cooperative in October 2007. She has been enjoying her grocery store, which provides their income. 

She wants a loan to use as additional capital for her grocery store so seh can support her children's education and other financial needs. She started her business when she got married. She is thankful that Paglaum gives financial assistance that can support her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for grocery store

loans.name: Kyelema Eyeta Mudondo Petronia Group

texts.en: M. Petronia is thirty years old, the Cashier of her group. She is a married business lady blessed with three children all going to school and she looks after six dependents of whom four are schooling. M. Petronia deals with a retail shop business for thirteen years so far. She is requesting for the loan to purchase retail items such as salt, paraffin, match boxes, sugar, soap, etc selling mostly essentials. She is an active business woman who keeps on mobilizing women in her community for developmental ideas and her dream is to educate her children as in setting a better future for them.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as salt, paraffin, match boxes, sugar, soap, etc selling mostly essentials.

loans.name: Bestsi

texts.es: Betsi es una joven y dinámica mujer, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 21 años y se dedica a la venta de caldo de gallina, Juanes,  jugos y gaseosas, cuenta con el apoyo de su prima quien le ayuda en esta actividad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles que será utilizado para implementar su negocio como comprar mesas, sillas, vitrina, y productos que necesita para la venta en pequeño negocio. La meta de Betsi es  tener un restaurante y bien implementado.
texts.en:
Betsi is a young, dynamic lady, she lives in the town of Pucallpa, she is 21 years old and sells chicken soup, "Juanes", juices and pops. She is supported by her cousin who helps selling. She has been a member of "Banco Comunal "Jesús de Nazareth" for two years. Her first credit of 300 soles was invested in pops and now she needs a loan of 2000 soles to be spent on setting up her business buying tables, chairs, showcase, and products to be sold at her small business. It is Betsi's goal to own a well installed restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in setting up a restaurant.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn B. is from Pala-o Market, Iligan City. She is 44 years old. Jocelyn is single. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business vending a variety of fruits. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pala-o Market, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Full of hopes and aspirations in life is our featured entrepreneur. She is Ms. Adelina T., 29 years of age, a single mother and a resident of Barangay III, Tangub City. Together with her 3-year-old child, they face life together.

For her source of income, Adelina decided to open a sari-sari (variety) store four years ago and has been able to sustain it even through those crisis years. Now she is earning an average net income of not less than P5,000 a month which is of great help to her and to her family.

As a newly recognized member under the regular loan program of Paglaum MPC, Adelina is given the privilege of applying for an amount of P20,000 as her first loan. She will use it to add to the revolving capital of her existing sari-sari store business.

Adelina is so very thankful for the programs and services offered, especially our savings program.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en: Anatalia M. is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Anatalia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month. In 2005, Anatalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Anatalia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Florie

texts.en:
Florie M. is from the village of San Carlos, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Florie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Florie has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Florie joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

texts.es:
En una pequeña Comunidad llamada El Mezón Municipio de Ayutla de los Libres, dentro de la Costa Chica del Guerrero, vive la señora Luvia G. M. tiene 29 años, es legitima de la comunidad mencionada. 
La señora Luvia se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de comidas y cenas en su casa y en pequeña escala, tiene intenciones a través de los créditos de superar sus ventas y esforzarse por quedar bien y seguir trabajando con los créditos, para poder hacer crecer su negocio, ya que tiene 3 hijos de 11, 12 y 14 años de edad, en la vida ha luchado con todas sus fuerzas para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos en su educación ya que es madre soltera, comenta que es muy difícil la situación económica, pero gracias a las empresas de créditos como Fundación Realidad puede trabajar su pequeño negocio y espera que pueda hacerlo crecer.
Por decidieron formar un grupo de crédito donde están incluidas las siguientes personas:

texts.en:
Sra. Luvia G. M. lives in a small community called El Mezón in the municipality of Ayutla de los Libres, in the Costa Chica ("small coast") of Guerrero. She is 29 years old, and a legitimate native of the community mentioned. For five years, Sra. Luvia has been selling lunches and dinners in her house on a small scale. Through the loans, she intends to exceed her sales and make an effort to be well and continue working with the loans in order to be able to grow her business. She has 3 children, 11, 12, and 14 years old and in her life she has fought with all of her strength in order to be able to get ahead for her children in their education. Since she is a single mother, she comments that the economic situation is very difficult, but thanks to the loan companies such as Fundación Realidad, she can work her small business and she hopes to be able to make it grow. They decided to form a loan group that includes the following individuals: Group Member's Name Loan Business Livia G. M. 3,000 Food sales Mayuribel B. M. 2,000 Perfumes and cosmetic sales Juan L. V. 5,000 Clothing sales Patricia Martínez G. 4,000 Sweets sales Juana García S. 5,000 Grocery store Estela M. P. 2,000 Cheese sales
